_comment_: I have add combine type  like most that have to be on medication when I start doing well I don't think I need it anymore. With Adderall I have been able to adjust my dosage as needed with dr approval of course but somedays I don't need to full amount. with add I feel like my brain is misfiring like with a car. With Adderall I feel its firing in the right direction atleast so I have the ability to function on all my cylinders if I need to. I don't want to switch to a different medication this one works great with my body chemistry
Cant breathe

This drug has been a big help with my ADHD and negative moods.  I've been taking it for about 3 months and am now suffering from some of the side effects.  I become very tired a short time after taking my first dose and very run down.  I also find my self becoming mixed up and my memory also suffers.  I won't stop taking it because it does calm me down and allows me focus.  I take it when I am going to be in public.  At home I sometimes skip it just for a break and to bring back my mental clarity.

BEWARE!! This medicine is dangerous!! I was a 20mg of Addreal once a day for five years and it worked with no problems.  Within those five years I got pregnant and when off my meds during pregnancy. Two months After the birth of my last child  I re-started my medicine and for some reason it didn't help as it did before. So I self-Medicaid  and take another pill.... Long story short  I became  dependent on the medication and could not go without it. I very quickly became addicted and started taking more and more. My mood changed  I was very   Aggressive and mean always yelling at my family my children would be scared of me I would lose my temper very quickly. Also This lead to no sleep  not eating  I became too thin  my hair started to fall out and became very thin and stringy. My husband didn't know what to think  and I became someone I didn't even know. I almost got my children taken away and a divorce.... Mortal of the story it changed my life upside down and I had to stop taking it!!! I have been working with my doctors and now I'm on vyvanse along with depression medicine and it works great!! Not addicting at all and helps me get my daily tasks done  care for my family and I'm finally getting back to myself

I have suffered with ADD for the majority of my life. It was very hard to stay on task. I went years undiagnosed. Now I'm able to stay focused at work  sit and read a book without distraction  and accomplish tasks I start and actually finish.

Adderall has been the most effective for me. I take 30 mg a day and it is perfect to get through the work way with the necessary focus and attention. It has also helped with my frustration issues with staff. I now have the ability to think clearly before I speak  and that has been a welcome change for my coworkers and subordinate staff!

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: Until I was placed on this medication  I found myself falling asleep just two hours after having a 10 hour night's sleep. I could not stay awake. After several tests  I was placed on Adderall oral. Two pills a day. A strong one upon awakening  I believe it was time released. A smaller dosage around 2 or 3 pm. I had no trouble sleeping. In fact it truly improved my life. I no longer have insurance coverage and had to ween myself from the medication. The quoted cost for this med is at least $800 a month in Co. and just under $400 in Wy. I cannot afford the out of pocket cost. Now  I am sleeping 16 hours a day and sometimes still opt for a nap. As you can see  without this medication  I am sleeping my life away. I wish it was more affordable. I really miss it.

Taking twice a day but the second dose  even taken early afternoon  made it hard to get to sleep at night. Sometimes I would skip the second daily dose to get some sleep. it didn't seem to last very long. Maybe an hour or two as far as attention improvement. Causes continuous jaw clanching and movement.

My son was changed from Ritalin to Adderall at age 13. After a short while of being on Adderall he became very angry and defiant. We thought that since he was going through puberty & dealing with ADHD that he was just having a rough time dealing with the chemistry changing in his body. As time went on he became more aggressive threatening to stab his father with a butcher knife & constantly going up against his dad & peers at school. He distroyed things in his path & punched holes in the walls of our home  yelling & cursing when anyone rubbed him the wrong way. The slightest things would set him off into fits of rage. He took on multiple personalities one being very evil as if Satan's son. He was a Jeckyll & Hyde.  This went on for 4 years as the dosage was increased because of his high tolerance to Adderall. After being in support groups & reading up I discovered other we're experiencing these very same side affects. I demanded the doctor to take him off of it and since he's been off of it for 6 months now & almost instantly I got my sweet boy back. I read that Adderall was like taking crystal meth. This medicine needs to be removed from the market permanently in my opinion. He was in & out of the hospital 4 times in a 3 months time frame. Not once had the doctors ever try taking him off the Adderall. All they did was ginnea pig him pumping him full of antipsychotic meds. He ended up for the first time in his life getting in trouble with the police for assault on an officer  resisting arrest & interfering with police business. Adderall is a very dangerous medication. If you benefit from it without the bad side affects  then that is good. If not  I would not take this medication.
Lit

I started adderall in mid-2013. I felt I couldn't function w/out it even though my jaws were clenched more often than not. A few weeks ago I ended up in the ER with a blood pressure way too high and heart palpitations. The psychiatrist who prescribed this med for me had given me a 6 to 8 question survey for ADHD. THAT was the extent of her diagnosis. Never asked how my BP was or what other meds I was taking. I believe she is a source of adderall for students who attend university about a half-mile from her practice. She presents put together but I think she's missing a screw when it comes to being a smart and engaged psychiatrist.

My story is a tad different. I work online with addicts  so have a warning for parents.
I am very concerned about the popular misuse of this drug by students. It enhances focus for studying but is very addictive. Many drug addicts promote it to their peers  and also tell them what to add to improve the 'rush'.
Please - don't let your children use this unless it is vital and justified  such as for narcolepsy or ADHD. And  if your child is addicted  defiant and refusing rehab  please learn to help him or her via e.g. an online course for parents with addict children such as Parent CRAFT (cadenceonline.com). I know I might sound like a crazy lady  but this drug is being widely abused by students and too many health care professionals prescribe it without caring about consequences.
30 mg brand name only 30 dp other side does nothing  if anything make me ancious. I want to know who make the brand name not generic with all the fillers  and salt?

I have been taking Adderall for over about 17 years. Without this medication I would never have graduated high school  college  and be working on my second degree. Sometimes medication is the only option for those who try everything possible first. This drug is nothing to play with  it takes precise clock work  discipline and knowledge. You have to ensure you are keeping your body healthy when taking it. Yes  it does have side effects but yes it does work great for those who need this type of chemical balance. If you want to prevent the "rush" as some report  EAT first. Then  make sure you drink more than the minimum amount of water a day. I literally drink about 10 waters a day. Stay away from caffeine and make sure to NEVER take this med. at night unless you don't plan on sleeping  which is another thing to make sure you are getting enough of. A balanced diet  sleep  and overall life routine is important. I also wouldn't recommend you take it if you are going to a social event  because like me I'm not the socialist butterfly on it when I would normally talk an ear off. With proper care and balance this is the answer for most. It is my answer and I'm more than thankful I have gotten as far as I have and I am thankful for its creation. I hope this helps some and also to the mothers  when your child is on this med. it's best to leave them alone. They just want to focus and most likely won't want to eat. It's just how it made me and when they are "coming down" they will need something to pick them up..it's a horrible crash on the XR(extended release caps 8hr). I usually drink a soda or a coffee. Sometimes I will even take a 1/2 of my instant release(4 hr tabs) if I have school work still to help ease the crashing. Lots of water to prevent headaches and time the pills. I don't get the full 8 hours that some would  I'm about 4 hours and I begin to fade. My doctor has me prescribed 1 8hr cap in am(7am) and then by 12pm one 4hrtab  4pm one 4hrtab. single mom so long day

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: After trying several other stimulants to treat my excessive daytime sleepiness due to Narcolepsy  I was put on Adderall XR. It is the only one that seemed to help me stay awake during the day. The only problem I have with this Rx is that you build up a tolerance to it.

I've been on this medication since I was only 5 years old  I'm now 16. I started taking it because I couldn't focus/was very disruptive in Kindergarten. I stopped taking it when I was around 13/14 and went back on when I was 15. When I'm on the pill it really does help me focus  but sometimes I'm so focused that I get lost in what's happening around me. I can say that I'm more effective using it  but the side effects are terrible! Always feeling the need to throw up  not being able to eat  always dead tired by the end of the day  being unbelievably shaky and nervous for no reason  and it also links to depression. If you don't take the pill for a week or so it hits you hard
with out it i would never be able to complete any tasks.
It keeps me alive. Now I'm required to seek treatment from a shrink!  Why?  All I have is Medicare and $hrink$ wont use it.  I give up.  Help  please.

This amphetamine salt was a nightmare  I was prescribed it as a child and didn't know the side effects yet still ended up spitting it into the bush outside my house a majority of times because of how it impacted my thinking and cranked me out. This type of drug is completely last resort and I would recommend anyone think twice before taking it

I'm 42  wasn't diagnosed until last year with ADHD I tried Ritalin with no help  then was prescribed Adderall 10md 4 times a day and I haven't felt better.  I have bipolar  anxiety  depression  panic attack  and many back issues.  I couldn't figure out why I couldn't stay focused or I was in bed 24/7 until I started taking Adderal I actually out of my  I can focus on tasks and get thing done.  I'm thankful my psych dr finally figured out it.

I'm 52yrs old and taking 45mgs a day. I run 5 day's a week and never felt better. Cardio wise I'm in tip top shape  BP While on adderall at its peak is 125/82 pulse mid 70s (have BP machine at home)Pulse in morning when waking up 55-58 beats per minute(due to my running) BP 110/70..So for me after taking adderall in the morning about 2hrs after taking first dose it goes up slightly  but not alarming...So to answer peoples question about taking adderall AS YOU get older its all how you take care of yourself and Genetics  Coming from a family (on both sides) with no BP problems or heart conditions runs in my favor..Main thing eat right  keep your weight down and get active  Even a brisk walk 30 minutes a day will do the trick...

I tried 6 different ADHD medications that did not work before I started Adderall (diagnosed when I was 18). I wanted to avoid it if at all possible due to its stigma and popularity on the streets. I regret not trying it sooner because it works wonders for me! I am prescribed 30mg twice daily (i have severe ADHD) and it's really helpful. The reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because I do find if I take it for an extended period of time it becomes less effective  but when that happens i'll stop taking it for about a week or two and it will go back to working like a charm. I'm so glad I am prescribed it  every aspect of my life has improved since taking Adderall. it made my ADHD easier to manage  my social life better  my marks increased significantly  and helped basically every negative symptom that comes with having ADHD. One downside I will mention  it is very expensive.

My 7 year old daughter tried this for ADHD.  This was the 8th ADHD we have tried and by far the worst.  She could not sleep for 37 hours.  She was picking at her skin and couldn't settle down.  We only did it one day and will not do again.
Adderall helps me to stay focused which makes it easier to stay on task.

in the short term it leaves you with a ease and you can focuses more but it in long term effects you ability to interact with others it makes you think before you act....on every thing so before you say something you have to think what will happen after you say it what could be said in response and in the time its taking you to finger this out 30  40 min pass by and you look as if you are ignoring some one or not willing to engage in conversation so as long as you arnt on this long enough to keep these habits when you stop taking it then you are good or better yet if you start taking it at an older age you might be able to not take effect to this so to all you parents I recommend not giving your child this simply because they are a little hyper because it could "mess them up" in the long run

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: Narcolepsy type episodes after a concussion. 3rd shift worker in a job where I CANNOT doze off  and would doze off during the day  even after sleeping. Been on treatment for about 3 years. 20mg. 3x day. Has helped to where I can work and function in a normal way. Still have some moments  but try to take a day or so where I don't take any so don't get too used to it. Overall  gave me a life back.

Living with ocd & add is tough and this drug helps me immensely! I've been on 20mg's 2x per day for over 10 years. I have a very hard time without it and I'm grateful it's available to those of us who suffer from these types of disorders!

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: There are times when it seems to work. But much of the time I do not notice any difference at all. There have been times when I actually question if I am getting a placebo med and not actually receiving the real med? I know that sounds really crazy but one should not fall asleep after taking one 30mg and a half og one or 45mg. If anyone has experienced anything similAR I would like to hear their story. Just trying to keep my eyes open during the day. I no longer will attempt a trip 120 miles away by myself for fear of nodding off. I take 3 30mg tabs per day. 1 1/2 twice a day.

Female  64 and had attention help all life.
At college had some help but told to use a recorder for notes. I did well  but I knew I needed more. This medication was my answerer. I have taken it for so long at  the same dose amount and feel fine. I wish more doctors were available to help. Growing older  I feel there is a lot of information out there and doctors more up to date with the answers.
I cannot take this pill because it makes me feel jittery and I can't have it in the house because my mom is a recovering adderall addict

I just recently began getting treatment for my adhd. The first drug my psychologist prescribed me was  straterra  which is a non stimulant. I was suppose to take it 3 weeks but after 2 & 1/2 weeks I decided that was enough. I absolutely hated it ! It made me nauseated & constipated. It made me very tired  but I still couldn't sleep. It was not helping me concentrate and put me in a terrible mood. I went back to my psychiatrist and was prescribed adderall xr generic brand by Barr. It's amazing ! It's puts me in a great mood  I'm able to concentrate  and I'm not experiencing many side effects. Only thing I notice is it doesn't really last as long as it's suppose to. I work in a fast paced environment and I'm constantly running around dealing with patients which speeds up my metabolism and makes it wear off pretty fast. Also the first morning I took it I had to take 2 otc sleeping pills which I didn't feel until hours later. It's day 3 now and it was busy at work so it wore off fast. I got home and was ready to sleep  but here it is 2

I didn't find Adderall until I was halfway through college in my early 30's  it has been a God send! I don't have much of the hyperactivity but it simply allows me to concentrate on one thing at a time  something that I didn't know was even possible. I was drinking insane amounts of caffeine prior to starting which I found out was a way to self medicate. I don't take it everyday  only those that I need full concentration on items. The only drawbacks that I have found is I don't like eating after I take it  I grind my teeth and periodically have problems sleeping. Beyond that it is AWESOME!

So far so good!  It has been one week and a big bonus was my improved mood.  I was very cynical before I started taking Adderall.  But most importantly I am definitely more alert and my mind is sharper.  I am so glad that I was prescribed!

I have been on Adderall 20mg's for many years  and have not had any issues with it  except for forgetting to take it in the afternoon. My doctor took me off 20mg's three times a day  and knocked it down to twice a day  then down to once a day. Not that i am more active  and notice i become a bit out of it  of foggy in the afternoon  my doctor thought maybe the Adderall XR would be better  as i would only be taking it in the morning  but it would last all day.

After 18 months of realizing something was wrong - no concentration  lack of focus  depressive moods  sleeping disorders and overall funk  I broke down and saw a doctor. He prescribed 30mg twice a day. WOW what a difference. I am staying on task  getting things done  people have noticed the upswing in mood and activity. Worst side effect is the tingling in feet and hands but workable. Loss of appetite - so I force myself to munch on healthy snacks during day. DRINK LOTS OF WATER. Dry mouth and grinding teeth does happen. Overall 4.5 stars.

I have had the same experiences as just about every post in this blog. I was finally diagnosed as an adult with ADD in my late 40's. I have been on Strattera with little to no effect  Vyvanse and Adderall XR that didnt last through the day and now for the last 2 years have been on 40 mg of the regular Adderall  20 mg in a.m. 10 at noon and 10 at 4. However I found myself in a terrible slump last month  binge eating  anxiety attacks and all I wanted to do was sleep. Then one morning I accidentally took a double dose (40 mg).  Immediately my depression disappeared and I was able to get off my couch on the weekends and didn't dread going in to work.Since then I have been taking 30mg in the a.m. and 10-20mg in the afternoon. I have an appt. with my doc. in a few weeks to discuss this  but I was wondering if anyone else has had a similar experience and if so what did you do?

I am more focused and am able to complete my tasks from beginning to end without any interruptions. I have tried every ADHD medication out there and I am completely satisfied and relieved to be taking the correct medication and finally living a normal life...thank you Adderall!!

I have suffered from ADHD my whole life. after having 4 kids  I decided to try meds again to help my focus. As a stimulant  Adderall gave me intense panic attacks  anxiety  and insomnia. I also completely lost my sense of humor. I felt like the anxiety and stress offset any benefits of focus I might have had related to the drug and after a month I had to switch. I found Strattera which is a non-stimulant MUCH more effective.

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: Has changed my life significantly.  I'm able to stay awake and not plan my day around my next nap. I'm more productive and focused at work. I'm starting to think though that my body is getting used to it so am talking to my Dr. about taking "days off" or changing the dose during the day.  Definitely worth trying if you are struggling with abnormal sleep patterns.

Diagnosed with ADD last fall - this was the first med I tried.  Almost 30 minutes on the nose after I would take it  I would feel it kick in.  I would get really hyper (ironically) and feel that I was working faster  but I didn't feel like it really helped with my attention and focus.  And then when it would wear off  I would crash really hard.  It would feel like I was coming down with the flu

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_:
The generic brand matters! 
Generic Teva

I have long had bipolar2 disorder as well as ADHD.My severe and extensive depressive episodes made focusing on anything  especially reading impossible For 3 years now I have been taking 60 mg/day of Adderall and the benefits have been many .Especially excellent  is that it has had great effect of lifting my deep and debilitating depression.

Im 43 yrs old and just diagnosed with adhd  severe depression  anxiety disorder  and bipolar disorder. Had i been diagnosed with all these earlier in life things would have been much easier. But i was on the extended release  didnt work for me but the immediate release was a life saver. I was so bad i may have lost my job from being so unproductive. I have been hospitalized 3 times and was immediately taken off of it  i was on 20mg 3x a day. Once they got me correctly diagnosed  my doctor started me back on it at 10mg 2x day and im a different person. I say its a miracle drug for me. It can be addictive though  so you just need to be careful and takeas directed.

Totally changed my life  especially with regard to decision-making  overcoming self-imposed obstacles to  take positive action  and enhancing inter-personal relationships. I have received much positive feedback from friends and associates about changes which have occurred with no real conscious effort on my part. They just happened.
This medication has really worked for me!  I seem to be calmer and not as distracted.
I was diagnosed with ADD very late in life

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: Generics don't help my narcolepsy and ADHD. I was able to get adderall XR 10 years ago but why can't I get it prescribed now? I was on it was almost 2 years. It helped me finish and follow through quality of life chores such as getting a job. Now the generic does barely anything. I know chemistry changes but what is really the ingredient?
Godsend
Never last long enough  and you have too many crappy generics out there.

My mental focus is greatly improved. After using it for 3.5 yrs  I still find it effective. I was given this drug only after reserching it and being proactive. I was my only advocate. My life would have been very different if I had been properly diagnosed and treated.

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: I have had excessive daytime sleepiness since I was 12. I constantly feel exhausted and before Adderall  I longed to be able to take a nap (even if I slept 14 hours). That is what I looked forward to do. Sad. I asked my neurologist to let me try it and because he knows me (and my kooky  holistic  try NOT to take meds  gluten-free  sugar-free   organic diet-self) lol  he wrote the prescription. WOW!!!!! I have lost some weight  I have gotten VERY organized  I don't constantly think about when I will get to sleep. It takes about an hour for me to feel "awake"  and for me  it only lasts about 2-3 hours. So  I break the 30 mg Adderall in half and take half at 7am  half at 12pm and try not to take any more. [The more you take  the more quickly your body adjusts to it and it seems like it doesn't work anymore.]. I try to NOT take it as often as possible. It is good to take a day off/week. Ask your doctor if you could take "Nuvigil" for your day off Adderall. It is nice to be able to feel "normal" and not totally exhausted. Just try to take as little as possible. And  try to take "days off" if possible.

I found out later in life within last 2 years when I decided to go back to school. it has helped a lot with focus  being alert  and miminal side effects.
I wish I would have known when I was in grade school  think my life would have been a lot different.

I am on Aderall 30XR by TEVA (Generic) that I got from local Wallgreens. It is absolutely 100% WORTHLESS. Drowsy  fatigue  ZERO help with concentration  etc.. Seriously 100% garabage. I did A LOT of research (after I came home from picking up script) and found numerous complaints about TEVAs "fillers" etc  that they put into this drug!!!  WHY DOES THE FDA ALLOW SUCH BS?? These are used (and NEEDED) to help so many people with serious issues of ADHD - yet  they (Teva) is allowed to sell products with the FDAs blessing that the drug can be 20% LESS EFFECTIVE than the Brand Name??  ARE YOU SERIOUS?!?!  

If you are perscribed 30mg XR - DO YOURSELF A FAVOR and INSIST with your Dr. on getting the brand name (SHIRE) instead of this TEVA Generic GARBAGE!!  Cannot belive the FDA allows this (wonder how much they are getting paid to look the other way)!!!

TEVA ADERALL = GARBAGE! Save your money

I was prescribed 15 mg twice a day for depression-related fatigue. I have stuck to just taking it once a day...It helped for several months then the effectiveness wore off. I have been off of the med for at least a week and I'm considering going back to taking it maybe a few times a week  to see if it will work better that way and I don't build up a tolerance again. I do not want to end up on high doses of this addictive med.
I only wish I had found the proper treatment for my condition prior to adolescents.  Maybe I would have had an easier time getting through high school!
this medication worked so well for me....finally after years  doctors found I had ADD and prescribed adderalol.

I had to take 35mg of Adderall in the morning before school  and then 5mg when i got home so it would last me until i went to sleep... But ive noticed that after the Adderall wears off  i would get very aggravated and i would get frustrated quickly and also i would have panic attacks and body tremors due to them wearing off.
Adderall is definitely very helpful when I need to get something done. I do get a very dry mouth and sometimes it causes me to focus on the wrong things.

I could not believe that feeling of being able to concentrate could boost my self-esteem. My anxiety level has increased to some degree but but the pros out weight the cons. Ive been on this medicine for 12 years and developed a tolerance which  I now do not take everyday. It doesnt work the same for me as once in the beginning but it does helps my behavior. hopefully they can come out with a better type of Adderall. I get no side effects and no dependecy.

I am an adult male who was diagnosed this past summer.  I have been taking this for about 3 months at 5mg twice a day.  I haven't had a chance to check in with my physician  but the mess seem hit or miss.  When it works  I really feel I can actually be productive and successful. I wonder if when I talk to my doctor if we will look at other mess or increase my dosage.

My question for other reviewers is how extensive was the testing before you were diagnosed with ADHD? This is for adults in particular. My prescribing psychiatrist gave me a short list of statements to rate (maybe six to eight) and on that alone she prescribed what to me is a powerful drug. It's not as if she's an expert in this field. I'm beginning to think she's not a very good psychiatrists. Thoughts? Thanks.

This was a miracle drug for me. Before I started taking it  I was pretty much at wit's end. Finally was diagnosed with ADHD  after going through dozens of doctors. Immediately  it changed my world. 
I could actually focus  concentrate  and complete a task.Impossible before. I doubt I would have kept my job if I didnt start the med when I did. Pre-Adderal...anxiety  frustration  mind always going day or night  trouble having/holding conversation no concentration  constantly distracted  all making me very stressed  it was a horrible way to live. i started at 10mg twicw a day  increasing slowly over the next 4-5 mons..until now  currently at max dose of 20mg  3 times a day.My med dr actually wanted to increase to 80 mg per day  but there was an issue with insurance that was being worked out. It worked great and consistantly at each dosage  but eventually after few weeks to maybe month and half i notice my symptoms coming back. Watch for side effects- i am very active  but there was pretty quick weight loss. i think i am at 30-40 lbs lost in 4 months  im working up to 70 hrs a week  on this med 16 hr days are no prob. also i had no appetite  my mind has slowed quite a bit  i now seem to have aggressive tendecies  recently constant anger  paranoia. im like a different person. i also take with effexor  the combination was so great until recently. while it is helping in so many ways the changes have not been a problem until recently.

My son just started a few months ago on Adderall 15mg  before he his doctor tried many other drugs but nothing seemed to work. Since he has been on this medication he can stay focused at school and home. His sleeping is fine  the only problem is getting him to eat!! But I found pedia sure helps him balance a healthier diet.
I was diagnosed with Adult ADD at age fifty.  Adderall is an important part of my treatment regimen which includes cognitive therapies  a healthy diet and lots of exercise.

I started taking Adderall for my ADD. The doctors started me on 20mg long release capsules to start off with. The first week few weeks of taking it I noticed an increase in confidence and energy. It helped my in school tremendously. While I was taking it  I felt incredible. After the second week I began to develop a tolerance for it. I began to feel unmotivated  angry  and depressed without it. I began to crave more and more of it until I couldn't function without it. When my superscription was empty  I had to force myself to not refill it. I knew that if I continued to use it it would only make my life harder. I told my doctor that this drug is not for me. Adderall is highly addictive and I do not recommend it.
I have experienced memory problems and dental issues while taking this medication.  My mood is great and I can get tasks completed at home. However  at work I still have a hard time concentrating.

I have been taking generic adderall for 3-4yrs. Like many other reviewers  I have experienced irritating jaw clenching when the drug wears off.  I have done my homework and found that with certain generic manufacturers this happens and others not.  Most pharmaceies in my area carry TEVA manufacturer (also M'ckROOT)  which I DO get clenching with this. CORE PHARMACEUTICALS is the one that I do NOT get grinding and glenching with. Find a pharmacy that can order this or can stock it.
It caused paranoid thoughts  inability to focus  emptiness  . I threw it in the toilet. I think it's poison.

I am a Cancer patient and the medications I take to keep me free of Cancer also make me very tired. My oncologist recommended Adderall for the times when I think I may need it. For example  when I know I am going out for the night  I take 5 mg to basically stay awake and enjoy the party  dinner  show  etc.. Main problem is taking it too late (after 2pm) it's hard to fall asleep when I do get home so I found 3-5mg of Melatonin helps. I don't go out very often so 1 prescription can last for months.

I am ADD b4 Adderall I would put off just about everything until the last moment. My life so busy  yet never seemed to accomplish anything day in and day out.Start something then see something else needing done as I am doing the first thing I started  next thing I knew I had many things started and nothing completed. I didn't seem to ever have a lot of energy/felt tired and moody. My then doctor said I was depressed. He tried several different antidepres.(not all at once).  Nothing worked  I don't like taking pills or anything really so I wasn't taking something that had no benefit in/to me. ADD & ADHD runs on both sides of my family  I knew I was ADD guess I thought I knew how to live with it  I had this far. Long story short I ended up getting prescribed Adderall started a 5mg 3X's day ended at 20mg 3X's day  have been taking this dose for many years and has changed my life for the positive. I start & finish what I start  I don't put anything off til the last minute  I have the desire/energy to get'er done  my moodiness "depression"-Gone. I feel like a productive adult! Now years later I drive a commercial bus; DOT Phys/Cert and Random DT'ing so Adderall has become a pain for me in this respect as DT's come back + and this new DOT Cert. Co requires I get DOT re-cert every 1yr instead of every 2yrs + proof of script to me from my phys. every year..really non-since on their part. I am sure I couldn't be a com. driver if a didn't take this script  I am a better and safer driver taking it. I would stop taking if it didn't make such a positive impact in my life. Cons
It's that addy daddy. That zing a ling pow. Got you hooked like a catfish on a trotline.
worked for the purpose  however  created a positive for meth amphetamines with my body chemistry during a drug screening. rare but it happens I am told. inconvenient at the time.
Was able to stay focused and get more things done

I was severely addicted to cocaine and was using it to gain an edge witch led to paranoia and ear nose and throat problems.I finally got professional help..went into a rehab to stop.After 28 day program I was referred to an after care program which included Adderall 30mg/day and Cymbalta.This combination of drugs has helped me to stay off illicit drugs and renewed my life and job.
I know I am still addicted..but have worked to take less and less.I am now on only 10mg and still on Cymbalta..It has proved to be a life saver for me..Many people have been put on the same cocktail but tend to abuse the adderral..to get the same feeling that coke gives you and that's a problem for many.I don't take these drugs to get high but to stay normal..to me it's way safer and a lot less costly

My self esteem is much better  it also took care of my anxiety & depression  It calms me down & as I like to say  it helps me think like an adult.

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: This medication has been a life saver for me!!! For years  I was diagnosed with Chronic depression since I slept so much  18 hours at a time at times... With a daily dose of IR 30 mg  I have my life back!!! I'm happier  my body hurts less (from not sleeping my life away)  alert  able to function in day to day activities  chores & more than anything the relationship with my Husband & children has improved 100%  since Mommy isn't 'sleeping' all of the time. I highly recommend seeing a sleep specialist if you have excessive day time sleepiness.

This medication has worked wonders for me & has helped me focus & get thing done thus leading me to lead a normal life which I could not do before! The only negative effect it has is excessive sweating & I mean EXCESSIVE! My face litter all has sweat dripping off off it & I even sweat so bad my had get really wet! Other than this annoyance it would be hard to live day to day with out it!!!!

I was on Strattera for about 5 years and switching to adderall has been one of the best decisions i've made. Adderall is essentially like taking 10 red bulls. It can work for longer periods  but the biggest bonus is the quality of work that I can produce. The reason being  adderall gives me the ability to be able to be much more focused on the material and as a result  I retain it better. There is a downside however. If taken too late in the day  it can keep you awake and sometimes you can feel a bit overstimulated. Another thing to watch for may be a slight change in behaviour. I had family members that hadn't seen me in several months tell me that I seemed too stimulated during regular conversation. In terms of dosage  I personally found 20mg to be more than enough but this varies from person to person. Overall my experience has been great  it has helped me bridge that gap that has kept me from performing like the rest of the students in my classes.

I was only using 10 mg for about 3 yrs. it was just enough to help me be more focused  even out my emotions and have more sustainable energy. As long as I was excersizing regularly  eating healthy and getting the sleep my body needed  I never felt I needed more than 10 mg. Once I started to slack in my healthy eating and regular excersize  I started to become more sluggish and unfocused and eventually jumped up to 15mg. I don't love how it makes me feel. After 6 months of the 15mg I felt I could use more but decided that I was not going to fall victim so once again  I have been getting back on track with my eating and excersize and have lost 5 pds  and already feel so much better. I do not crave more Adderall so by continuing good healthy habits  i'll see if I need to adjust back to 10 mg or stay on the 15 mg. I've learned that Adderall is not a substitute for unhealthy habits.

My anti-depressant medication does not work as well when I don't take my adderall. I spend so much time starting new projects that I seldom finish one which is very frustrating. It also affects how well I learn new things  without adderall I have a hard time concentrating and learning.
I am having problems with my teeth and gums. Is this related
helps me comcentratate on task at hand . i do not get distracted and can focus on what i am trying to learn

I have been taking adderall xr for almost 3 years now.
It has changed my life for the better.
I am a 35 year old female who my parents didn't believe in me taking drugs like this as a child.I knew I had issues in high school 
and I know for a fact had I been on this medication I would have done better in school
and would have cared about going to college.
I finally did something for myself when I turned 30 and went to a psychiatrist. It took a few different medications(concerta/vyvanse) before my Dr put me on Adderall. One made me so dizzy and one made my heart race. 
I can see getting addicted  but I knew with the way I live my life  I wouldn't have to worry.  
I had major issues staying focused and awake no matter how much sleep I would get. I would get bored easily or start a dozen different tasks and not get one completed. I had no time management.
I started with 20mg and I take it in the am when I wake up at 6 am. It makes me want to do my job and not get stressed. I am much more
organized. It keeps my life on track.
I started getting headaches about 3 months in and just really tired again by 3 pm. When I went to my dr for a check up she decided to
try a half of a 20mg of plain adderall at 2pm.
It did the trick and I've been on this combination ever since and haven't had to change anything.
I go to bed by 10
my son started to hear and see things he was on 20ml er I stopped his medicatiom and the hearing and seeing things stopped
taking multiple psych meds leaving me semi comatose. Drug has relieved fatigue  restored most of my focus and added a touch of energy.

When I lost a significant amount of weight (due to health changes - NOT the medication)  my Dr. thought it might be best to alter my medication system  and for the next year my dose and brand was shuffled around  as a result every pharmacist in town thinks I am some cartel drug dealer. But once on the right dose for your body  Adderall is incredible for those with Attention Deficit. It will not cause shakiness or nervousness. It will have a calming effect while in your system. I can generally think much more clearly and am able to multi-task. If you need Adderall  it will work for you and you will NOT have the same reaction to it as someone taking speed. I am a 54 year old male. I did not put two and two together when ADHD first came to light. It did not take long to realize the connection between ADHD and my younger days. I new years ago when ADHD was medically proven and legitimized (for lack of a better description) that it was my problem. I had learned to deal with it by working harder and longer than others would have to for the same results. I would accomplish what I needed to but where others would do it in an 8 hour work day  I would take it home and spend another 2 to 3 hours to accomplish the same amount of work to have it available at the same time as everyone else. A typical 8 hour day for anyone else was a 10 to 12 hour day for me. (this also helped me understand as an intelligent person the struggles in high school). This system worked for me as I progressed in my career until my latest and highest level management position. It didn't take long for me to realize I had progressed professionally beyond my ability to overcome my focus problems using the system that had gotten me by to this point to overcome the issue. The difference after Adderall has been profound  I have no doubt that had I not discussed the problem with my doctor and began taking Adderall I would have lost the position I now hold. This is coming from someone who at 54 years old was on no prescription medication for anything and proud of that accomplishment.
Had I only known how good it was is taking it 30 yrs ago

Around that time I was like a little tweeker rollin all the time  mind going 1000 mph irritability insomnia just plain weird feelings thoughts and emotions I guess the onset of amphetamine psychosis. I wanted to quit I had really bad tick it could have been from the other meds to counter act the side effects of other meds side effects caused by other meds and it was the most annoying thing. Everything in me said quit this s#! but an addict for 11 years yea right. once i turned 18 i smoked weed everyday quit the crap and live a wonderful life thanks to nature.

Please practice extreme caution when using this drug.  The first time I used it I became hooked and went to the doctor to get a prescription right away.  It was not long after that I developed a dependence that turned into an addiction  and an inability to do anything while off of the drug.  I started at 20 mg  and three years later  have to take 40-60mg to get the same effects  but the side effects are completely dreadful....intense mood swings  depression  insomnia  etc.  I just did not feel like myself  but it was still so hard to stop taking the drug.  I still take it once in a while because I have a rigorous class schedule and studying without it is almost impossible.  I am definitely a different person when I'm on it and feel that it has brought more negative than positive experiences into my life. Although not all people will have negative experiences and/or become addicted  this drug can ruin your life.

_comment_: I use it when I have trouble sleeping and pain I find this drug  takes care of both my problems

When I researched Adderrall  the description of us who are prescribed it FIT ME TO A TEE. I now have so many answers to WHY I have behaved like I have ALL MY LIFE. My first episodes were in 4th grade. At 50+ years young I had no idea that I was "not normal". BUT it's ok. There were some adjustments that I had to make for the first couple months  but I trust my Doc. and after 14+ months of taking Amph salts I have discovered and accepted so many life changing traits/behaviors. Don't expect everyone to understand...you have to be here to know or be very trained as is my doctor. Many pharmacy personnel here in Florida have been very rude and upsetting when I fill my script every month. Mom and Pop type pharmacies have treated me very well  like they should! Listen to me  I have been to 15 to 18 PHARMACIES IN ONE DAY AT THE WALGREENS/TARGETS/CVS GOING HOME WITH NOTHING! I understand that inventories run out but the above mentioned pharmacies made me feel like a criminal 75% of the time. Please give your local Mom and Pops a chance  they are honestly hungry to serve you  NOT LIKE THE BIG CHAINS. Too bad I did not grow up around great doctors back in Oklahoma(my guess is great doctors don't want to live in dirty  ugly Okieville;sorry but it's true)  I could have had a second bite at life's apple years earlier by growing up around understanding doctors. I now recognize reasons for past failures/behaviors and can see what to change. Adderrall is not a cure just an equalizer and when without it the old actions/behaviors return. Man I had a rough start by my situation being born but it's ok. Don't believe most everyone that says you are LAZY OR CRAZY...IT'S NOT TRUE. I just didn't know I that I was lacking attention. Thank you and God Bless you all.
life changing
Improved ability to concentrate

I was recently prescribed Adderall for low energy/fatigue associated with depression. I'm a Cancer patient; My Oncologists give Me many  many Medications. They've never actually put it into words  but for those going through Radiation  Chemo/Brachytherapy...They give You the Medication that You need/want  to even bother getting out of the Bed the next Day. I have used all of the Amphetamines  except the legendary Desoxyn...as well as the "Phenidates". I'm Prescribed 15mgs upon waking up  and 15mgs at 2 in the Afternoon. It totally helps Me..."be ME again"..I'm able to Use this as an actual Aid in My life. I of course have to take many other Narcotics; Opiates for pain  and Barbiturates or Benzodiazepines for horrible anxiety and panic...I feel sometimes when the thought of Death enters My mind  if I'm nothing but a Humanoid Guinea pig for "BIG PHARMA" in the end...Oh well. The World keeps spinning. Adderall had helped Me see things in a different light; able to find new perspectives. I started (after several Visits) on the XR 30mgs  but I couldn't stand that I couldn't control how long the Amphetamine effected My body. So I have the Dose split  and back to the controllable 15mg tablets  BID.

Adderall helps me stay focused while keeping my mind at ease. Vyvanse is sometimes too harsh for my body and leaves my stomach in knots  gives me headaches  and dehydrates me. I recently started to have some stomach pains with Adderall though.

_comment_: Diagnosed with narcolepsy about 6 years ago- excessive sleepiness  all the time! It was hard to find the right dosing schedule to control my symptoms  and my Dr. and I still make adjustments as needed. Hardest thing was to remember when to take my doses (6am  9

If you truly need this medication and are on the correct dosage  it will not cause shakiness or nervousness. It will have a calming effect while in your system. You will think more clearly and be able to multi-task. I've seen comments saying this is no different than meth or crack. That is inaccurate. If you need Adderall  it will work for you and you DO NOT have the same reaction to it as someone taking speed. If you feel this way and have been diagnosed with ADHD your dose maybe too high or you might be a good candidate for the XR version. My husband's metabolism is too fast for extended release. He takes two doses a day to keep his level stable. This medication actually slows him in a sense. He is still very active but can focus and accomplish tasks effectively.

My doctor treated me with the usual anti-depressants - Prozac  Paxil  Lexapro  Klonopin  etc for depression  confusion  lack of self worth  crying.  Finally  my Pain Management doctor  who maintains my drug infusion pump gave me a prescription for Adderall XR.  I immediately noticed an improvement in my mental state.  I had more energy  felt more stable  better concentration  even more able to deal with my chronic pain.  I started on 10 Mg daily and increased over time.  I am now on 40 mg XR daily.  I am certain that I could use another increase  but I prefer stay as low as possible for as long as possible.  I will say that this has been the absolute best medication I have ever been on and the only one that dealt effectively with my depression.  I have never been able to deal with life in such a positive  focused  and calm manner.  I hope I never have to stop taking this medication.  Even my Psychiatrist has noticed the difference in me and he recommends that I continue on this medication.  He said he is willing to prescribe it for me if there should ever be a reason I stop requiring the services of the doctor who prescribes it for me now.  I have been under treatment with the same psychiatrist for 12 years and he agrees that this medicine has been the best prescription for improving my depression and dealing with other very complicated issues in my life.  So  for right now  he says continue the good work and he is very pleased that I have found the correct medication. Over the course of therapy  I have gone from 6 different medications a day down to 2.  I also still take .05 Klonopin at night  if necessary  for anxiety.  I am happy to say that I have never felt better.  I do realize this is an addictive drug  however  it is also a necessary drug for some people and I am one of them.

Began taking 20mg three times a day 2 1/2 years ago. I am 23 and have been off medication for 5 months. Adderall at this dosage increased my heart rate  decreased my appetite  and increased focus. Tasks in school were easy  studying was efficient and listening was second nature. Difficulties lied with eating. In order for me to enjoy a meal  I would need to stay off the med for at least 2 days. After being off the drug for 5 months  I have had better success in  school (no failing grades) and better appetite. However  social skills became worse  reading became difficult  getting a firm grasp of ideas became non existent  confidence decreased  sex drive decreased and wellness decreased. While the benefits outweigh the negatives  the moral aspect of the medication became important. Therefore after serious thought  some kind of ADD med should be taken. This could be a mixture of adderall (for stimulation) with strattera to fill in the gaps.

I feel like a full blown drug addict all over again. how do I get off this drug without feeling angry  tired to the point of wanting to sleep 15 hours a day  migrane headaches and overall coming down depressed feeling. its a great drug for my adhd and my life but I can't have it. I always need more.

I have had ADHD since I was a child  although never medicated or treated for it.  I am on the lowest dose you can get  5 mg  and I take it as needed only because it tends to cause some stomach issues such as upper abdominal pain  painful gas  and slight nausea.. But.. This drug has helped me to focus  complete household tasks  I find myself felling happy on it and I don't need a nap.. I usually split my 5 mg into halves and take in morning and afternoon...if it didn't upset my stomach I would take it more often..amazing medication!
Extremely effective for the issues that I were suffering from.

I was finally diagnosed about twp years ago by a Psychiatrist. He had noticed  during my sessions with him that I would jump from on subject to another  and never really finish discussing one issue before skipping to something I needed to talk about. He asked me if I had ever been tested for ADHD and I said  "No  but years earlier another doctor thought I should  but I just really didn't understand what could be done to help me focus; and truly thought that there's no way a medicine could help me stay focused on one task at a time. Since several years had passed by now  I decided to take the ADHD assessment test  and the results were that I'm ADHD  and that's when he started me on the Adderall 10mg twice daily  but the ended up raising the dosage to 20mg twice daily. I notice a complete difference in my ability to pay attention and to complete a task at work instead of having so many different things going on at once  but not following through well with any of the. I am much more calm;not figity.  It has helped my work performance and personal relationships.

I have taken this drug for a few years  and the only apparent notice side effects I have had are rapid heart beat  hyper talkative (when I am around people).  About a year ago  I noticed that I was having mild to moderate facial ticks (rapid blinking  nose tick gestures)  etc.  I have know for many years that I have a very mild case of Tourette's Syndrome  but for some reason  the Adderall seems to have brought out those symptoms after two years  and not sure why this is happening.  When taking Adderall  I feel normal  active  hopeful and at my full potential -- and I have incredible focus at work.  When I don't take Adderall  I feel just the opposite; lethargic  depressed  and kind of generally overwhelmed with life.  My question is this  has any one else out there that also has Tourette's Syndrome  found a good remedy for this.  A combination drug with Adderall?  A smaller dosage of Adderall?  Currently  I take a 30mg generic  and it is called "Amphetamine Salts ER 30 mg Cap"  manufactured by Teva/Barr.  I really hate to quit taking this  but near the end of the half life of the dose  the tourrette's syndrome symptoms are getting to the point where it is almost not worth taking.  Any feedback or input would be helpful and beneficial.
Fine
Helps you reach your full potential!

Adderall worked great for the first year I was on it  then it turned on me.  This is a serious medication with serious side effects   I am shocked and disgusted that any parent would put a young child on such a strong drug for their "ADD."  I began with 20mg a day and had amazing grades while working full time as a bartender  I honestly felt like every time I popped one of these I got a little "high" from it and euphoric.  It made me impulsive  impatient  obsessive compulsive  and sometimes anti-social.  I wasn't aware how much this drug changed my personality until the third year I was on it.  I was fully addicted taking only 30 mg at the most in a day  but when the pills went on back order I realized how bad withdrawal sucked from it.  I couldn't leave my bed or do the simplest tasks without popping an adderall for the day.  I also became paranoid  and sometimes would hear things that weren't there  that's when I knew this drug was messing my head up.  I quit taking adderall and it took a good 6 months for me to regain my natural energy. I'm back to my normal  social  happy self.  I think adderall causes serious problems with your body  as I had heart palpitations  poor circulation  weight loss  chest pains  extreme insomnia  and mental instability while on this drug.  PARENTS PLEASE DO NOT PUT YOUR CHILDREN ON THIS DRUG unless you want them to grow up to be full blown drug addicts who resent you for introducing them to what seems to be legal coke or speed.
My initial reaction was extremely positive with noticeable improvement with focus and productivity. The medication still provides positive effects but to some extent the benefits have plateaued.

I have been on ADD/ADHD medication since I was 7 years old. However  I did not take Adderall until I was 19 years old & it was the right ADD medicine for me. I had tried Concerta during high school & it made me like a zombie. That didn't mean I didn't have ADD/ADHD it just meant I was on the wrong medication. It can be vice versa for other people but my best advice I can give for finding the right ADD medication is you have found the right one if you still feel like yourself. If you are overly hyper or overly inactive  I highly recommend trying a different medication until you find one that you can't tell a big difference in your personality  but makes a big difference in your day.

I came to this site today to review opinions between "Brand" and generic Adderrall and thought I should add my personal experience with this medication.

I was diagnosed with depression 14 years ago and was prescribed Paxil. After six months of little change in my condition  I was prescribed Prozac and Xanax. Over the next few years  my conditioned worsened. I was eventually prescribed Ambien for insomnia  which was a huge mistake.

I became addicted to Ambien  not for the sleep benefits but for the Utopian feeling it provided me. I would take it several times during the day  and quickly began running out of my prescriptions. This led to "Doc Shopping " and eventually I had three doctors writing me scripts every month.

Long story short
It helps me focus but also make me anxious and never hungry. I also feel that it may be   having a depression side effect on me after my 10+ years of use.
Use it for ADD & has definitely helped me focus better at work & with every day tasks.

I was on Adderall for three years for ADD (non hyperactive) and it worked great for focus and attention. Increased my blood pressure slightly  but I had low BP to begin with  so this was not an issue. The drawbacks were increased anxiety (worsened with time)  muscle tensions (again  became worse with time)  and for lack of a better term  impatience (I tended to be "short" with people on this/ snap at people more often than normal). Overall  I would recommend it for ADD/ ADHD

Wonder drug ! I wish I had it when I was in school. I was labeled as a problem kid. Lazy   always  in trouble. In the remedial classes in most subjects. Could not pay attention to things that were not interesting to me. Age 44 is when I was given my first dose of adderall. My kids were taking it for ADD. My doctor was treating me with anti depressants with no real results. He gave me a simple test to take in his office. Switched me to adderall to see if things in my life improved. With in just a few days I noticed Hugh improvements in my life. I was able to do things that I could never do before. Like understanding what I had just read  being able to focus on things that were always a challenge to me so I avoided them. I could understand new concepts and enjoyed learning for the first time in my life. Before I struggled with following basic instructions and would get frustrated and just give up.  For me it was a new life that I could enjoy and be present and be part of things I was scared to get involved in. For fear that others would think I was slow or challenged. Adderall change my whole life for the better. I wonder where I would be today if I had been given this drug in my early school years. I own a very successfully catering business and I'm happy with my life. I will always wonder what I could have accomplished if I was given the right treatment when I was in school.
been on it 1 week for severe untreatable depression.  has been working great.

I have been on Adderall for about 2 years nows due to a decrease in mental ability to what I call"  Mentally Keep Up".  As a nurse working nights on a very busy floor that I truly Love & Self Employed Auto Dealership    I became more & more scatter brained & stressed due to the inability to stay focused.  Adderall has made life so much better  in that I can focus & get things done as I once did with out all the stress & un organized state of mind.  It has not caused me to have weight loss  infact I have gained & maintain with difficulty to loose weight.  I sleep well when I do sleep & it is just such a miracle drug for me.  I notice when I have taken vacations from it   I can not think for myself & I can NOT stay still long enough  when trying to sit at my desk to get work done.   I am very concerned about the ability to get COMPLETELY off this drug & function as I should.  Haven't got that far yet but will surely let you know when or if I do.   Important need of Adderral for me is that is slows me down MENTALLY so that I can properly function & think as I should in orders to focus & concentrate on very important & large amounts of work.  I was told by my doctor I was a TRUE canidate for this drug & I must agree.  I have Never been on any medication in my life.  This is the first & I am 51 years old.

I started adderall 1yr ago and it has changed my life.I take 40 mgs daily.I was in bed and in my home going nowhere I suffer from depression and anxiety and chronic pain also ADD Ihave been on pain meds anxiety and depression meds also I found out thru taking adderal i am normal Ican focus and follow thru with things I go out into the real world. My doctor put me on this medication about a year and a half ago. In the beginning it had improved my attention span majorly  and I was able to concentrate for much longer periods of time without letting my thoughts distract me. I started noticing that after taking it for awhile it was not working as well as it did at first because I was becoming more tolerant to it  this meant I had to increase my dose. I try to give myself a "medication vacation" at least one day a week  usually a lazy day  but i noticed now when i dont take it  I literally cannot function well at all  all I want to do is lay in bed all day. This medication has also caused me to lose over 50 pounds in about 10 months because my appetite decreased so much from it. Now I am down to about 105 pounds and I am a 23 year old female about 5'5"  so this is defintely not a healthy weight for me. So I would say this medication definitely has its pros and cons. I guess it depends on the person.

This drug has allowed me function more normally.  I am much more focused  and able to concentrate on what people are saying.  In addition to intellectual improvement  it has improved my atheletic performances!!  It allows me to better concentrate and assimulate what the coaches are saying to me.  Then  while I am doing an atheletic activity  I am better able to concentrate on what I am doing without my mind wondering.  

Also  I seem to be much better at focusing on multiple body parts at the same time.  It use to be that if I focused on what my arms were doing  I would skrew up with my legs and vice-versa.  Now I seem to be able to think about what I am doing with my arms  legs  shoulders etc etc all at the same time.  I feel so much better coordinated.

i have used this for years (childhood to adulthood) have tried other drugs but none worked as well. it allows me to "level out" and retain my focus and concentration so that i can function in my day to day life. without it i become so overwhelmed by "butterfly" moments that i just cant do and accomplish ANYTHING. my only complaint would b that it doesnt last as long as it should which requires me to take more during the day and every month its hard to find a pharmacy thats able to fill the full amount.

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day

_comment_: Taking Adderall (generic)10mg 2st month and 20 mg 2nd month I begain losing my hair and my eyelashes were falling out (quite noticeable).  I stopped using it for a a couple of months (in between used ritalin [generic not as effective with focus and concentration] and my eyelashes grew back and my hair was not back to where it was before I started taking aderall but it stopped thinning  I was having nightmares and evil dreams  my eyes were so dried that I would wake up in pain in the middle of the night and have to put eye drops in  constipation  and racing thoughts.  I started taking the NAME BRAND Adderall a few months afterwards because I thought maybe the side effects were from the fillers because I am very sensitive to some medications.  I was able to concentrate and focus and become a normal person but again  slowly but surely  my eyelashes started to fall out and my eyes were dry but not as bad as on the generic brand--the dry eyes I could have tolerated  but I had to stop the Adderall or lose my hair on my head and eyelashes. Aside from the hair loss  I would have stayed on the NAME BRAND Adderall.  It was like I had chemotherapy and my hair was falling out.

While I was initially skeptical of taking this medication because of my professional life (I'm an active-duty commissioned officer in the United States Air Force) I must admit that this mdication has changed my life. Not only was this medication life-changing  it only took hours for me to realize the bennifits of the treatment in terms of subsidence of my ADHD symptoms. While others have experienced problems with Adderall and its generic forms  I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND anyone suffering with serious  life-altering ADHD symptoms (as I was) consult your primary care physican or mental health care provider and see if this is an option for you. Believe me  I understand the challenges associated with both the stigma associated with ADHD generally and this medication specifically  but I promise that if this treatment is as effective for you as it was for me you'll kick yourself for waiting so long to try it (just like I did)!
the medicine keeps me in one room at a time instead of jumping around from room to room.
i just started taking this drug and I am inquiring about it

My doctors previously have tried me on non stimulating medications. But with Adderall I've always come back to. Why? Because it works! I am now on 60mg a day. I have found that I am able to do menial tasks like housework  stay on task for helping my 11yo with homework  stay on task for craft projects and am able to keep a cool head when amongst stressful situations. Also I am playing darts in leauge and when it comes to state darts or any tournament  you can tell when I am have not taken my dose properly. I do need however my iPod when playing as well. I do not have an appetite and do sometimes stress eat  but I have been able to take better control my eating. With Adderall I have been able to take back my life  instead of this condition take control of me. I reccomend this medication for anyone who cannot find the right med for them. What's the  worst that will happen? It won't work? Oh well try try try again! Hope this was helpful to someone.

WOW miracle drug  did not realize I had ADD went to doctor about anxiety  he asked me about my kids and wanted me to try this. Life changing for me! I allows me to focus on my paper work  greatly improves my attitude towards work (I used to procrastinate to the extreme)  solved my anxiety (I feel it drew a curtain in my mind between tasks constantly thinking about and what I am doing at the moment)  I used to think about sex all the time (it solved that I only think about it when I am in bed with wife but don't feel it has to happen)  I feel my poor memory has improved slightly and focus is awesome. I love this drug and appreciate what it has done for me....made me more normal and competent. thanks you much

_comment_: Originally was prescribed to help me develop more energy.  It has helped in that I no longer have the urge to nap in the afternoo.  But  even though I am awake and walking  my desire to do things that I want to do is lacking.  I have fairly constant dizziness  light headiness  and rather severe balance problems.

I was raised in a verbal  physical  sexual abused drug & alcohol addicted environment. My depression started at an early age. I had my first child on my 18th birthday & my second 18 months later. I had cervical cancer & had a partial hysterectomy @ age 26. In 2003 @ the age of 15 my only son was killed in a horrific alcohol related auto accident. My brother was the driver. 
I lost interest in everything.I lost everything.I cut myself off from even my best friend. I turned to drugs & alcohol(which I swore to NEVER do after the life I endured)for about 3 yrs. YES I wanted to die  but never once thought of suicide. One day I just decided I had enough & quit all the nonsense. I did not seek help until 7 yrs after his death. I am now 43. Since I was a teen I noticed I had problems concentrating  seeing things through to the end  lack of interest. Daily headaches  some leading to migraine. Multiple projects going at once. Occasional panic attacks & anxiety. I am so O.C.D. about certain things that I get on my own nerves. The panic attacks & anxiety have progressed over the years so I take xanax as well.  After trying several anti depressants that NEVER worked. & after seeing the results my daughter had with the Adderall  I asked to try it. It has made such a difference in my life. I can actually concentrate long enough to complete what I start. I have found my passion for my art again. All this time & All the different medications I have tried  people tell me it is a miracle cure for me & can attest to the fact that I feel like a NORMAL human being for once in my life..........I am extremely scared to death of this medication though.... I NEVER want to go back to whoever I was before Adderal Yet I don't want to become dependant on it & have to take it forever....rock & a hard place on this one...It is only thing I have found that actually works yet the aspect of the methamphetamine scares me.

I was placed on this medication  Adderall 20 mgs. tid for treatment of depression.  I have recently suffered a lot of strange skin lesions and periods of brain fog.  I am concerned and would like to taper off of this drug as I am concerned about these skin lesions that I believe are related to this drug.

Overall  I am happy I spoke up to my doctor and was honoest on how I was feeling because since taking adderall I have felt more like myself.

She has become a 95lb. weakling and I am very afraid for her life  she was once a 135 lb. healthy woman and is wasting away to nothing. Since as far back as I can remember I could not comprehend directions  instructiuons or even general reading of something without having to re-read about 3-4 times. I was also so envious of people and embarrassed of myself. I turned 40 and was just sick of struggling with fatigue  and not completing tasks and before I knew it I had alot of unfinished things to do. This made my symtoms even more difficult...i didnt feel normal. i took the written test and realized that i wasnt a mess  and this can be addressed and would not have to struggle anymore. My doctor and I tested it out and i seen immediate results. we adjusted it alittle until I was at the perfect dose for me and my lifestyle. I feel normal.... its been along time waiting!

I was treated for major depression and anxiety disorders for many years  with ADHD being a secondary diagnosis.  My Psychiatrist turned things around out of lack of any more ideas  and treated my ADHD as my primary diagnosis.
The results have been amazing.  Adderall stops the anxiety and panic attacks completely.  Unfortunately  it's a very short-acting medication with me  so I only get 3 hours of relief from it.  Those 3 hours are worth it  just to be able to breathe after many years of constant anxiety.
ADHD makes it difficult for me to finish any tasks  clean my house  or take care of pressing paperwork. All of this leads to extreme anxiety  then depression.  By treating the ADHD first  I am able to focus more  get some things done  and the anxiety and depression over it all lessens.  
Dependence is definitely an issue... you must be careful to take it only as directed.  I take it every other day or so  when I need to focus  and trying not to become dependent. When I do take it every day  I can feel myself needing it more often  as the anxiety gets worse.
It's not perfect  but I finally have some relief from depression and anxiety after 20 years.

i was prescribed adderall and all other add meds as a child never followed through with the work involved like taking meds and working with counselor.  its 15 yrs later and im miserable in and out of rehab and depressed so i see a shrink after so many sessions from what i told him he thought i had add isaid i already knew that but didn't think much of it.  he said alot of people with add have substance abuse problems and self medicate. so i went on ritilan which made me angery and paranoid i told him when i was a kid i had better luck with dexadrine     or adderall not knowing how available dex was he put me on adderall and i tell you it was horrible nothing like when i was a kid i t made me so sick i went to hospitol.  now i take vyvanse which is awesome helps alot with minimal side effects however i work early and it runs out at around 3 depending on what i eat.  so my doc put me on a ir booster for afternoon since i take highest dose of vyvanse 20mg amphetamine salts ir i was skeptical but i thought maybe id try another kind nope teva barr only thing available at every pharmacy i almost didnt fill it but pharmacist said i probly had a bad batch like thats normal so stupidly i filled mind you i pay out of pocket insurance says after 18 you cant have add.  well i didnt go to hospitol but dont have any positve effects either don't notice anything tried taking 3 nothing.  theres too much bad press college kids taking it for cram sessions people using it to lose weight and over prescribing ruined a drug that used to work if you took it you were in the zone that was 15 years ago i was appalled the fda would approve that garbage they should be ashamed of themselves drs and pharmacists dont know they probly were told not to take it but i don't appreciate the hospitality trying to get these meds filled treat like a drug addict how can a sugar pillcause that .  for those of you that never expierienced "adderall" because you a too young get off and get vyvanse way better.

I get so sleep deprived during the week  however  that I don't take it on the weekends and I basically do nothing but sleep and eat for two days - consequently have gained weight. Overall I get a lot done and feel much better.

It helps my energy level (I have fibromyalgia) and my concentration. I am a nurse and I am required to multitask. This medication helps me do that. Without the pills I tend to procrastinate a lot which is bad for my job as well.

If I don't take it in the morning I can tell because I am more lethargic  ditzy  and spaced out. It helps me not think about food constantly too. 

The only side effects is that if I get busy and don't take in enough water it will make my lips chap up really bad and get red. I do hate having to pick up a actual script each month and pay about 30 dollars for the XR capsules. The tablets don't seem to last as long and I can never remember to take my afternooon dose. I prefer the 20 mg XR in the AM instead of 20 IR in the AM and 10 IR in the afternoon.

 I have a script for 10 IR in the afternoon in addition to the 20 XR in the morning but I feel like that it is too much and I have a hard time winding down in the evening.
Intercourse is virtually impossible for men. Severe impotence. I reccommend trying to take it really early in the morning so it will wear off by the time you get home from work.
