My 8 year old son was having terrible trouble concentrating  and keeping information taught to him at school. He however is and has NEVER been hyper  just no attention span. This medication has been a blessing! He remembers what he has been taught  and is so much happier  it brought me to tears! He is excelling at school and home. So glad we tried this.

Before getting diagnosed and taking medication  my life was difficult and stressful.  I'm in graduate school and ever since I was younger I always had to study 2-4 times harder than everyone else just to get the same grade.  I was constantly losing everything  forgetting what I had been doing  and forgetting important things/events.  Now I've been taking a generic adderall and my life is so much easier.  I have spent less time studying and am finally able to organize things without getting distracted every 5 min.  Adderall is not good for everyone with ADHD and different treatments are available.  After my experience on medication  I would recommend that people with ADHD at least try some sort of medication.  All of my friends who have ADD/ADHD take medication and are just fine.  There are some side effects  but those are generally mild and go away after some time.  All in all  adderall has helped me a lot in graduate school  and I don't think I would be able to finish without it.

My friend suggest i try one of her adderalls  And it was sooo great! doctor put me on Zoloft for depression  i do not like it at all! i get a headache from it and i dont even want to take it anymore. I want to get put on Adderall but since the doctor diagnosed me with depression how do i tell her i think i might just have ADD instead.

I was prescribed Adderall three years ago and it has helped a great deal.  It helped alleviate probems such as chronic generalized anxiety panic attacks and bouts of depression (all disorders that physicians had been trying to ease with various prescriptions for years).  With Adderall  I find myself simply pushing past the anxiety and panic. I have always been a perfectionist and this med does lend to occasional OCD  but so far  this has been managable.
I have also had insomnia since I was a child and presently take Seroquel at bedtime so that I'm able to sleep. Prescribed sleeping pills have not worked. Since Seroquel is known for weight gain  I have not enjoyed the weight loss I have heard others on Adderall describe.  I have recently tried Valerian Root and Melotonin with some positive results. Any other suggestions? Overall  Adderall has been a lifesaver - the positive effects far outnumber the negative ones.

My life has changed with aderall.  Iam more focused  less reactive and it has improved my stamina  as I have ADDHD  fibromyagia and ms.  The only problem now is I changed insurance companies at work and I am having difficulty paying for it.
it is great to be able to focus and concentrate without forgetting or moving onto something else before i finished .

Adderall has helped me focus and actually complete a task or a 'to do' list. Can't believe what a difference it makes. My husband used to 'poo-poo' me...you are lazy  just focus  why can't you get anything done? I thought I was losing my mind. Was tested for ADD/ADHD by a psychiatric doctor who said I was anxious and depressed and prescribed Xanax....that made me sleepy and more disconnected. 

Finally found a nurse practitioner who recognized my symptoms right away. Sitting in her office  I couldn't even keep my feet/legs still....always felt as if I needed to be doing something!! Within three days  I couldn't believe the difference. I can focus at work  I can listen to a conversation without having my mind race at all the 'things' I need to complete. Just wish I would have had this in college...a lot of my professors thought I was just a scatterbrain...
One of the best commercials on TV was my ah-ha moment. A woman is sitting in a conference room--in a meeting with many others. The camera focuses on her face and she has thoughts racing through her mind  the announcer says..."her mind is like a television that can't find the right channel" shows constantly changing channels/commercials...Oh my...that is me...!! I knew I needed to find someone to help me. If this sounds like you...search until you find a health care provider that will listen. The first doc I saw  made me think there was something seriously wrong with me  even after all the ADHD tests. The Nurse Practitioner diagnosed me at the first visit. 
I have no issues with this medication  no shaking or nervousness...the opposite effect actually. One complaint  it is amphetamine  salts...there is a 'salty' taste in my mouth--occasionally. I drink lots of water during the day  that seems to help.

A miracle drug for me. The only problem I have with it is the requirement of getting a written script every month. I travel for work and finding a Dr. that will prescribe it where I happen to be working is sometimes very difficult.
Has anyone else had a rash (on the face) develop and does it go away?

It worked somewhat in the beginning  but made me very sleepy. Two months later  I'm not as sleepy but no benefits anymore. My doctors are puzzled when I tell them that I can take adderall at like 8pm and have no problems falling asleep  and actually sleep better at night. I have an adverse reactions to a lot of meds.

Adderall changed my life. I was self medicating my ADHD for years with insane amounts of caffiene and struggled in school. This drug allowed me to tap into my naturally high IQ and use it to my advantage. I went from a social reject to having a lot of friends  and I no longer constantly struggle with being exhausted during the day. Tolerance will build  however  so use it sparingly.

There was always so little time! Now Keep in mind I was aware I had ADD and ADHD for many years prior to making the decision to try medications. The first day I took Adderall it had never felt more calm and quite in my head I am sleeping better  I feel less anxious it has been wonderful in that aspect but like all drugs I do struggle with the side Effects and finding a balance in my medication as well as questions with stimulants and conception/ pregnancy. As a child I never really knew that i had a short attention span. I've always had a hard time in school  but I really noticed it whenever I got into college. No matter how much I studied I couldn't seem to retain any information. About a year ago I went to my doctor and found out I have ADD. I never knew I had it until I looked back at my childhood and all the way to me now as an adult. I was put on adderall 20mg twice a day my life actually became normal. For the first time in my life I actually heard a clock ticking while talking to family. My ability to stay focused and on task was just the best feeling in the world. My life has very organized and I can hold interest in studying  my work  as well as my social life. The only downfall about adderall was that it had an extreme supression of my appetite and I had no extra weight to lose. After I would come down off of my doseage I get very irritable  not sure if it's a side effect from the drug or the fact I work 3rd shift as a police officer and rarely sleep good. But overall this has been a blessing to me and my ability to do better at work and at home. If I only had this when I was a young kid and in school I believe my grades would have been out of this world!
server heart burn

I have adult diagnosed ADD. Was unable to take concerta-thought I was having a heart attack within an hour of my first dose. Doc then tried wellbrutin-did not work.  Next-vyvanse-no results.  Started on adderall. Developed the worst case of dry mouth that took over 4 mos. to clear up (after stopping adderall). Started adderall again to see if  it will work for me. Two days in at 30 mg/da & the dry mouth is raging even with a high dose of nystatin  salt rinses  baking soda rinses & every other suggestion I got professionally & from others who have suffered with dry mouth. It is on par with shingles. If anyone has the answer to dry mouth I will try ANYTHING.

I have major depressive disorder and am a parent and get suicidle a lot. Adderall saved my life by getting me out of bed  motivation  and look forward to things. I've been prescribed 20mg of Adderall IR 3 times daily since I was 15  and I'm almost 20 now. Up until a year ago  it helped A LOT. I suddenly got good grades  more social  and felt great about myself. This past year  I noticed it wasn't giving me the same awesome effects. So  I started taking half of one extra  for that extra boost. Half of one became 4. Yes  I was taking 7 to 8 a day. This went on for about 9 months. My seasonal depression turned into major depressive disorder and I'm diagnosed with general anxiety disorder  chronic insomnia  major depression  mild schizophrenia  and amphetamine psychosis. Moral of my story
I was diagnosed with ADD (not ADHD) in early August 2012 when I finally decided to get checked out for it  and I'm taking 10mg twice daily. The pros
I use the medication on a PRN basis  or more steadily at times...it takes a while to adjust to with insomnia as main side-effect.

I am prescribed Adderal 20mg per day In July I began taking the generic form D Amphetamine Salt Combo for cost effectiveness.  I was drug tested and the results showed positive for 97% D Methamphetamine isonomer and 3% L Methamphetamine isonomer. 4872 Amphetamine and 1872 Methamphetamine. I have researched and came to the conclusion that the generic DAmphetamine Salt Combo is the causitive factor compared to the Amphetamine(Adderal). I need documentation to support to save my licensure. My employment agency has my current prescription on file stating Adderal 20mg (generic ok). Please assist. I found no clinical difference between brand and generic and the efficacy is amazing.

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day

_comment_: I had been diagnosed multiple times with manic depression  anxiety  psychosis etc etc  and yet none of the medications seemed to help me overall with my mood and motivation. Then recently after being diagnosed with fibromyalgia  I was referred to a psychologist for ADD testing which can be affiliated with fibromyalgia. I was then diagnosed with ADD and was put on 10 mg of adderall twice daily. It has done absolute wonders for me. Taking it early enough in the morning and once again around noon keeps me from being up too late. My mood is always heightened and I am very motivated and not overwhelmed. The only downfall is that of a rare side effect  which would be once the adderall starts to wear off  I get the sensation of bugs crawling all over my skin. It scared me at first because my first impression was that it could be bed bugs or scabies  but after both were ruled out  I learned it is a rare and unspoken side effect of this drug  which has been controlled by a low dosage of atarax  which is an antihistamine primarily. and the nice thing about it is that it helps me sleep at night! Anyone else seem to have that bizarre sensation once it gets later in the day and the adderall is wearing off?

It makes my life run much smoother  I have to multi-task during my day and it makes it possible  Prior to getting on this medication I would have 6 projects started and could never seem to stay on any one thing long enough to finish.I have had no side effects except from time to time I get shakey hands for a short time. Its a wonder drug for me.

I've been taking Adderall for about 8yrs now and there's good news and bad news. Good news is that it works wonderfully in managing the symptoms. The bad news is that you have to watch how your appetite is affecting your eating habits  usually you won't be hungry until the medicine wears off and you might find yourself malnourished if you're not careful. Also note that you can develop permanent 'tics' or compulsive repetitive behaviors. I have developed a tic of chewing on the side of my tongue. I am now pregnant and cannot take the medication for obvious reasons and yet I still chew on my tongue  but that being said  it isn't severe enough to prevent me from retaking it after my pregnancy because the ADHD is definitely worse than the side-effects of the Adderall. However  every person is different so maybe for other people these 'tics' and appetite changes might not seem so minor. Overall though I have found it very useful and it has made a huge and mostly positive difference in my life  so if you're thinking about trying it to treat your ADHD then I'd say go right ahead.

I have suffered from depression for most of my adult life but the last two years I was lucky to get up dut to family drama and I had  had enough of hurting. I had no idea that I could be helped so much by a medication. I do understand it is considered an "upper" for those not afflicted with ADHD. I had seen the shows of abuse by parents with this medication. This medication  although  not used for ADHD  for me  allowed me to feel like I wanted to get up and live my life. I have only been on it for less than 6 months but I feel it saved my life by giving me the kick in the butt someone else might get from coffee. Nothing worked for me  complete loss of energy until I started the Adderall Oral. It is mentioned as a treatment for severe depression and I refuse to feel bad for using a medication that made me want to live again. It's not magic  I still have to think positive  not focus on the negative but I'm so thankful this medication serves more than one ailment.

I would get angry  and cry. I'd have MASSIVE headaches everyday and when I did my homework i'd get impatient  cry somemore and just feel hopeless. upset that I couldn't do my work like I could the rest of the day and get re-angry when someone tried to help me with it. It has changed my life completely for the better! I used to be so unorganized  with my manic thinking and racing thoughts and insomnia  as well as being so extremely uncomfortable in any and all social situations. Now I am able to function in daily life and have a daily routine I stick too as well; by feeling comfortable in my own skin and before having no self confidence  now I see myself as attractive and young and intelligent and full of potential. 

When put on this medication by my doctor - after being on every anti-depressant  anti-psychotic  mood stabilizers and benzodiazapines  etc; since the age of 4 and am now 29 - I now feel that I have finally found the one psychiatric drug that has actually helped me in my life. Not just with my Adult Add  but also with my Generalized Social Anxiety Disorder and Bi-Polar I Disorder and lack of concentration  focus and energy to complete tasks. This drug is a life saver...that is no joke!!! Constant catatonic depression for over a year and being pulled out of it and having your lust for life back  is a gift from the Gods!
They should take this highly addictive medicine off the market.  Pharmas are getting rich and people are getting addicted.  HORRIBLE BAD DRUG!

Not my fault they couldn't keep up

For over a.decade I was incorrectly diagnosed as having a serious anxiety disorder. During this time  I was treated with xanax(alprazolam) tablets which  as directed  I took 3x a.day. Over these years I was at a dose of up to 6 mg per day. I tried one time foolishly to just stop taking it and was put in the hospital the following day  unaware that I was going through serious and potentially life-threatening issues. Then  lure and behold  in 2009  the dr who I continue to see suggested that I actually seemed to be suffering from adult add. He immediately placed me on adderall. It has been a life changing med and is the sole reason that I.am now free from the addictive grip of xanax. Well  I am now almost totally off of benzos and currently working down from only a 5 mg diazepam...1/2-1 twice daily. Its so nice to be medicated appropriately and arty the same time  I am no longer a slave to anypill.

I've been taking Adderall since I was in 3rd grade for treatment for my ADHD. I am now a junior in high school and still take it daily for school. When I started taking Adderall it was the 5mg IR before school every day. A very low dosage for an 8 year old but it did help. Since then I changed to 10 mg ER somewhere in later middle school when I was either 13 or 14. Just this year I increased to 20 mg ER before school with 10 mg IR after school in order to help focus on homework. The adderall has been invaluable for me in helping me focus both during school and out  as well as lowering my impulsivity since it gives me that second reaction time before I say something or do something I shouldnt. The only side effect Ive ever noticed is that I do have a decrease of appetite when on the pill and once it wears off Im ravenously hungry. However  once on the medication for 5 days or so that symptom has gone away and I end up hungry again. Overall I would recommend it to anyone with ADD or ADHD.

_comment_: Hypersomnia. Put on Adderall. Yes  it keeps me awake but the side affects  to me  are not worth it.  I had severe loose bowel movements  slight headaches  shakiness  VERY IRRITABLE AND ADJITATED at every little thing.  Became cold to the world and everyone in it.  Sore throat  and severe rash on my chest that still hasn't gone away after almost 2 weeks off the adderall.  I was very sensitive to anything that seemed loud....things that I normally wouldn't think was loud.  Fighting with my own mind and my family constantly.  Tightness in my thumbs  yeah WEIRD.  Sore tongue and the list goes on. Also  even though I was awake  I had absolutly NO MOTIVATION AND WOULDN'T EVEN COMPLETE A SIMPLE CHORE.  My mood has gotten better since off of this and I would never recommend it to anyone.  But I know each medication is different for everybody. Hey  if I didn't have the HORRIBLE side affects I would still take it because it did keep me from excessive sleep.  Now went to a neuropsychiatrist and he put me on Nuvigil  which I have heard GOOD AND UGLY news about  but can't even try it because my insurance won't cover it.  Now  back to the doc tomorrow to get my script for ritalin and am totally scared because the rates on that med. don't seem any better than the adderall. But  you never know it may work for me.  I can only pray. Just wanted to share my story in case any of you have had these side affects I would immediatly stop.

To begin  I've never had an issue with addiction or drug abuse. I'm a college senior with a GPA of 3.6. I LOVE my classes and professors  but I can't pay attention as well as I wished. I found myself drinking insane amounts of coffee just to try and stay focused. I couldn't get through more than 4 pages in a book without having to reread it again. The worst part was  I had absolutely no motivation to do any schoolwork away from school (which used to not be a problem at all.) So  a few weeks ago  a classmate told me she was prescribed Adderall for the last 14 years  but stopped taking it  and selling it to make a quick buck. I had already researched ADD and ADHD and self diagnosed myself. I cut a 20mg pill in half  and didn't feel any difference at all. I waited a day or 2 and tried a full 20mg dose. 30 minutes later or so  I then found myself reading normally again  I was motivated to do things I had put off for weeks  I didn't get bored doing normal everyday things  and I didn't feel like I was moving at a million miles a minute (like I read people felt earlier.) I don't know when or if it even stopped working. I took it around 7pm and went to bed  no problem  at midnight (my typical bedtime) without any issues. I know that I don't HAVE to take it every day at all  but my days off when I want to just sleep and be lazy  I take  just ONE 20mg pill around noon after I have been up for a few hours  and I am far more productive than I have ever been in years. I'm not sure how to go about talking to a doctor about my self-diagnosis  or if there are any other similar medicines that could possibly be prescribed without the overly judged and criticized name Adderall attached to it. Not sure if that helps anyone  but I do see a positive change definitely. I wouldn't use it habitually or for an extended amount of time.

This helped me increase my focus and concentration tremendously... I once was at a standstill in College  always wanting class to be over  never paying attention  ditracted and over stimulated by the smallest noises; I would find myself obsessing about the tapping of a pencil  rather than the professor. As a result  my grades suffered  self-esteem suffered   and I wanted to give up. I was prescribed adderall xr my sophomore year in College and I literally noticed a dramatic difference immediately. My grades went from a 2.4 and have remained at a 3.6. I do not recommend for long term use.
DOES NOT LAST ALL DAY  GREAT IN THE AM

Adderall has helped so much with my ADD issues. I have a fast paced job and my inability to maintain organization  stay on task and follow through has gotten much better. It is critical to have therapy to learn ways to work with ADD. Drugs are not the end all to ADD  between therapy and meds  it works.

I knew growing up that i had a problem with focusing & motivation for anything. i caused trouble in school to make the days more exciting or i would count repeatedly in my head & obsess on objects  instead of paying attention. (i also suffer from diagnosed OCD)after high school  i found myself breaking up my family & the life we had going for us  just so i could live my life on the edge with alcohol  pills  & sex. all because i was bored with life & i needed the adrenaline rush to stimulate my mind & body. i was officially diagnosed with ADD without hyperactivity at the age of 23 & started off with Ritalin  which didn't even touch my ADD. i'm finally taking what i wanted all along.. Adderall. i now take 30mg twice a day & it has made all the difference in the world. i can finally focus on tasks at hand  i have the motivation & energy to get things done  and people & things don't irritate me as badly as they did before. side effects? it does give you an addictive "high" that's supposedly comparible to cocaine  so i do see the potential for abuse. it causes insomnia for me if taken too late in the day or if i double my dosage  but i can take my next dose that morning & run like i had a full-night's sleep. i was 143lbs when i started taking Adderall (which is the biggest i have EVER been in my life  due to eating for comfort after the death of my sister) but i am now 126lbs after 3-4 months of being on Adderall. i literally have no appetite anymore.. unhealthy & i know this BUT i honestly love seeing my lbs drop. also makes my heart race at times & can be somewhat alarming  especially since my heart rate is on the high side anyways. the major issue i have had (that i haven't seen from other users) is my OCD is worse than ever now. maybe i'm focusing TOO much & that triggers my OCD? other than that  i think the benefits outweigh the side effects. thank you Adderall. sorry for the long story  but i hope my experience helps & someone else can relate
Awesomooo... Go for hours and never get distracted. (-
it keeps me up all day where I can do all I need to do.

I was diagnosed with ADHD at age 28.  I have a history of procrastination  lack of motivation  organized chaos and extreme fatigue/tiredness accompanied by worrying and anxiety.  I was treated for anxiety to start  pristiq.  Once  under control  My doctor started with a low dose of adderrall increased by 5 mg a day until I reached the point where I felt focused  locked in on my work and time seemed to fly by.  I reached 20 mg and maintained for 30 days.  The results where amazing.  I can't believe I went my whole childhood without this diagnoses.  Anyways  upon my evaluation my doctor "upgraded" me to vyvanse stating that it has a cleaner smoother release and I should benefit more.  The first day I felt like I was on cocaine.  I had lock jaw  grinding my teeth and felt like i was high which kept coming and going.  I gave it 2 weeks and had to quit.  My doctor switched me back to extended release adderrall and I'm symptom free.  My ADHD is under control and I'm functioning much better at work and home.  Eating was one of my coping mechanisms before so the decreased appetite was a welcome.  To combat  I keep lots of fruit  yogurt  veggies and nuts on hand.  My general physician introduced me to a book called "Driven to Distraction" which helped me understand my condition  the different variations  as well as ways to combat.  For me  exercise and to do lists are my keys to success.  Recently  I tried stopping pristiq to see if my anxiety was just a result of the ADHD but found I have a combination condition.  I wouldn't have understood this without reading the book so I highly recommend in addition to adderrall xr.

Here is the issue. ADHD Im diagnosed with by some phychiatrist. Other phychiatrist i have been evaluated by say i don't have it. They all have MD after there names so who is correct and who's incorrect??...I've been off and on adderall for 8 years. Im 28 years old. Yes it helps me concentrate. Yes  it helps motivate me. Yes  it even makes me feel better about myself...however adderall is extremly addictive  so thats the biggest issue with it. This is a med that is in high demand among society and can kill if it falls into the wrong persons hands. Drug users feel great euphoria and energy when they use it  simply put; thats why they use it. Prescription drug abuse is sky rocketing like never before. So parents keep that in mind.---SO-- The fact remains adderall helps a ton with certain people. If you plan to take it here are a few tips (not that im a dr.) 1)If you have a prior substance abuse problem  FORGET adderall 2)Take it exactly how directed by MD. 3)Keep it in a place thats secure  kids know ALL about adderall. 4)Keep an eye on your pulse  BP  and heart rate. The worst side effect i've expericed is becoming anxious on it. I am just trying to give a down to earth review  and i hope it helps some of you.

I get mixed feelings when it comes to Adderall. I'm a 25 y/o male that was diagnosed with ADHD 3 years ago. I took adderall (30mg  2x day) for the first 2 years and it worked well for the most part; there were two problems though. For one  if you forget to take your second dose when you're supposed to  you're going to notice...at least I did. Secondly  god-forbid I took my morning dose on an empty stomach; I'd feel really jittery and my mind would race at 100mph. Overall though  it did it's job. I ended up switching doctors at the VA (I'm a vet) and my new doc mentioned dexedrine. I was reluctant to try them  but he put on me on 2x10mg spansules in the morning and 2x10mg tabs in the afternoon. Here I am a year later a lot happier with the results. The onset is smoother  it's easier to eat on it and there are no ups-and-downs. I recommend looking into dexedrine for anyone who runs into these problems with adderall...Also  dexedrine is a lot cheaper than adderall. Generic 10mg IR tabs cost about $.27 each  while the 10mg spansules are 2.16each.

very aggressive and angery acting on impulse

My son who is 8 1/2 has struggled with reading with no improvement despite various tpes of extra help and instruction. He was very implulsive with his behavior always "acting before he thinks"  grades at school were very inconsistant. He was failing to "grow out" of certain behaviors. 
Since starting Adderall ER 20 mg a month ago the change in him is amazing. He is now able to read on grade level  make good choices and is more socially confident. This drug was our missing link for him  we were doing everything possible for him and it all came together once we added the medicine. He is no longer receiving supportive reading services at school. He completes his homework in a timely manner with little assitance  last year it took an hour plus to do 20 mins of HW. It truely has changed our son's life and improved our family. Get your child tested for learning disabilities and ADHD/ADD if you have any concerns. My son didn't fit the mold of what ADHD/ADD looks like but upon testing he presented with Behavorial and Cognitive impulsivity  with a reading disability. Just starting 3rd it was critical to figure out the best way to help him reach his full potential and be happy.
We do now give him 7mg of melatonin to help him fall asleep 15 mins prior to bed. He was 20 lbs over weight from implusive eating and so far has lost 6 lbs. So that was an unexpected plus for him. Overall we are very happy with Adderall and the improvment in our son.He takes it at 8 AM and it lasts until between 6-7PM  it wear off gradually.

Adderall has helped tremendously with my ADHD-C whereas Ritalin did not work nearly as well. It makes me less "spacey" and able to do simple tasks (like brushing my teeth  for example) that I would regularly forget to do. The only issue I have is that it gives me strong desires to smoke cigarettes. I don't know why this is  but it has been an impediment in my path to becoming smoke free.

I started Adderall-XR after my doctor ruled that I was ADHD  which I was very reluctant to believe. I had a history of suicide attempts  depression  anxiety  violence  etc.  which was attributed to a specific event  - being raped by our parish priest as a teenager at 13. The drug Adderall  made it possible for me to be focused  on task  centered and a lot more accessible to psychological treatment which lasted almost 9 years. I am a much better person for doing the treatment  I continue to take Adderall. It is the only "psychological" drug that I now take and was misdiagnosed for over 30 years. Work with your doctor to tweak this drug  to the just right amount - you'll be glad you did. I am just one of the many that lived through a horrid  tumultuous life in regards to the rape  upbringing  violence  etc.  and just trying to find the real me. A compassionate  loving  understanding and forgiving me buried deep under the ugly layers  of hell. I wrote a letter to my doctor and expressed the aforementioned and that he could read it to any patient that he desired - if he felt it would "connect" with that patient. My final words would be do not be afraid to ask questions  investigate  get second opinions and never have blind allegiance to one doctor. We all make mistakes and are not perfect for we are truly  only human - it is our nature. Anyone desiring to discuss what any medications have done for me were always welcome but you cannot base your results on someone else. You can only use it as a loose guideline for your own personal situation and physical makeup. That is where your trusted physician comes in and although they may be right on the money regarding one drug that works for you beware - they do not always remember all the drugs you are taking so that is where the patient must be vigilant  especially when being referred from specialist to another doctor or specialist. I bring an up-to-date prescription printout to any new doctors as a new patient. Thank You -

I has made me more calm and I can now function almost normally. I was sexually abused also in my teens and have serious control issues that I cannot see to get rid of. actually makes it go away for the most part.  I am a lot less aggressive with others.

Where to begin... I decided to start seeing a therapist when my anger and irritability issues were having an impact on everyone around me including my children and my girlfriend and her daughter. I have always had these issues but I can also be a very fun person too. After a few visits with the therapist and asking her for help with the anger among other issues including concentration. She gave me a test for ADD and failed miserably. Went to the Dr. and he prescribed 20mg Prozac a day and 10mg of Adderall twice daily. WOW! Slap in the face and one happy son of a gun. For a week it was weird because of adjusting to the meds. Not much sleep and felt foggy and strange but that went away. After a couple of weeks I upped the Prozac to 40mg a day. Worked a lot better for me (28 year old male 215lbs).  I tried not taking the Adderall on the weekends but I just got distant and irritable. I thought it was the Prozac so I tried stopping it and just taking Adderall. Nope  that didn't work. I got easily car sick and real irritable. So just went back on both at the same time until I could talk to my Dr. about switching or something. I decided to try upping the Adderall by splitting on in half and taking 15mg in the morning and 5mg later in the day. I felt a lot better on a higher dose. I decided to save up a few extras and try to take 20mg in the morning and 20mg later in the day. WOW! That is a lot different feeling. I can really concentrate now and I actually get up and do things and finish them instead of just wanting to but can't seem to just do it. My girlfriend (now my wife) is loving it. I taught her daughter how to ride a bike  cleaned up the garage and organized it (which has been a dump for a long time) and I cleaned up my office (boss has been on my butt for a while). Best part is  I love that I am a person now. Cure for depression and anxiety
I'm 16 and just started adderall it has worked for me big time  i had it my whole life but it was never treated I'm on the thicker side and it has helped me drop some weight too

_comment_: I have suffered with chronic panic attacts /anexity/major deppession for 21 years  have tried most every medication and different doses for my depression  also time in mental hospital. my life has suffered greatly.I was always felling bad  like something was really hurting or making me sick to the point I would go to a dr. My marriage suffered greatly  but I had a great husband for 32 years until he died.Since his death in 2005 my life was just existing for no reason. Then I found another psychist who gave me ADDERALL 20MG times a day along other meds  DR changed and added higher doses of meds. such as 300mg seraqual 300mg trazadone  klonopin 1mg 3 times a day and cymbalta 120mg  with the adderall  this has been the best combination of meds for me. I know feel like a different or normal lady. Thanks for the adderall. I reccommend adding adderall to most chronis depressed people. Don't knock it until you try it. I wish I had adderall years ago  me and my husband would have had a more outgoing life. I am 54 and stated to really live.

I didn't realize I had ADHD for most of my life until my Shrink pointed it out to me. She had me start on Adderall and life became much easier. I could stay on one chore and not get nearly as distracted. It has a real calming affect. I can organize my life for the first time ever. My kids see a huge difference in their mom. Seeing that I battle with bi-polar1  PTSD  major depressive disorder and generalized anxiety disorder  Adderall I can honestly say does the most good for me! If I could say one thing that is the very most important- Never take this med more than what your Dr. prescribes! I have been taking Adderall going on 4 years and I am taking the same dose as I did when I started taking it. I wonder how many of you out there can take an adderall right before bedtime and fall asleep in a half hour or so? I try not to  but I can. Take care-
My memory has really improved with this medication. (I am not hyper.) I still have trouble staying on task which I would like to improve.Highly recommend Adderall!

I will come back and rate after a couple months this is my 1st day on Adderall 20mg 2x a day.I'm a 47yrold male who in the past 2 yrs have had 3 shoulder surgeries 3neck injections and camflobactor well I'm hurt and on top of this my testosterone levels are9/48 taking the max dose of pain meds for2 yrs I've recently started the process of tapering off those.my problem has been for the last year I go to work come home and sleep until I have to go back to work on my days off can barely do anything I also fall asleep at work for 20-30 min blocks have a hard time staying awake while driving home I know this is long I think it is important for people to understand the problems I basically had given up test after test have come back normal no reason why should be this way 2 yrs ago I was very active and felt alive well today I explained to my Dr I could no longer live this way and he suggested this well I'm feeling a little weird more energy than I don't know what to do with I will keep taking the 40mgs a day for a week at that time I have to contact my Dr and he will adjust I guess I just want ppl to know please do not give up you must be pro-active in your care talk to your Dr and sometimes we have to insist on things I had no idea I could ever feel energetic again I hope the fireball of energy goes away with time but I'm sure my Dr will handle it is a start and I'm grateful that after all the money spent and tests done my Dr was willing to do SOMETHING

I am on Adderal XR. I began with 20 mgs and that worked for about three months. During this time I did not suffer from any side effects.But I began to feel "out of it" again and found myself struggling to focus and being overwhelmed with all my tasks. I also (again) had problems with impulsiveness and not being able to "think clearly". I asked my doctor for an increase and he then prescribed 30 mgs a day. It did help. I also discovered that the generic did not work for me. I am experiencing dry mouth as a side effect. With the medication I've estimated that it has decreased my impulsivity by 85%. I believe it has taken a years time and a bit more for me to see the maximum effect of the medication. It's as though my brain needed that much time to get "soaked" by the Adderall XR. I am now in the place where I am now starting to deal with developing good habits to overcome my great disorganization. I am trying to strengthen my ability to think linearly.  When I first started the medication (at 20 mgs and again at 30 mgs) I found disorganization unsettling and I became neater for a time.  I then again became sloppy and I was bothered by the fact that the sloppiness didn't seem to bother me. Over all I'm happy with the medication.

Overall  Adderall (30mg/daily) has worked well for me. My academics have greatly improved and my ability to start  continue  and complete a task are a complete change. However  like many others have said  you quickly grow a tolerance to it. I have noticed an improvement with this by taking 1-2 days off a week. Those days are of course a little rough but the only thing that has helped me from the tolerance issues. I also have sleep apnea and if I'm having a rough day it sometimes makes me feel even more fatigued. The "crashing" after the medication begins to fade is sometimes worse then simply not taking it at all. So far the only medication I've tried for ADHD but overall a good medication thus far  not sure If I'd say the same if used for sleep related disorders.

everything else put me to sleep and it seemmed no on e beleived all these "stimulants" weren't stimulating me but making me lethargic almosr narcoleptic.
this one works i dont feel tired and i fell sharp...not hyper or shaky just where i need to be...i have never had that feeling before and i am 47.

Adderall has changed my life!!!  I was the absolute worst person to deal with in the morning and it took so much effort to get my day started.  Struggled for years with sleep issues during the day and honestly thought I had other medical problems.  I take the IR version because my insurance won't cover the xr  45mg when I wake up and another 45mg around 1pm.  Come down is a bitch  but by the time it happens  everything I needed to accomplish is done.  Just drink lots of water and avoid vitamin c or caffeine 2 hours before of after your dose.

I started taking Adderall 4 years ago.  I noticed a difference immediately.  I no longer had panic attacks  I was able to focus more easily.  Less fender benders due to not paying attention.  I will say that after years of being on this medication I have developed a bit of a tolerance for the dosage I am currently on.  This is a medication that you can and will build up a tolerance to  and it needs to be adjusted according to individual patient history and patient need.  The dosage should be adjusted according to patient need.  Afterall  each individual patient is unique and different.  I am a bright  intelligent 38 year old woman who has ADD  NOT ADHD.  There is a difference.  This is the only medication I have found that works for me.  I can concentrate.  I am not having panic attacks anymore.  I do experience upset stomach at times.  I think the benefits outway the side effects.  If you try this medication and it does not work for you  you most likely are not truly ADD or ADHD.

After trying several different medications for my son's ADHD  we found that adderall has been the best. The only side effect that we have noticed in him is having a smaller appetite. Adderall has calmed him down enough in order to focus and cooperate while in school. Without Adderall my son is VERY hyper and impulsive and cannot focus on one thing for very long. He also talks A LOT when he is not taking it  it seems like his mind is racing a mile a minute. Deciding to put our son on Adderall has been so beneficial for our son and his success in school. He is a much happier kid!
Helped me so much with work and staying focused.
excellent medication  it has solved a big problem for me . . . ADHD

It has done wonders for me. I feel lucid and I am not nearly as forgetful. I took 20mg just about every day for two years and just recently it caused me to slip into depression. The "come down" at the end of the day is killer and I was extremely agitated and aggressive. I stopped taking it for 2 weeks and I finally feel like myself again  but not being able to focus or remember things is very hard. The side effects are not the same for everyone but I am one of the few cases where they occur and are detrimental.
I am taking 30mg twice a day and it has made a world or difference in keeping on task at work and home.

I started on a 20 mg dose but was quickly raised to a 40 mg dose and I take 1 20 mg dose when I wake in the morning and take the 2nd 20mg dose at noon (12pm) for the day.  This is a miracle drug for me!  I am a completely different person since taking this medication   this medicine has really saved my life.  I feel so much better  i can actually concentrate on one thing at a time  i don't have the racing thoughts I used to have throughout the day  it is like someone finally flipped a switch inside and finally turned he madness off in my brain.  I can finally finish what I start the same day that I start it   and not 3 weeks later when someone use to have to force me to finish the task.  I just can't say enough about how Adderall has changed my life and made it so much better.  I definitely reccommmend it as a starting point to any adult who is diagnosed with ADHA or ADD

I have what is known as a atypical depression.  I take wellbutrin regularly. I found that by adding adderall for that extra spark I needed sometimes has given me control over my depressive symptoms.  I am careful not to misuse this drug  and that serves me well as I avoid tolerance.  I use 5mg about 0-three times a week.  I am very happy with the control I have now over my depression which causes me to lie down on my bed listlessly all day and not go anywhere  see my friends or want social contract  engage in recreations that I enjoy such as horsebackriding.  It is my ticket to life at this point in my life.

I am 52 years old was diagnosed with ADD 16 years ago at the same time my youngest son was diagnosed. I never had the hyper activity but could not stay focused on any task for long. I have always struggled with staying on task  reading and re-reading text and not comprehending what I read  putting off simple task such as paying bills or cleaning the house. I wanted to fo these things  but somehow I could not make myself do it. I have learned excellent coping tools through the years and did not take medication for my ADD. After four failed marriages and filing bankrupcy twice I finally asked my doctor for medication. I tried the Adderrall ER and it did not work for me. I am now taking 20 mg of Adderall in the morning and 20 mg at noon. It has changed my world. I am now able to complete simple tasks daily and an interesting side effect that no one warned me about is that fact that it has increased my sexual drive and intensity of orgasms. I am not complaining

taking large amounts of meds for anxiety and depression.they work well with one exception constant fatigue. exercising  meditation helps for short periods  adderall in small doses 10 mgm bid does the trick. better concentration  better multitasking capabilities and much less tendacy


 to procrastinate.check blood pressure frequently and under no circumstances do i take more than the prescribed dose.

Diagnosed Manic Depressive but Possible Neurological Damage  ADD. I was forced to see shrink again with Interferon Treatments. Good thing too because I was fighting with the desires to kill people. While on treatment I relapsed into crack use due to the depression caused by interferon and the Antipsycotic meds I was given. My son was struggling in school and displayed many of my life long traits. He was diagnosed ADHD/ADD Opositional Difiance. They gave him Adderall. I hear bad things about ADD/ADHD meds so I previewed his meds having abused many drugs in past. At 10MG I felt like I was coming down off of crack but when the crack dealer called to deliver that I said no with $1500 in my pocket. The nerve pain I lived with daily level 7 on 1-10 was gone. Local pain down from 7 to 4. Manageble with Ibuprophen. I no longer wanted to kill people and even smiled and laughed when I should again after 30 years of not doing this. I felt normal but over medicated. I reduced my dose to 5MG from 10MG because of this so I don't feel this is at all addictive for me since I don't want more than enough to treat my symptoms where life is normal again. I now can listen to people where before they'd talk and I'd go yep  yep  yep and never understand a word winging it hoping I did not miss something important. Best of all I now realize I may have neurological damage and will be seeking a better eval after I finish Interferon treatments. This med saved someones life be it mine or yours. I wanted to kill you without it. I also have no struggle with Crack Addiction and could actually sell it without using it if I wanted too. LOL. I can't believe how well that fixed something I struggle w for 25+ years that cost me enough money to buy Miami. WOW! Thank you Kids School for interfering w my life. I may actually have one again. PS IQ140-150 as tested when I was in school No longer narcisistic as before... Want to treat cause now...
Amazing. I have not felt this good in YEARS. But I feel as if I am becoming dependent on this medication.
I feel dehydrated and have had decreased urine output

I am in my early 30's and recently went to the Dr due to my OCD symptoms and racing thoughts. My doctor prescribed me a low dose of adderall that I take daily and it has changed my whole train of thought and has limited my obssesive compulsions. I love this medication  it has helped me alot.

I am in my early 30s and always knew that I had some symptoms of ADHD  but never thought that I was clinical because I was not overly hyper and often times quite the opposite.  I also struggled with some OCD issues.  The Dr. decided after testing that I was on the obsesive side of ADHD and prescribed low dose XR with low dose IR.  It has done wonders for my work and daily life.  I have less stress. I don't get upset when I have to divide attention between multiple things  I actually get all done with excellent results. Then on the other side of my OCD like issues; if I am working on one thing alone I don't over analyze it too much  I just get it done.

I am in my late 30's and was just diagnosed with ADD. I always knew there was something that wasn't "quite right" with my ability to concentrate  but I just thought I was just very impatient. I never knew it was an actual medical problem. Adderall has literally saved my quality of life. It has made a huge difference that I can't imagine ever going "untreated" again. I only wish I'd found out how much it would help 20 years ago!
Diagnosed in my late 40s. Medicated now for 17 years. Experimented with most ADD meds in varying doses. Adderall became my uncontested choice. No side effects. Almost magical for me.

I have been diagnosed with depression since my mid 20's. I've been through a number of antidepressants and while they seem to help for a while  as I've gotten older the duration of effectiveness seems to grow less and less. I was started on 20mg of Adderall along with my Zoloft and I don't know when I have ever felt better or more clear minded. For the last several years I feel as though I was walking around in a fog. Now I can focus on what I need to get done and I don't keep asking my kids the same questions that I asked them 5 minutes ago.

Very good at making me concentrate. Started on normal adderall now i'm on adderall XR in the morning and normal adderall at 3 o'clock. I have trouble sleeping some nights but when I take my pill the next morning that goes away and the next night I am always tired enough to sleep.

I have stuggled with attention problems  problems in school & at work  and distractibility for as long as I can remember. I'm 20  and I was just diagnosed with ADHD (without the hyper-active) part a few months ago. I stared out on Adderall IR 10mg once daily  upped that to twice daily  and now I'm taking 20mg once daily. It has helped me beyond belief! I don't know how I lived without it! School is going great  my job is going great  I'm able to stay focused and do the things that need to be done! I'm hoping to start taking 20mg twice daily  but I think since I've just started on it  my psychiatrist just wants to make sure my body is handling it okay. I do get a headache occasionally  as well as loss of apetite and sometimes I'm not able to fall asleep quickly  but that just depends on what time I take it. I'm taking 18 hours in school  night classes  5 nights a week  and I work during the day about 4 days a week  so I have long days. What time I take it really depends on what's on my schedule for the day. I'm new to all of this  but Adderall has been a lifesaver for me.
able to focus and accomplish my goals

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day

_comment_: I was about 12 years old or so when I started taking Adderall. People said they noticed an immediate difference- my grades improved  I started paying attention  I was more obedient. Then  by the time I turned 13  I began to have chronic stomach pains  which continue to plague me to this day. At the time  I was battling ADD  depression  anxiety... you name it. The stomach issues were just another thing to add to the list. By age 15  I had an endoscopy  and it discovered I had a condition known as Eosinaphililic Esophagitis (I think that's how it's spelled) as well as an ulcer. I continued taking medicine to treat everything  until I had the idea to just stop taking my medicine altogether. That was at age 16. For more than a year and a half  I experienced NO pain whatsoever from my stomach  my depression faded  and I was still able to focus as well as I was able to on the drug. I haven't taken it since  as I haven't felt a need to  though I still take the stomach medicine as needed. Bottom line- Adderall interfered with many of the other drugs I was taking to treat other things  and kept me in a state of perpetual pain. But I was always alert and focused  so technically  the pill did its job. I don't see how everyone says this pill is addictive  I find it far from that. During the time I was taking the medicine  I continued to gain weight until I was nearly 300 pounds. Now  it's been almost 2 years since I've taken them  and the weight melted off naturally  I'm down to 175- lighter than I've been in years. I feel better  and I still can focus as well as I could on the drug  despite not taking it. All in all  I wouldn't really recommend taking this drug if you take other medicines in conjunction  but it surely gets the job done if you don't mind the agony...

Whether or not you have "ADD" adderall will help you concentrate  get things done  be more efficient etc.. Im a Senior in college.. 95% of people use it to study. If your kid says this isn't true.. they are lying.. or a freshman.. or from Idaho. I was tested and given 20mg pills... at first it was amazing. Not only could I sit down studying for my exams for 10 hours straight (literally) but it felt fun to study. Class was all of a sudden so interesting. Loooong story short  after a few months of using it off an on (about 3 pills a week) the effects changed. Yes  I could concentrate better when I was alone studying/doing school work. However  when taking adderall I felt like some kind of zombie. Like.. I couldn't smile couldn't laugh  didn't want to talk to anyone..(Im usually very extroverted). The day after taking adderall I sleep until about 2 or 3 pm. Ew! Typically I wake up at 7am and cannot sleep past 9 am! Once you start using the drug it is hard to get off it. Example

Just started taking this about 1 month ago. It really works for me. Before  I had trouble concentrating and finishing tasks. Even minor things on my 'to-do' list (like mailing letters  making phone calls etc.) would feel like a huge weight on my shoulders. Adderall helped with all of those issues. I take between 5mg - 10mg per day. Anymore than that would make me tense (I'm surprized that most reviewers here seem to take much more. Sometimes reviewers even call 20-30mg a 'small dose'--not for me!). I split it up--half around 9am  the other around 1pm. It's true it'll keep you awake at night if you take it too late. Other pros

I have depression with anxiety and have been on medication for 20 years.  My symptoms have changed over the years; more anxiety  less depression when I was younger now its more depression with less anxiety.  My thinking became disorganized.  I was forgetful and easily distracted.  When my doc suggested this med I was very concerned it would increase my anxiety level but agreed to a trial.  That was over 5 years ago.  My energy level is increased  I'm much less forgetful  my mood is improved and there was no increase in anxiety.  When I've stopped the med my mood plunges  my energy level drops  I become irritable and I'm miserable to live with.  I take 40 mg every morning and sleep well.  I did have a trial of the XL version but found it ineffective.

I have beem on adderall for about a year now. I started with 39mg 2x a day. It was a ;miracle; drug. I had motivation  great concentration and I was like superman. I could work out for hours non stop for hours and stayed up for up to 5 days in a row just cleaning and remodeling the house. With tine the medication looses its potency because u develop a tolerance. First was 60mg a day than 90mg  than 129mg and now im on 159mg-30mg 5x daily). I used to be able to take hakf of a 30mg tab when I started and be superman. Than taking it oraly did not work for me unless I tripled my dose. So I started crushing and snorting the drug. Right now my tolerance is so high I can snort 150mg very easy. Whats next 180mg? Probably My One time I lost my pills and I was literally narcoleptic  sleeping about 16hrs a day going through crazy withdtawals and not knowing what to do with myself. My son was put on in February and has done wonderfully on it. His teacher told me she noticed a difference in him the very first day.The only problem I have is the mood swings after it wears off

I am 35 years old and have been taking Adderal for 6 months now. Although it has helped me focus on tasks and allowed me to complete projects without a problem it has also made me almost obsessed with whatever the task is that I am doing. For example  I wanted to clean my pantry counter  a quick spray with some cleaner and wipe it down  no big deal right. About three hours later I realized I had cleaned the counter  the stove inside and out  the dishwasher  sink  floor  and organized the cabinets. It felt as if I had to keep cleaning until everything was perfect and it just feels strange. Some may say that is a good thing but If I had video taped it I probably would of looked like a crazy person while doing it. Also  I lost a good amount of weight since taking Adderal and now I feel I am to thin. I am 5'7" and my weight was 155lbs before the Adderal  I looked healthy. My weight went down to 132lbs and I looked sick but did manage over the last few months to get up to 145lbs. I take 50mg a day  30mg in the am and 20mg around noon. I have tried lowering the dose but it did absolutly nothing for me and without the second dose I end up crashing and want to nap by 2pm so the seond dose is basically to keep me going till bedtime. I do have trouble sleeping and even more trouble waking up but once I take my morning pill a half hour later I am good to go. Well that is my experience with Adderal so far  oh yeah  one more thing to add. I don't know if this happens to anyone else but I notice my hands and feet feel real cold at times and even though I will be sweating I am always cold. Well take care everyone  hope everyone has a great day.

My doc wanted to give me more Zoloft for my depression  but I was afraid it would make me tired and gain weight. Since I was also complaning about having difficulty concentrating at work  he added 10xr adderall. (i usually only take 1/2 - 2/3 of the dose tho.) It has definitely helped with my mood and with concentration. It has also made me just slightly more aggressive which so far seems to be a good thing  since I tend to hide when it would be good for me to assert myself. It gives me gas tho  and although sometimes no appetite  I haven't lost any weight! Am a little anxious and worry about it being addictive.

I have had a good experiment with this drug  except Im getting sores all over my aems  kegs and scalp.  I feel like I have electric all over my body  especially my head.

Adderall has been a lifesaver.  Once again  I was faced with the possibility of losing my job for trivial errors

I took this drug from 2001 through 2010 and unfortunately never realized that this drug was the cause of intense calf pain and horrible circulation in my legs and hands. My feet used to literally turn blue. My legs in general were always bluish. I went to dozens of doctors over the past decade for a diagnosis. I even proactively asked the doctors if adderral could be causing the awful calf pain (which was the result of such poor circulation). The doctors all told me "no". FINALLY  I found an incredible doctor who researched my pain extensively and told me that adderral may indeed be the cause of the freezing cold hands and feet  as well as awful pain in my legs. Adderral is AWFUL to get off of. VERY DIFFICULT. I'm now off adderral and my pain is 90% better and I no longer have blue hands and feet. This drug can work wonders...but it has the potential to cause many health problems.

I would love to find something else but I have had 2 serious head injurys.I've been taking it for about 12 years.I also have severe depression at times.But I don't think anything will ever take that totally away I have been thru too much to even print.

i was diagnosed 11 months ago at the age of 40.  Finally couldn't cope with juggling everything...i was actually excited to have an answer to my disorganization and rambling sentences..

Adderall has made SUCH a difference (although CHANTIX interacted - blocked it and my Lexapro!) 

I started Adderall and i could tell a difference in a day in my brain processes - my supervisor noticed it within 5 days - my frens and my employees will tell me occasionally "did you take your adderall" and i'll check and sure enough i didn't!

its not a magic bullet - i still fight to focus on some days - particularly if i didn't get enough sleep.  That being said - had i been diagnosed 10 years ago  there were a LOT of stupid decisions that might not have been made...

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: Some days the medicine is clearly working and other days it doesn't
I have Been taken this for Two Months  I Have noticed that I am able to finish what I start with out worrying about what is next.My demeanor is much Better also...

This medication was like being born again. My constant impulsive behavior and concentration issues had been plaguing me for as long as I could remember. I was misdiagnosed when I was younger but went back as an adult and was prescribed Adderall XR. It's like I can do things other people have always had an easy time doing  and overall it has allowed me to make more rational decisions.

This medication has its pros and cons. I've never been able to focus on anything for more than 30 minutes at most  especially with work and school. It took a while to figure out what worked for me  but due to insomnia I use the instant release tablets since they wear off by the end of the day. I take 15 to 30 mg per day and it works wonderfully. I feel like I can actually function like "normal" people. The downside is that this is a stimulant so it will wake you up and makes sleeping difficult. It also causes a loss of appetite  which can be rather difficult to deal with. After taking a dose  it becomes nearly impossible to eat. Even forcing food down with liquids is a chore. It's as if food has no appeal or satisfying taste. Another negative side-effect of the instant release tablets is the comedown. Since this is a stimulant similar to speed/cocaine/meth  it can have an intense comedown. I become very easily agitated (little things will set me off)  I get headaches  and I overall just feel sick. This is more intense if you haven't been eating throughout the day and if your taking a higher dose. Being aware of how crappy the comedown is makes it easier to deal with. I now can control my mood very well during my comedown and it now rarely affects me. I am not recommending this since it is an illegal solution (unless you have a medical prescription)  but "herbal" use has been extremely helpful with the side-effects. Once my day is over and my comedown is beginning to make me feel sick  a little greenery goes a long way. It removes all the negative moods and headaches  restores my appetite  and helps me fall asleep. I can not believe such a helpful drug is illegal  because I would be (more) underweight and sick without it. It's what works for me and my prescribing psychiatrist is aware of my use  but I'm not here to preach about it.
Basically  Adderall side-effects can be ROUGH  but without it I could never manage to work 8 hour days or sit through night class.
it helps me concentrate at school  work   etc.

I have experienced the worst days of my life while on this medicine. If you want to feel like your chained into being a person you're not  take this medicine. I can promise you will be happier overall if you don't.
this helps me concentrate and seems to help my fibromyalgia

I have very bad headaches when I take this med  alos I have lost a lot if weigh about 65 lbs in 6 months on this drug also I just found out my care takers has been taking my drugs We had to let her go last night . I have had this person for almost 5 yr=ears careing for me nd o find this out has just mad me so sad  She al so has been taking my Methadone and pain meds

As an adult and a family history of heart disease  I find the non extended release tabletsto be more effective and less impact on sleep at night time. I do find that close monitoring of this drug is very important. Also quiting smoking  interatctions with other medicaitions that can effect the heart is very important to discuss with the doctor. Also taking holidays from the drug is difficult with the side effects but helps to decrease tolerance and decrease having the medication dose increased. With taking these steps this drug as dramatically improved my life at work and home.

I have higher than normal blood pressure  so I stopped smoking and reduced my caffeine intake before asking my doctor about it.  I would have been considered a light "on and off" smoker; probably 3-5 per day for a few months  then I'd stop for a few months  and repeat.  

Two weeks afterward  I decided to go out a few nights and had a few cigs at the bar.  The next day when I took my Adderall  I had an immediate urge to smoke.  It was to the point that I wanted to smoke up to a whole pack in a day.

Being as it's a stimulant  it definitely helped me focus on schoolwork.  I've been on a number of psychiatric meds  most of which killed off my libido and led to sexual dysfunction.  My libido went sky high  but it destroyed my ability to perform.  I'm sure it was caused by the Adderall in addition to smoking because I checked my blood pressure about a month later and it spiked to 165/80.

I also have seasonal depression  and during this period the Adderall made me irritable.  Eventually  the depression killed off the effects of Adderall.  I just started an antidepressant  so hopefully this will correct it.

Be very careful if you have high blood pressure  smoke  or consume excessive amounts of caffeine.  If you anxiety  depression  or bipolar disorder  as I do  you may have better results with the Adderall in treating ADHD.

_comment_: Boy it has helped me to focus  truly  but I do have trouble sleeping and I find myself rubbing my tongue against my teeth in certain/consistant spots often.

I have a 2 year old and 6 month old twins. In the beginning  I thought I had lost my mind. Now  being on adderall  I can remember things again  I can focus again  I can multi-task like crazy!!! This is a great drug for moms with a full plate. The only negative I have noticed is my patience isn't as great as it used to be. An added bonus though is that I am thinner now than before I got pregnant with my twins.

I'm a 30 year old white male who is a recovering addict from meth. I'm diagnosed with ADD w\o Hyperactivity. My life has been a stuggle. I lived with this disorder untreated for most of my life. this is how I found my way to meth addiction before I found out my real problem.  I want everyone to know that this medication is nothing like meth. A lot of people say that it is and a lot of people believe that it is. Let me  being someone who has experienced both. Tell you that it is not at all the same.  To be honest with you I wish that it was. Do not think that in anyway I'm trying to say that meth is a good drug in anyway. What I'm saying is  is that meth for people with ADD is a form of self medication and its addicting to us because we become normal people. I had high hopes that this medication would have some of the positive results that meth offers and none of the negative attributes of that drug.  I'm pretty sure I can tell you why this medication is addictive to people though. I've been on a lot of different medications and have learned well how to evaluate their effect on my life. This medication is the most difficult to figure out dosage and the most inconsistent medication I have ever dealt with. This medication can be addicting for us because we are tired of living our lives with ADD. When you take the medication and get varied and inconsistent results you want positive results so you take more to try to find that place where it helps you and remains effective. Its not a medication that you can just take the dosage when your supposed to and it will do what its supposed to. So far I'm not pleased with adderall. I will probably ask my doctor for something else on my next visit and pray that something else will work better for me. I know that this medication helps some people and I really wish that I was getting those kind of results. It would be nice to be able to speak with other people taking this medication and see what their experience has been like.

i was suffering with adhd and when i atarted taking adderall i was kinda tired the first few days but when it got all the way in my systom i was amazed that i could foucus on one  thing and was not running around like a chicken with my head cut off i find that it has really helped me with work school and at home i am  more atttentive and in controle
thanks

sometimes it works sometimes it doesnt

I have taken adderall for about 8 years now.  I have some mixed feelings about it.  I would not recomend it because of soo many mood swings  and it is very addictive.  It really helps me like the hour after i take it and after that i feel tired and disinterested and not in a real good mood.  It also made me lose my appatite in the mourning and I would have to force me to eat then later on in the afternoon I would be starved cause i hadn't ate much earlier because the pills made me not hungry.  This stuff did calm me down to some extent but I became a whole different person when I was on this and it changed my personality and that was not a good thing.  My grades in school did greatly improve on this stuff.  And it does work immediatly when I take it.  I also noticed though when I took this it made me focus but made me focus on things I shouldn't be focused on.  This makes you feel awake when you first take it then like right after lunch time you feel completly ezhausted and you can't focus on anything  plus i would get headaches every day.  This stuff did temperaily put you in a real good mood like 15 min after you take it then all the sudden you were in a bad mood.  This stuff works great for like a couple years  then after a while you feel addicted to this drug and like it consumes your life.  There are too many ups and downs with this and a different moods every hour.  And without this drug I am not a moodie guy at all.  So I would not reccomend this stuff at all.  This stuff will mess you up.  Try Ritlen I took it for a while it seemed a bit better.

My Psychiatrist prescribed this medication to me (10mgs  2x daily) to treat a condition he called "Pseudo Dementia" associated with my severe depression. I've tried all kinds of drugs in all kinds of combonations and dosages  and the Adderall has been the only thing that helps with the dementia  plus helps with the depression and anxiety issues. It is a C2 medication  so you have to be careful that you take it EXACTLY as prescribed.
im really hyper and cant sit still every long and i need to be able do school work
so far so good  only problem is poor sleeping....am now trying Tylenol pm will see how that goes

I've had ADHD all my life  and unfortunatly was not on corrective medications throughout childhood. The disorder had a serious impact on my academic and social development as well as my being able to maintain gainfull employment. ADHD symptoms always left me scatter-brained  unable to focus  and made me a slow learner. Adderall has changed that over these past 6 years.

Was on a ritalin schedule as a child and it was suggested that i might benefit from adderall. by day 2 i was amazed at how effective it actually was. never before have i had the drive or attention to detial as i have with this medication. now well into month 7 of the taking it i have developed itchy acne like sores on my face. they started bout 2 mnths ago n i have come to the conclusion that they are a result of the adderall. while i once had fair skin i now look like a meth addict. this med have wonderful effectiveness but im reconsidering since having lost what was once a pock free face.

Be very careful when choosing to take this drug  or any amphetamine. If you look at the pamphlet  I experienced the "rare but serious side effect". I basically had something that mimicked a heart attack on the 1st dose. For months I had chest tightness  weakness on the left side of my body  and felt like I could pass out all the time. It's rare... but it does happen. And it ruined my year. I'm ok now  but I was worried for months that I had damaged my heart at the age of 16. Just... be careful. Try to work with your ADHD without amphetamines. They're basically speed.
A calmness with ability to focus on one thing

Diagnosed as an adult with ADHD along with being bi-polar. First I was taking the 25mg which worked great but then effectiveness dropped.
