We are in our second week and second day of the 30mg. the worst side effect I have seen is that in the evening  after his shower  his is getting Gout like symptons in both of his feet which goes away by morning. I am not sure if it is gout  and would like to know if Adderall might increase uric acid in the blood stream.

This medication has helped my ADHD tremdously over a period of 16 years of being treated with this medication I have never had a problem plateau on it. There are very many mg and forms of this medication thatbwith careful Dr. Oversight you can switch up the mg amount or the form so that you don't plateau.
Works for me

I am an adult and was diagnosed with attention deficit disorder without hyperactivity. This medication has made a huge difference in my ability to initiate and focus on tasks as well as retain information. 

Positive side effects so far have been weight loss  mild euphoria  and improved energy and mood. Less positive side effects include dry mouth  insomnia (I am up all night if I take this too late in the afternoon)  racing pulse  and occasional nausea. It's also definitely a little addictive  more psychologically than physiologically  and on the days I don't take it I feel kind of crappy and inadequate.

All in all this medication has dramatically improved my ability to function at home  school and work and I am excited to be starting a new chapter of my life.

I have been on the generic adderall for about 4 months now 20mgs 2xday. It has worked wonders for me at work and my home life with the boyfriend. The hardest part is im a 2nd shifter. so i will stay up till like 4am and want to get up at 2 right before work. Making me feel like im rushing everywhere before i take my meds. I take my med at 2

Hi  I have never been diagnosed with anything or taken any medications until just recently. I am a 26 year old make and have been feeling very down for almost a year to the point of wishing to die everyday. I have always felt it even as a child  but recently decided to seek help. The doctor prescribed me Celexa 20mg at first  I took it for a couple weeks and really didnt notice anything. He upped it to 40mg/day (Celexa) and after about a month on it I started to notice a change. It happens pretty slow  and it is subtle. But now I am much happier  I can talk to my family now without getting an attitude  and I have an overall feeling of "life is good". The only thing negative I noticed about it was sometimes I would feel zoned out  or staring off into space. So the doctor prescribed me Adderall 10mg twice a day. I have only been taking the adderrall for about 4 days but let me tell you... this drug can work for you or against you. The first day I got it  I didnt take it early enough and was up all night. The second day I took it in the morning  and then in the afternoon. The first time taking it the feeling was intense. One pill makes you not feel much  but after the second one you get euphoria that last's for about an hour or two and you have the feeling of being on coke or something. I was unclear for a couple of days how to use it because I didnt really feel like I could concentrate. So today I reduced it to one just before I took my test and found it to be ok. It isnt what I thought  I know it would work better if I took the second dose  but i didnt want to seem wired today  and I wanted to get a goodnight sleep. As far as mood goes  the Adderall put me in a really good mood  non aggressive  and also very relaxed (even though I felt wired and cracked out). I want to know what I should do  because 1 dose in the morning is ok  but the second one really enhances the situation  clears my head up and allows me to concentrate  but like I said the feeling for a few hour

This treatment is the best thing that has ever happened to me....I was diagnosed with ADHD when I was a little kid. At the time my mother refused to put me on medication because she feared I would be put into special ed classes. I hated school  with a passion. I was bored with what I was being taught  and focusing on doing homework was impossible. After dropping out of high school  and moving to a different state  I got my GED and started college. I talked to my doctor about my problems in the past with ADHD and she started me out on Concerta  which didn't do anything at all. She then switched me to Adderall XR 20mg once a day. For me this medicine is an absolute miracle. I can't believe the difference it has made in my ability to focus  not only on school  but living life in general.

This drug definitely does not work for everyone. I have read a lot of reviews about children having negative reactions. A close friend of mine's son was taking 30mg a day at the age of 12. He also has MANY other psychological problems as well  and Adderall turned him into a monster. His rage towards everyone around him was unbelievable. When he stopped taking it his behavior improved tremendously. In my opinion I think doctors are giving kids way too high of a dosage. 

Withdrawals from Adderall is a nightmare. I've taken a few breaks from it for about a month at a time within the past few years. I slept at least 16+ hours a day for a week straight. When I wasn't sleeping I was eating. The mood swings were terrible  and I had NO patience for ANYTHING or ANYONE. But after about a week I was almost back to normal. 

Adderall sometimes makes me very compulsive.  I will occasionally obsessively pick at my skin  and once I start its really hard to stop. Not many people experience that. Also as a smoker  it makes me smoke A LOT.

I also found that Vitamin C pretty much blocks Adderall from absorbing into the body. Once I stopped drinking juices w/ vit. C  the Adderall worked normall
i have been taking adderall for 11years now it works fine JUST have to watch yourself just like anything else i wish i had it in school maybe i would have done better and not have a G.E.D.

I have just been on it for two days now. I am new to all the medications. I take celexa 40mg everyday for about 2 months now. like i said i started adderall 2 days ago because the celexa is awesome for depression  but i feel spaced out. The adderall makes me feel very wired  almost a coked out feeling for the first 2 hours. then it goes away but you can still feel it. I take 10mg twice a day. I made the mistake of taking it later in the day around 4pm and was up all night. finally rested around 4am for a few hours until i got up. i havent really noticed the ability to focus more because it has been thrown off by the wired feeling. i will give it a try for a few more days  maybe cut back to just one a day. i didnt think 10mg would be strong  but it messes me up.

I just began taking adderall 10 mg twice a day. I am able to concentrate in classes and study for more than 5 minutes  however I don't feel like myself. I don't eat  I'm not as outgoing  and I'm certainly not as happy. The mood swings are also apparent.. One minute im crying  followed by a feeling of elation. I also haven't slept in a few days. I could never fathom giving this drug to a child!

Sure adderall works wonders  it made me a straight A student  extremely focused  and very chilled out. But to me the side effects are not worth it. Its overkill  it made me like a 'zombie'. My dose had to be raised at least yearly to even work. After being on it for over 8 years I decided to quit taking adderall because i felt it consumed my life. And the withdrawl symptoms where horrible. I was constantly tired and moody  and had a uncontrolable urge to constantly eat  i gained tons a weight. So basically I would not recommend adderall and even thought it is tough to deal with ADHD  i would recommend just overcoming it instead of medicating.
highly addictive. large mood swings

I AM A 27 YEAR OLD FEMALE. I STARTED TAKING ADDERAL AT 15. GOT HIGHLY ADDICTED TO IT BY THE AGE OF 18. WAS TAKING TO 10-15 PILLS A DAY. DOC DECIDED TO CHANGE ME TO VYVANSE. IT'S BASICALLY THE SAME THING BUT LESS STRONG. I GOT ADDICTED TO THAT. I HAVE BEEN DEALING WITH THIS ADDICTION NOW GOING ON 5 YEARS. STAY AWAY FROM STIMULANTS. THERE ONLY TROUBLE IN THE LONG RUN.

Adderall lifts my mood and allows me to concentrate at work..all parts of life. My one concern is the I sometimes find myself focusing on what is in frot of me and not what I need to be focused on. It's hard to change gears sometimes. Multi tasking has proven to be challanging at times too especially when it comes to forgetting or spending to much time on one of the many tasks to be completed. I prone to nervouse energy and it does make it worse sometimes and better other times. I recently started taking Klonipin with adderal and the combination is really working for me. I have the focus of adderal  but with a calmer approach to just about everything.
suicidal thoughts  very sad  thoughts of harming or hurting myself  loss of energy  feeling of worthlessness  wanting to be isolated  wanting to die

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: I take this for narcolepsy. I have tried almost all other stimulents and this has the least side effects for me. Other stimulents caused extreme shakiness  like I drank 10 cups of coffee. I am still always tired  but this allows me to at least get out of bed and function somewhat. I have severe narcolepsy and am considered 100% disabled.

I have taken this medicine from middle school all the way through high school it helps me concentrate  but if I stay off of it I get hateful and when I start to get back on it I get hateful as well though when I am off it I tend to feel a bit better and when I am on it I hate being interrupted when I am trying to complete another task. It seems to make multitasking ten times harder.

I have been on Adderall for almost five years. Up until recently the entire experience with the medication was great. I recently started having heart palps and other very severe side effects and have had to stop taking it resulting in terrible fatigue withdrawl. It is a great medication while it last. My doctor actually said these types of medicines one should not be on for more than two or so years due to the severity of the side effects that come later.
My 7 year old was taking this and all he did was cry and act very withdrawn.  Also  I could not get him to eat at all.
treatment was most helpful in bipolar diagnosis combined with klonipin

I had been diagnosed as depressive with hyper features  bi-polar disorder - you name it  I was diagnosed with it. I finally found a dr. who actually took the time to TALK to me and observe me before giving me a label or a prescription. As it turns out  I have ADHD. We started with Ritalin  but the peaks and valleys were too much. Plus it made me feel REALLY anxious. Now I am on 30 mg in the am and 20 mg of adderall in the afternoon. This medication has been a miracle for me. I can actually complete a task and I no longer burst into tears just thinking about compiling a grocery list. The only side effect I am experiencing is an upset stomach.

My 5 year old son has been on this medication for 1 week. He was prescribed 10mg once a day but the doctor told us to half it for the first couple days. This "medication" should be banned. My Sweet careing and yes incrediblly hyperactive boy has left leaving behind an angry anxious boy who has spend the last week in tears. I see NO positives about this medication and SO many Negatives. Today was day 7 and the last day my son will ever take this medication. I would take the worst hyperactive day then to sit by and watch my son cry all day. I just wish I hadnt put him through this in the first place. Please think twice before you do.

I went on this medication after being diagnosed with ADHD. I did really well on it   but it got too expensive for me to use; no insurance. I don't recommend going off this med without a doctor monitoring. When I called and told them I coudn't afford it and needed a new med  I was told it would take 2 months. I had a horrible time coming off of it; very emotional  aggressive and irrational outbursts over small things  foul language and inability to concentrate with moderate depression. So yes this medication works well for ADHD but coming off it is another story.

Adderall really helped my add. i was on concerta in highschool and i made me depresses  so i went off add medication for a year  then my dr. suggested adderall and wow what a difference  i can actually focus  be productive at work and school and not feel the depressing effects of concerta. I dont feel any adverses side effects other than the fact that its a little harder to fall right asleep  but that dosent happen when i take it on school days because i take it earlier before i leave for class.

I am 34 year old male that was first prescribed this drug over a year ago. I have been on and off antidepressants since about 25 for panic attacks and depression which seems to be to  genetics. It seems I had a low lying depression for years that I never realized but soon became clear when I finally went to a doctor. I never liked meds so I was on and off of them. Nothing had really changed for me in life so i was always self diagnosing and realized(i thought) i have ADD! All the symptoms were there  told my doc who is prescription happy and gave me a script. No tests  no medical screening  just a script for 20mg 3X daily to START OFF. Giving someone that much of a hardcore narcotic who suffers from panic and depression is just beyond me. Sure it made me concentrate  big freakin deal...I always did well academically without even trying. It also made me lose all patience  had zero personality  and just withdrew from life  didn't eat or sleep and depression worsened. The toppper is that within a month I was in the emergency room for what I was certain was a heart attack. So I threw out the pills  but again I decided another shot but lower dosage. Same results pretty much. I know this drug helps countless people but if you take you better damn well make sure that you have ADD for real and not just making excuses for your failings in school  work etc. And please if you read this  and you have depression and get panic attacks don't even think about touching Adderral or any other stimulant drugs. How the FDA could approve something so dangerous and highly addictive and abused is beyond me. They should just go ahead and legalize cocaine while they are at it and tax it. Bet the nation's deficit would be gone in a year!

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: My RX is for 150mg/day. Yes  that is one 30mg pill/5Xs/day. I am 30  started on it at 18. There's been good times and bad. +'s and -'s. Straight A's and Psychosis. I don't think it's a good idea.
PERCEPTION OF REALITY IS DISTORTED AND MOOD SWINGS.  AGRESSIVE AND INOPROPRIATE BEHAVIOR

i have ADD. ive been taking this drug for several years now i dont know how many drugs i wient through that didnt work for me but this one does! my doctor has told me Adderall may not work for everyone but i can say it has helped me

I am 45  and have been taking Adderall for several years now. It has worked very well for me  as i am now able to complete tasks  and think more clearly. I will say  in the beginning it gave me the jitters  like drinking a pot of coffee at once. After a few days  i felt like my life had some order to it  as opposed to feeling like i was going 90mph  in 100 different directions. I have been on a few other med's for ADD/ADHD  but they didn't work for me. The only negative thing i can say about Adderall  is i do have some short-term memory loss  but nothing major.

I just started taking Adderall yesterday morning. I was originally diagnosed with Bipolar disorder  but after changing doctors I am found to have ADD. After researching I found that my symptoms are almost 100% on. As a child I was very hyper and what I considered to be "outgoing" but I never really achieved anything. Didn't get in much trouble other then talking to much  or being a class clown until after high school.Normal mornings without Meds I could barely get out of bed I had been angry and frustrated with  MAJOR depression  and this is as soon as I get up!I just felt like a failure! Everything I do seems like such a task appointments or family gatherings have been like pulling teeth for me.Honestly getting into the Drs is a life saver. Because I couldn't have been that miserable for much longer. I know I just started taking this med.but today when my alarm clock went off I hopped right out of bed and made breakfast for my daughter before she was even up.I normally would go back to bed once she went to school and I have been up since.I feel happy I even felt good last night.I am worried bc my blood pressure gets high when I am stressed out or upset  and I worry about the adderall making that worse. But I'm hoping that it will help ease my stress bc I wont be behind on everything rushing to catch up and get things done at the last min.(thats how I've been living my life) I mean even my sons shots were 6mths behind  and thats a major health concern for my child and family.My homework and health has been put off for so long.I've lived w the anxiety that I will fail at everything I do.I am ready to live a normal meaningful life.I have always been a good Mother as far as giving my children all the love they can stand =)But now I am ready to be the Mother that can teach my children by example a good role model who isn't sleep all day either!I have had a couple lilheadaches only lastin 10m thats it.I feel brand new now!20mgs allday& last dose@5 slept good.30mgs/2today

Adderall has been a lifesaver for me.. literally. Before switching medications  I had been on Strattera in high school  which had left me depressed and without any change in my symptoms. When I started college I switched to Adderall and it made a significant different in my academic performance and improved my self worth tremendously. My only side effects were weight loss and insomnia  which eventually diminished after my dosage was correctly adjusted. While I am extremely satisfied with my experience on Adderall  I understand that each drug is different for every person  .. but I still think people should be willing to try several drugs and dosages until they find what works for them.. because effective treatment TRULY makes a difference!

my son takes this at 30 mg per day at 7am. he no longer sleeps on the day she takes it and is up for more then 24 to 36 hours. he also says he feels bummed out and has talked about dieing. last nite he says he blacked out and while he was he trashed his bedroom and dug a hole in his leg with a pliers. I am no longer giving these to him. Until I can talk to his doctor.  his behavior has gotten worse.
I am scripted for 30 mg salts   they are wonder drug..... vivanse  even better
use for chronic fatigue syndrome and gives me just enough boost to accomplish my daily tasks with a short break between hours.

I'm almost 60 and a MH therapist. I have had moderate-extreme difficulty being organized  fighting (and losing) my battle with depression and suicidal thoughts  and taking large amts of hydrocodone for pain  from arthritis and fybromyalgia  on a daily basis for several years. Also smoking and drinking far too much  high BP & overweight. Started taking 30 mgs x3/day recently and the results have been

I have only been taking Adderall for 2 months  but I think it has saved my life.  For the longest time I couldn't understand why I couldn't focus on one thing  or start something and never finish it without going on to something else.  I've been diagnosed with depression since I was 18 and tried just about every one out there. Nothing helped  i usually ended up feeling more depressed.  I almost felt paralized in my own body  there were so many things I wanted to do and needed to do and just couldn't.  Since taking Adderall  I am completely focused on what i need to do  i actually have the energy to do what i need to do and overall feel like a new person. I haven't had a job in over a year and I'm living with my parents currently with my two children.  In the past few weeks  I have gotten a job and started to look at apartments.  Let's just say I am making a lot of positive changes in my life and i feel like the adderall gave me the motivation i needed to do it.  hopefully everything works out  and things keep looking up!!!! i would recommend this to anyone who feels the way i used to. to me  it's a miracle drug.
has been a great help
This treatment overall has been a tremendous help.

i am able to stay on task and follow thru with my tasks.normally i am very distracted and not able to complete any tasks i get very eaislly overwhelmed.now i have been able to stay on focus and i am more involved in my daily life.i dont get so overwhelmed and stresses.

im able to focus and have goals and ambition instead of hopelessness and despair i more social less to result to violence and have an ambition to learn all  knowlede spirtiual historical and scientfic

It keeps me focused on the things i need to get done.

I just started taking adderall about 2 mos ago  my husband tells me it has made a positive change in my attitude but I cannot sleep! I am taking 20mg a day and I do not take it after 2pm. So why cannot I not sleep? I am wired and like tonight I have been up for almost 24 hrs. This is horrible  what do I do?!?!? Other than not being able to sleep it has really helped me in my day to day life.

it made me tired and not calm and it gave me an adverse reaction  and i dont know why this damn chinese drr gave me this adderal when riddaln been working fine for the last 15 yrs  and it didnt cure my none focusing and my figiting and my mental alertness and still my brain was thinking 50 miles and hr like a train  i just felt unfocused and tired  like a confused tired
I THINK THAT PEOPLE NEED TO REMEMBER AS GOOD OF A DRUG IT MIGHT BE FOR YOUR CHILD THEY SHOULD NOT BE ON IT FOR MORE THAN 3 YEARS. YEAH IT MAKES YOUR CHILD'S LIFE EASIER BUT WHAT ABOUT THEIR HEALTH.

I take adderall to study and it helps me alot. I am alot more organized on it and want to learn. I have never had that feeling before. But it does boost your heart rate up and BP. My resting HR not on addy is 76. On addy it's 120 resting. Cant sleep if i take anything over 20mg. Good for studying  not for health.

My 12 year old daughter has been on Adderall for 3 years for ADHD.  This is an effective drug  no doubt.  She's able to focus in school  be less impulsive  and complete her homework.  The problem is that she gets regular stomach aches (her stomach is already sensitive)  it drastically changes her personality (too calm)  and she experiences a decrease of appetite. 

I guess you can't have it all.  Bottomline  she's able to get through the school day and learn without getting into constant trouble.  However  there are trade-offs.
How can overcome with a death situaion. I need a medicine  right a way to treat it it is very bad right now.
I have been on Adderall for over ten years as an adult. My concentration has gone up tremendously.

I've had ADHD since i was a kid  after i didn't grow out of it i finally went to my doctor and she put me on adderall. I'll admit it works  it totally helps me be focused and "normal" like everyone else  i'm not obnoxiously hyper and impulsive  i just sit quietly and do what i'm told. IT'S AWFUL! it's pretty much a personality stripper  inside and out. When i take it I feel distant from the real world  overly focused on whatever I'm doing. I wouldn't recommend putting your kids on this  just saying. i mean  if you wanna take it that's fine  but for your unique child's interest  if they have ADHD  just love them anyway and deal with them the way they are. don't put them on meds  it'll make them feel like a zombie  WHICH IS NOT FUN. just something to consider.

_comment_: PLEASE READ IF YOU TAKE AN SSRI (CELEXA). STARTED USING ADDERALL XR 30 MG. AFTER 3-4 DAYS I DEVELOPED SERATONIN SYNDROME (SWEATING  STOMACH PAIN  TREMORS  ETC.  I THOUGHT THE TIME RELEASE CAPSULES RELEASED ALL AT ONCE.  NOT TRUE.  THERE IS A VERY HIGH RISK OF COMBINING ADDERALL WITH AN SSRI. OF COURSE  NO ONE WARNED ME. MY DOCTOR SWITCHED ME TO 15 MG TABS TWICE DAILY. ADDERALL HAS ALLOWED TO ORGANIZE AND THINK AGAIN  PERFORMANCE AT WORK IS WAY UP  BUT AFTER THE SECOND DOSE AT NOON I'M STILL READY FOR NAP AT 5PM  WORRIED ABOUT FALLING ASLEEP AT THE WHEEL AGAIN.  NOT SURE WHAT TO DO ABOUT THE INTERACTION W/CELEXA. I TRIED NUVIGIL BUT COULDN'T TOLERATE THE SIDE EFFECTS.  SUGGESTIONS NEEDED.

I am 31 and just got diagnosed with adult ADD. I always wondered why I got bored easily never finished anything got into trouble and had affairs outside of my marriage. With the adderall I am not have compulsions to cheat or go party I have become more focused and actually feel like an adult. I am on 30mg 3 times a day this medication is a god send!!
it has helped my grandson in school

the medication has been extremely useful  almost a lifesaver at times. However it has tended to alter my personality in some ways

I'm 17 and I've been taking Adderall for about 5 months now. I really like how it helps me focus in class and it helped my grades a lot!!! (not to mention dropping 20 lbs

This drug is amphetamine  the one ingredient in methamphetamine. Warning to all look it up on the internet. Go to the DEA or FDA websites. It is an highly addictive drug. Over a period of time it causes pretty much all the side effects associated to it. Watch who and how much someone is taking. It might start out ok but check over time  6mo. 1yr. Watch for symptoms associated to this drug and really think about other options before taking it. This drug is just handed out by doctors to easily and most people really do not need it.

My 4 yr old son is 2.5 mg of Adderall and he is EXTREMELY VIOLENT NOW. I am waiting for a call back from the doctor. It has only been a week since he started taking it. The teached for headstart he is worse now than he was without any medication. This is athe second drug we have tried in alittle over a month.

My Dr has prescribed the 30mg Amphetamine for me for two reasons. 1) for help with my current meds  to assist in the proficiency of them  as well as for trtmt of reoccurring depression.   Two years ago I suffered a back injury on the job. I have worked as a FF/Paramedic for the last ten Yes (8 now b/c of injury) and it has cost me not only my career but working again at all. I have had surgery and there's nothing more to do to fix any remaining problems. My neuro has made it very clear that at the age of 42  I have the spine if a 70+ yr old. With this info   I've hada Very hard time accepting this ESP at my age. I became a grandmother just 2 1/2 weeks before my injury as well. The amphetamine in conjunction with my other meds has def helped.   I take 30mg in the morning   and 15mg in the afternoon.

So much better than vyvance. When I would take the vyvance my heart would rece  I was moody  and worst of all I felt like I was always sweaty. The adderall does not make me feel any different  I can just focus better.
bad
yea!
it helps my son so i hope he dose not stop helping him.

I was prescribed Adderall because I had taken it a couple of times from a friend and I thought it could really help me get motivated  have more concentration  and help with my depression.  It has helped with all those things.  Although  sometimes instead feeling outgoing and attentive  I feel very nervous and therefore can't concentrate on anything except how I feel.  I think this may be a result of drinking too much caffeine.  Also  during the summer  I would sweat profusely.  Even now that Fall is here  I still feel hot at times.  It's almost a double-edged sword for me.  I say that because it's working very well for me  but  at the same time  I'm worried that I'll become addicted to it.  In my case that's a legitimate fear since I used to take a lot of opiates and benzos.  I don't abuse the Adderall though.  I don't like the "speedy" feeling  plus I realize it's very dangerous to do so.  Overall  my rating is a

I took this drug to help me study in law school.  It worked well to help me concentrate  however after a few months I began to hallucinate and eventually had a total psychotic breakdown as a result of taking this drug.  It almost killed me  and it certainly has ruined the past two years of my life.
doing work better but loss of attention still affects me

I have been sleeping for 10-12 hours a day for several years. My doctor and I wanted me to be able to sleep less and be able to be awake during the day and function like normal people. I was given Adderall 10mg  one a day. no change in my sleeping was noticed. We increased the dosage to 20mg  and I have only taken one yesterday and one today. I would like to know the best time of day to take the medication to get the best effect. I know that the suggestion says to take it upon waking in the morning. Will taking it in the morning be effective for me  because my problem is sleeping too much  but not narcolepsy. I just want to sleep normally and be awake a normal amount of time.
I hope someone out there can give me the answer  I think Adderall can help  but the time it is to be taken by me is very critical. Thanks.Pat
I was very pleased with this medication. I also suffer from an eating disorder so its also helped me plan healthy meals and keep on track.

I have been on this medicine since 2006. I have taken it always with one or two antidepressants and a anti-anxiety med. It is the only medicine that has helped me be able to physically get things done. I have been and tried many medicines. Before I was on it I physicaly could not get off the couch. I have always taken the generic product non-sustained release. I hope I remember to ask my shrink next time to get me on sustained release. I had life tradgedies that made a mild depression severe. As it is a controlled substance I like what one of my counselors said "A bad medicine for a good reason." I gets me from non functional to close to average energy. It does not get me feeling euphoric or high. On the street its called speed. I am a recovering alcoholic of 19 years  I am taking it to help me survive  and I always take it as prescribed. I was on it from 2006 until Sept. of this year 30mg 3 times a day. If I took it after 4pm sometimes hard to fall asleep. My new shrink reduced me to 30mg twice a day  I feel I have lost one third productivity.   
Thank god I have never had the urge to take a handful. Thank God!

I was on adderall for 2 years and i got addicted to the drug. i started getting mood changes and would be irretable. I was unhappy  with the way i felt. Also i runied my 17 birthday because of the aderall i was so uptight and hostiale  and my mood was bad.

Adderall has been a life saver for me  I take many Bipolar meds and they help me  but they have all made me have certain side effects like  cloudy head  memory issues  chronic fatigue and many other things. The Adderall has been a wonder cure for me!! Now my meds do not have those effects  so clear of mind!!!
was able to stay on task with no problems

I was on adderal for 6 months  eventually 30mg broken up in fours  throughout the morning...I wanted something long acting so I didn't have to keep taking it; well that was a BIG MISTAKE...I tried Concerta 36mg 1x in the am...I had ringing in my ears for 3 days  a manic episode  became violent  couldn't concentrate  suicidal...the whole shabang...do not take concerta! I much rather go into the bathroom at work and discreetly take my meds than deal with the horrible side effects of that drug. It made me a completely different drug  adderall can easily be abused; however  it will not be effective if it is  I take weekends off...adderall is definetely the most effective rx drug for adult add (attentive deficit disorder) i do not have hyperactivity.

The exceptence Of ADD was the hardest  but it sure answered a lot of life long difficulties that I had and have. Getting the right doseage was the biggest hurtel. I am a much more organized and productive person because of adderall. I still go to therapy because I need the additional support from the sudden change of low production& self-esteem  to accomplemishment of goals and assertiveness.I do not use my ADD for excuses of the past missed oppertunities but use as a lesson for my children and grand children help them overcome their current diagnosed ADHD symptons.
I take 50 mg. a day and it works very well for me!I just hate when it starts to wear off then I start to feel sick or just bad in general!

This medication  10mg which I take 3 times daily  (in conjunction with 2 Bi-polar meds and 3 Klonopin daily) has helped me to pay more attention to what people are saying  plan more easily and effectively what I have to get done during the day. I do experience slight agitation if I don't take it at a consistent time and ESPECIALLY if I forget to take my other meds. One of the other frustrating side effect I have noticed is that I yawn CONSTANTLY! I get this strong urge to yawn so badly  that I "force" myself to do it! The other side effect is having the urge to urinate more frequently. (Maybe I need to stay more hydrated?!)

I have PTSD from service in Vietnam. 100% disabled.  Recently in the last year I noticed radical changes in my behaviors and sypmtoms.  Not being able to focus  concentrate  lack of desire to do tasks or jumping from one to another to another and never getting anything finished.  On top of that my sleep patterns changed in a way different from my PTSD symptoms.  I began to stay up all night for no good reason and sleep most of the day.  Formally  with the PTSD I would not be able to go to sleep at night with racing thoughts about the war or I would go to sleep and wake up in sweating from horrible nightmares. Now it's like I have both going on except I seem to not have the racing thoughts about the war so much  in fact  hardly at all.  I recently started taking 20mg of Adderall XR last week but it does not last long enough and I only feel just a little bit more like doing tasks and finishing them.  It just doesn't feel like the dosage is strong enough.  I find myself drifting off to sleep in the middle of the afternoon.  I have a fulltime Psychologist and MD to monitor my situation.
My Internest MD diagnosed me with ADD.
I was prescribed adderall because i'm ADD at first it worked great and then a few months into taking the drug  it made me so anxious  snappy & on edge.
Much better than the Adderall XR. I developed a bad reaction to that and this is much better. Sometimes it still mess with my mood  I'll have highs and lows  but it's very effective.

I have been through the gammet of anti-depressants and years of therapy. Anti-depressants added to my already present symptoms of fatigue  brain fog  and inability to focus. My psychiatrist was hesitant to prescribe me Adderall due to my past history of using illegal drugs to eliviate my symptoms.I wanted to find something that could help me function without the stigma and lifestyle associated with illegal drugs. After two years with the same Dr. and close monitoring of the affects of other medications  he finally decided to try me on the Adderall. Before  I would start out to complete one task  and end up with 10 unfinished tasks and no desire to complete any of them. After the Adderall  I noticed a difference the very first day. The ability to start a single task and see it through to completion was a wonderful feeling. It has completely changed my life.

I am bi-polar and suffer from depression.  I have been on Adderall for about 6 months now and can honestly say that it has been a live saver for me. _conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: I've been on generic Adderal 10mg 3x day for three days. I had a sleep study and have a "fragmented sleep pattern" but just shy of having narcolepsy. After sleeping for 17 hrs a day for four years  falling asleep while on the computer  watching tv  dozing off while shopping and doing dishes  it's nice to wake up at 10am not 4pm. I was so depressed *because* I couldn't wake up  not because of my depression which is well treated. My psychiatrist didn't care to listen. I'm still getting the timing right so I can sleep well at night. I do take meds for anxiety  seizures  atypical depression  and tremors with muscular contortions. Thought adderal would really agitate all this but all I do is shake a little bit. I drag a lot between doses and my concentration goes away. I feel really physically hungry when I'm hungry  but every food seems repulsive to me. I force myself to eat. I've had really tight muscles  partly because of occasional contortions  partly from adderal plus scoliosis. I do a lot of stretching and see my chiro. My pulse stays at 84 bps  some very brief palpitations (one or two per day) so NO caffeine. I meditate and do breathing exercises. One very weird thing

My son is 10yrs old in the 4th grade (held him back in 1st grade due to failing while he was getting diagnosed.) He started taking Adderall @ 10mg 1x per day in the AM  5 months ago. He is ADHD with all the hyperactivity and lack of ability to focus on any tasks  no matter how minor they may be. He was diagnosed at age 6 in the first grade. We have tried at least 8 different medications in the last four years. As he grows  the meds seem to sometime lose their effect after a certain period of time. Concerta was great for almost 2yrs and then we tried various others till we found Adderall. It worked GREAT! He stays focused and we do not have any side effects at all! Not even the loss of appetite which was always a problem with the other medications. I am very pleased with this medication  and at times this may be frustrating as a parent to go through finding what works for your child. But once you find the medication that works for your child  it definitely is worth everything to see your child succeed at all he does  especially in school. My son is a very caring  loving and happy child and have never had any problems as far as anger issues that many people might mention. He is just full of energy and cannot stay focused on one task  school assignments or just doing things in order such as fix your bed and next clean out your back pack....he may start the bed but will soon be jumping in the living room having not completed his bed or much less totally forgot about his back pack...
at first i felt like i was on speed then when my body got use to it i needed more. i am also taking effxor and i am wondering if the adderall is effecting my depression making it worse.

I have been able to stay for focused and not trying to do 100 things at time  feel that I can consintrate more .

Adderall is one of the very few true "miracle drugs." I was finally diagnosed with ADHD (primarily inattentive) at age 23. I've been prescribed the other meds  but for the past 10 years I've been on the same dose of Adderall (20mg t.i.d.) and nothing works better. With Adderall I am able to focus  think before acting  I'm much less anxious and my temper is curbed. All of which give me much more confidence in the things I do. Hell  it even helps me sleep better!
Prior to diagnosis w/ADHD  I had a brief stint of drug use (and I know that's a contraindication)  but in all honesty  Adderall was of great help in stopping those behaviours. It's amazing what can happen when a person gains cognitive clarity & patience to assist in positive decision-making.
Although it can increase anxiety in some and if you have cardiovascular issues - forget it  I highly recommend at least a trial of this medication if you have ADD/ADHD. It continues to do wonders for me.
it helped me for a while but then I have to increase the mg.

I was prescribed adderall 15mg once daily at first for ADHD. I would take it at about 8AM and by lunch time it was worn off and I just crashed. My doctor then prescribed me 20MG XR once daily. This has worked so much better for me and seems to last about 7-8 hours. Side effects when taking 15MG immediate release tabs

Years ago  I had a TIA & it gave me such a "wild" sensation (whole left side went numb) that I shall never forget it. Years after that  I had a tingling sensation that was so similar to my earlier TIA  that I thought it was an aura signaling another onset of a TIA or worse yet  a full blown stroke. So I made a "beeline" to the ER & the ER Dr.'s had no idea what it was. So  they got on the phone with what I'm calling a "lifesaver" as he (Dr. Alan S. Zacharias  a "guru" of a neurologist here in Boulder  CO)  knew  once they told him all the Rx's I was taking  e.g.  Adderal  what was going on  i.e.  that the Adderall was the problem  told the ER Dr.'s that info & had them tell me to stop taking the Rx Adderall immediately. I did & the tinglings went away forever. That is ONE STRONG Rx!!! Now  I'm taking generic Ritalin & no side effects  i.e.  tinglings. So  now on to this wonderful WEBMD website. It's here where I found that those who've had a stroke  or in my case  a TIA  should NOT be taking Adderal -- therefore  thank you for being so inclusive  exhaustive  comprehensive  etc unlike the PDR where no mention was made of that contraindication. Thanks  Barry
this medication has worked for me I wouldn"t be able to get up &do my housework with out them. I have been taking them for 6 years they are great

_comment_: I was first prescribed Adderall XR when I was 16 years old. But in addition to that diagnoses of ADHD I was also told I had Bipolar Disorder. Now that I am in my 20s I have a worry about the long term side effects. Every doctor I have asked assures me that there are no proven negative long term effects of taking this medication for a long period of time.  But I can help but think otherwise. It is an amphetamine after all. Other issues I am concerned about have been the effect it has on me when I stop taking it completely. I am very tired and don't really know what to expect or I'm aware of things that are going on around me but can't really grasp the concepts. I have tried the none Extended Release Adderall and it was very unsatisfactory! BLEH! I would take one in the morning and then one in the afternoon and I had major side effects  tremors  ticks  I kept clenching my jaw and I was very unhappy. I am satisfied with the results and ease of the XR tablets. But I still think about the long term side effects...kind of feel like a lab rat considering every doctor I've asked about them seems to think that I'll be fine...I guess I'll find out  eventually...

In my mid 30's I was diagnosed with ADHD and with the aid of this medication have a clearer outlook on in relation to my family  job and tasks at hand.  With minimual side effects  at a dose of 20mg / day.  My pharmacy did make a mistake of dispensing the generic once. The pills are identical  but the side effects were not.  With the generic I experienced sever cramping  mood swings and extreme irritability.  It took another month off the generic and back on brand to rectify.  I also notice that not stopping over the weekends or on holidays  and keeping the regular dose without fluctuation  gives me a consistant benefit.
My little sister was prescribed Adderall when she was about 10. She has ADHD. The stereotypical kind
when it starts to wear off it wears off fast  and it makes me feel very tired

I am a full time worker and part time college student.  I was just recently diganosed with ADD but I know i have had it all my life. Inability to concentrate like studying  listening and hearing what people had to say  I always heard them but never understood them because I just wanted the end resuly because I am always on the go go go. I just started taking Adderall XR 10mg i believe because  I need it for school and would like it for work(I do a lot of computer work and make careles mistakes even though I know better). The very first day I expierenced like a high of energy  but very attentive that lasted only 4 hrs  supposed to last like 8. So I took it again the next day because I know my body wasnt used to it  I was expecting it do the same but did not happen  I just became more alert and focused and relized mistakes when I made them and was better able to multi task(at work sometimes i have to do like 5 things really quick)I was able to priortise  but it still only lasted 4 hours  I started getting sleepy  and felt "like a blonde" as usual. So I will be trying Vyvanes later so I hope it works longer because my day starts at 9 and it doesnt end untill 11pm most days.

I had severe side effects with this drug. After the time of use when I would come down I would become severly depressed for no reason and start crying. I also picked my skin bloody. I switched to concerta which worked wonders.
I've started turning my life around on this medication. I've improved every were  from work to school. I'm very interested in trying the different treatments.

**** Adderall helped me get through an intensive graduate school program by allowing me to focus on my reading assignments and projects after a long full day at work. It also elevated my mood. I felt happy that I was managing work and school well. I never abused the dosage and took it on a daily basis with the approval of my doctor for a year and a half until I suffered from a ruptured brain aneurysm. I never had high blood pressure and my EKG was fine before starting the medication. I did notice that my BP had gone up while on the medication but I just attributed that to the extra demands of grad school and a new teaching position. I was one of the Extremely lucky ones to survive the ruptured aneurysm w/o complications. My neurosurgeon said that the rupture could have been brought on by the use of this drug and demanded I immediately stop using it. Because of this I would not recommend it's use by anyone. I'm a teacher and would rather see kids or adults bouncing off the walls or daydreaming away then lying in a coffin.
i didndt like it. it didnt help my son what so ever

For the lady with is worried about her 29 year old daughters hair falling out.  I am 26 years old and have taken adderall since i was 13.  So pretty much everything that most of the things people are saying they are going through in these reviews  they have already come and gone with me.  But the last is the hair loss with me.  Right now Im going to a dermatologist just to figure out my massive hair loss problem.  I fear I will almost be bald by the end of the year (but mostly because my last dermy was a moron and never even ran tests). My suggestion is get her to a Dr.  Get a blood test or test the scalp tissues.  Thyriod/depression/stress/hormones are easily grouped and can be disguised.  And with this disorder is hard to figure if its just you or could actually be an underlining problem.  I have my other dermys apt tomorrow.  Ill respond when i have a better problem with whats going on with me because i can almost guarantee it might be the same thing.

Currently I am taking Adderall XR 20mg a day and have been doing for about two weeks now. Three months ago I was initially prescribed 15mg of the XR. I have a more inattentive form of AD/HD and I immediately noticed a difference in my ability to focus and concentrate  especially in school. However  as others have complained I notice it does seem to wear off a bit. It's possible I need a higher dosage for more effectiveness but I noticed I have begun jaw clenching and my dry mouth is insane! Although it's possible the dry mouth is from my Depakote. I have a Mixed Bipolar co-morbid AD/HD diagnosis. This medication is overall quite effective and can make a life changing improvement for some. However I want to caution this medication shouldn't make a person with true  AD/HD feel "tweaked out"  sped up  or high. It should just elevate awareness  focus  and an overall attention to detail. That's why I agree that it is safe for kids truly suffering from this diagnosis should take a stimulant medication such as Adderall. You will notice immediately if these medications will be a right fit for you.

Wow  thank you everyone for your imput.Special thanks to the Dr.for the honesty reguarding the addiction issues. I can relate to the person who said someone can talk to you for 10 minutes and you don't remember a thing they daid. I too use adderall for it's intended porpuse. Unfortunantly  I also use it and have abused it a lot.I moved 2 500 miles about 12 years ago just to get away from what was the meth Capital of our great country San Diego at that time. Thank God meth is not a major problem in Western Pa.However  adderall and meth are soooooo much alike. I encourage anyone out there to really think twice before putting your child on adderall. First I would get a second apinion from a Dr. who knows about addiction.2nd I would look at the families addiction history. If you must put your child on adderall I would only do so as a last option where you have tried everything else. I do not mean other drugs I mean like counseling  tuitering  sitting down with your child and helping him or her with homework. I mean really try to find out why they are having trouble focusing and try to solve the problem without a drug. Doctors are just so to quick to give you a drug or to put a lable on you. I can talk to 9 out of 10 head Dr.'s and in 15 minutes I can have them lable me anything I want them to and that is sad.I honestly believe most of life's problems are in a persons heart not our head.Please talk to your pastor as well. I think that is the first place I would start. Im talking to the man in the mirrior more than anyone and I pray someone out there knows exactly what Im saying and it's time for this great country to get back to place where we can get our hearts right with God and repent for all our sin and I truly believe our world would be a better place. I was diagnosed with Clinical Depression when I was 38. I've been on about 10 different antidepressants since then. I am now 53. I am doing so well on this since it was prescribed to me by my physciatrist a year ago. I take 30mg. twice a day. I now clean my house  organize my life and activities plus joined the gym. I've lost a little weight  I gained a lot on the antidepressants  and continue to slowly lose it since I've joined they gym. I've never slept much since I was diagnosed with the depression but I can now sleep a good 5 hours a night and feel rested. It does  however  make you sweat a lot. I sweat a lot anyway living in the south with the humidity  but this makes it worse. Sometimes this is a good thing. I think I need another does though. During the day after my second dose  which is late in the afternoon since I get up so early  I start to wind down too early. I still go to bed late and get up by at least 5 every morning. I've always been a morning person but I think I do need an extra dose. I'll be asking my doctor for a third pill to take during the day so I can get things done in the evening. It has helped me so much I recommend it to anyone that has depression and anxiety issues like I do. I've not had a panic attack in about three months. I've found that certain situations and people trigger those. I've learned to avoid them. Hope this helps someone in need.
I have tried similar drugs and by far this has worked the best for me. I have recommend this product to several of my friends  and they also are pleased with this product.

It's great to be able to concentrate!

A lot of people don't realize  that when you take amphetamines or stimulants  they will work AMAZING at first  but only for temporarily.  But once your body gets used to the drug  you need to increase the dosage in order for the drug to "keep working."  After being on the medication for a couple of years  the patient slowly feels like a "speeding slug"  where you are feeling energetic from the drug  but disorganized where it's not getting you anywhere  but giving you anxiety.

I think I will go aff it competely then go to 30mg x 2 a day.  One more thing.  When I don't take my adderal for a few days  when I do take it I have to start off on VERY small dosage.
Thanks for all the reviews  I really showed me what I alreadty new in my heart...  plus it gave me the re3commended dosage for amount to take a day.

Adderall seems like a miracle pill at first  but like most amphetamine based drugs that aren't entirely clean... it comes with a price.

First  it IS very expensive now  even though Shire doesn't even make the pill.  Teva makes the namebrand now...  also the price is now higher  even the generic XR capsule.  Dexedrine is a better drug for ADHD  but is also easily to become immune to  and you're once again  F'd.  

Adderall's negative side effects were not noticed by me for almost a year.  I worked out every morning  went to class  and had baseball practice after school.  College  drinking  bad habits  and the effectiveness of the drug were all part of the problem.

Ritalin or anything like Concerta will probably make you more nervous  and give you a worse headache.  So far  Dexedrine has had the least side effects but comes with a negative stigma attached to its name.

I have struggled with ADHD symptoms since I can remember.  I only recently started taking medications as my symptoms got worse after having children.  I tried Ritalin before switching to Adderall.  It has helped me more than anything I have ever tried to do on my own (making schedules  writing notes & reminders  not taking on too many things at once).  It just made life so much easier.  I don't have accidents at work  I focus better  I finish what I start and dont procrastinate.  I also am able to get to work on time and not be as stressed and irritable.  However  I have been on it for two years and I have had issues with not being able to take it for a few days or a week sometimes and I definitly felt that there was a dependence even after taking the correct dosage always.  I dont like the fact that Adderall is so addictive whether you abuse it or not.  I want to be put on something else so I dont have to worry about that  but i think that the outcome outweighs the risk...unless another medication can do the same job without being as addictive physically.

Male  Age 60  for Adult ADD. Taking it approx 18 months. Prescribed generic Adderall 20mg twice daily. Usually split the dose into 10mg 2 or 3 times a day. Skipping dose completely 2 days in a row each week so as to not have to increase the dosage. Works very well for me.  Helps me to focus and accomplish what ever I may be working on. Also more sociable and more tolerant of others. Good for anger management. Spouse notices the difference and supportive of my taking it. Some initial weight loss 5 - 8 lbs but have since regained it.  Just eat at meal times and try more highly seasoned food (easy on the salt).  Also drink more liquids. Best to not take it late in the day unless you plan on being up late. I still sleep at night and usually take a nap in the afternoon. Some people complain about excessive side effects and not liking the results.  Well see your MD and maybe try something else.  As for me  "it's just what the Doctor ordered".  Wish I had known about this medication years ago.  It's a real help for me. My results far outweigh any side effects  which I find to be minimal.

I am making a response comment to the individual that grinds his/her teeth.  I am in exactly the same situation.  I am 25 and I have been on unprescribed(street) adderall since I was 13. For the past 9 months I have been prescribed 20mg tabs 3 times a day.  I was a grinder prior to any stimulant use.  My grinding wasn't so bad until I actually got my own script.  I am actually wearing out my teeth on the right side(I'm right handed).  I chew those night guards to bits. I really don't know what to do about the situation either.  My dentist just told me  "Try to stay conscious of your teeth grinding and focus on not doing it."  Does he honestly think that 'trying not to' wasn't my first god **** idea?

I'm 23 and I have been taking Adderall Instant release for like 3 months or so now. I started at 10mg twice a day then three times a day. And then it was upped to 30 f twice a day. I dont have insurance and couldnt afford the XR. It works amazing for my ADHD  but I am grinding my teeth so bad and clenching my jaw. I was a grinder before starting the medication  but it has just made it a whole lot worse. I'm calling the DR. tomorrow about it. Maybe there is a different medication that wont make me do it as much. I've been wearing a mouth guard for years now  but I do it while i'm awake. I did it while I was awake before starting the adderall too tho. Its just making it even more. And I dont have money to go to the dentist. So I guess Ill just have to do the whole guinea pig thing untill i find something that helps with the grinding.

Okay so anything that actually works can be called addictive because you actually need it to accomplish things the normal person is already getting done...I don't sleep till 1pm anymore and yes the house is clean and things are becoming more and more organized.
As far as moods go (I know its not FDA approved) I take Damiana by Nature's Answer and there Black Cohosh with no adverse reactions or side effects along with my Adderall multivitamins and fish oil and yes my husband is very happy as well.Set aside some time for the kids even if you have to take a break from the cleaning... And forget the Xanax because that will just reduce the Adderall you are taking.Try to get the doctor to give you divided doses of the Adderall instead of one large dose-it costs more but much more effective and remember when it comes to Adderall dosages sometimes less is more... Effective....10mg BID or 15mg BID both are better then 20mg or 30mg a day.Also be sure to take them at 8am and 12pm-4 hours apart...You should be sleeping fine by night time -Ambien should never be needed and if it is your dosage needs to be decreased...

I began feeling the effects of the amphetamines within 20 minutes of taking the drug. I noticed a sharp increase in motivation and focus for the next 3 hours. This drug works as it should  just be prepared to deal with the consequences and side effects that will last up to two days after taking it.

This med has transformed my life for the better. I had been living in utter chaos for my entire life until I began taking this drug. I had to deal with two very suspicious and discriminating doctors who were ideologically opposed to the notion of ADD! My current doctor is very supportive of the meds transformative effects  and monitors my progress very carefully. I have to go in for check ups every two months. I have been on the med for 3 years. The first year  10mg once a day was effective  now 10mg twice a day OR 20 in the morning is what I take. The negatives are...muscle soreness  dry mouth and terrible breath  and excessive sweating. I try to go one day a week with out taking it  and it is truly a holiday- relaxing and mellow. **CAUTIONARY TALE** my husband came to abuse this drug in the last 3 years and wound up in a 12step program (thank goodness...) BUT he also has a history of drug abuse and recovery. I hide my script in the house now.

I am 24 years old and have always struggled with the typical characteristics of ADD.  I cut class in highschool cheated my way through  did everything last minute  and really missed out on my education.  I started taking adderrall in college and went from a 2.6GPA to a 3.8 in one semester.  I have been on and off the 30mgXR ever since then.  After a 6month hiatus from adderall i am now taking the non XR 20mg (pill and a half a day).  I have a love/hate relationship with this medication without a doubt.  Ive only been on it for 3 months and i have built up a tolerance.  I dont want to take more than 30mg a day because its unhealthy and only going to continue to build higher;however i am simply not getting the same effects.  I used to get a rush of euphoria where i loved everything everyone  and had thousands of aspirations--short and long term  i could do Anything for extended periods of time--including studying physics (ugh) for 6 hours straight......now that happyfeeling lasts maybe 45 minutes and i still have to work at reading.  i dont have the motivation to paint like i used to go to the gym  or leave my house. Honestly all i ever do anymore is organize/clean my house and study for a couple hours.  But by 7pm i am completely wiped out  listless  detatched  irritable  edgy  apathetic  social anxiety ect.  I used to drink alcohol socially now i drink atleast a glass of wine a day to cope with the irritability. AFter reading this one may wonder why i wouldnt get off.....its because im addicted.  i may only have 4-5 hours of productivity and studying  (i have board exams to take) a day--but thats more than id ever get done without it.  When i wake up in the morning i feel great  for about an hour  then i get so tired i almost cant make it to the adderral bottle to get my 1st dose.  i cant imagine life without it  however its depleting my social life and increasing my risk of cardiovascular problems. I dont know what to do anymore!
i have m s and great fatige 20 mg only helps for about 2 hrs

After years of being treated with anti-depression medications  finally being diagnosed with adult ADHD  has been the key. Proper treatment has made me the person I was always hoping to be. Staying focused and organized is helping be successful.

I found out that I was ADD almost two years ago. I never figured in a million years that I was until she described my issues to a (T). I agreed to start taking this drug and in the beginning it was a shocker. I was so amazed how alert and focused I was and wished I would have had this throughout school. I did well in school due to getting beat if I didn't but I could have done a lot better and at least been able to retain the information. As an adult I have found it very hard to keep my impusliveness under control. I have issues with spending. I am not a shopaholic but I buy for other people when I know I shouldn't and I over eat very badly even when I am stuffed. I can't control it. It eats at me until I almost have a panic attack. When I buy things it is always for other people not myself. This drug has helped somewhat with that. It at least makes me think about it first. But while I am doing better with it  it still is not cured. I still struggle with the eating and the buying everyday. At first it helped with the eating quite a bit. Now after a year or so the effect has worn off and I tend to eat more than I did however not as much as it was before. My doctor says that you dont get used to the drug and need to take more. You only do if you misuse it. Well I have not misused and I can tell you it doesn't work like it did and I find myself needing to take 3 to 4 10mg pills (fast acting) when before and even now my script says to take 2. I am scared to go off the med since it is helping in my job and keeping me on track but I am scared to keep on with it and get to where I am abusing. I don't think I ever will however I am getting used to it. I am also scared to take other meds for add since a few times I have changed scripts for depression and it has messed me up.

While her school performace has improved greatly as well as her ability to complete her homework  when the med wears off in the evening  she becomes irritable  moody and beligerant with us.  We will be considering a different medicine for her.

My son is in 4th grade & had extreme difficulties at school such as focus comprehension accumulating info  disorganized not being able to finish the work in class  math  etc. He was also diagnosed a couple of years ago with DAMP. He was on Ritalin for a couple of months 2 yrs ago & stopped since we did not see any improvement. we were at the point of desperation & had enough frustrations & so did he!Therefore eventhough I was very much against drugs we decided that he needs help so let's give it another try! His dr. prescribed Adderall 10mg/day in the AM before breakfast- a miracle has been brought upon my son & our family!! it works wonderful  amazing! the only side affects that I noticed are the loss of appetite (which I am not too upset over since he is about 6 lbs. overweight & noticed that he is hungry in AM  so I give him a healthy breakfast) and sensitivity (he easily cries if someone gets him upset).Other than that there have been no other side affects. we are all extremely happy to see him do extremely well at school. He was never hyper  but had some behavior problems - even that has changed for the better.  He interacts & socialized better w/friends. Prior to this med his grades were Cs and Ds; ever since he started on Adderall the test results are amazing; A's in social studies and B+ in math!!  Not only that it makes everyone happy (his family as well as teachers)that he's doing so well but he is very well aware of it & I can see the happiness that he did not have before when he comes home with good grades & ease at learning!! He has built confidence & holds his head up high!! Thank you Dr. Weidner!!!...& of course Adderall!  I shall return & review this med in a couple of month & let everyone know if he's still doing just as well and/or if the side affects have changed!

Adderall has been a lifesaver. I took Ritalin as a kid and developed some nervous ticks. So  I dropped it  and tried to manage without. I did fine until college reading emerged.

I have a ridiculously high dosage  but it works great for me  other than nasty looks that I get from Pharmacists thinking that I am a dealer.(that buys inventory with insurance...LOL) My dosage is steady now  but for about the first year  it was increased each month. Thats probably just me though  my body doesnt respond well to medicine.

Reading comprehension has always been my biggest hurdle  non-technical reading is virtually impossible for me. Just below reading is hanging-in with poor lecturers. I need to have genuine interest in something or my mind will promptly begin to wander. If a teacher shows the end goal and it appears interesting  then the uninteresting stepping stones become interesting  because they are required to get to the concept that you want to know. Conversely  if a teacher presents each building block as something to know  "because I said so " then I will be staring out the window before they finish their sentence.

Since arriving at the correct dosage  I can now do anything that I want. Not only are my problem areas fixed  but other aspects have improved as well. The best way that I can describe it is having a librarian roaming around in your brain. My capacity for learning has gone off the charts  my memory retention and recollection is ridiculous  and the boost of energy really shines though in self-motivation. And  above all  I now spend at least 2-4 hours per day reading anything that I want.

To put my improvement in context  I took my ACTs un-medicated. My best score was a 29/36.
Hmm  its okay  but look at the pieces
i have a long way.

I found this medication to be very effective.
It helps with focus. I'm far less scattered.
It helps me to stay focused and not put so much focus on distractions.

I've been taking Adderall for about three weeks now and found it very effective in helping me stay focused in my work.  Time flies by extremely fast when taking this drug.  I'm on 20mg twice a day and take my first does at about 12pm and my second at about 6pm right before I go to work.  I am very careful not to increase my dose and use only the recommended amount prescribed by my doctor. I've been able to eat and sleep pretty much the same on this drug although my appetite has decrease somewhat and I've lost weight due to being able to focus more on the healthy things to eat as opposed to not eating at all. Excercise is much more easier to stick with and finish.

From the first time I took the pill I didn`t like how I felt. I was testy and mean from the very beginning towards all.   
     The medicine was taken for two weeks  per my doctors instructions. At the end of two weeks I removed myself from the RX myself.
works great  has helped me alot at wk  and relationships
I was tested positive for meth I've taken adderall and phenpermine taht was a presciption for diet pills. It will be sent to lad to detect  will it verify thats what it was

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: I was VERY concerned about medicating behaviors  since I don't even take aspirin.  I have had GREAT difficulty with severe fatigue and ADD for years  and could not seem to work my way out of it. I tried to put systems into place  but I was never able to keep them going so they could work for ANY amount of time.   NOW I can FINALLY complete tasks in a timely fashion  organize and order my work and life and enjoy relationships  both personal and professional  as well as attend to details.  I am also able to resist the urge to hoard.  My life was chaotic with crap everywhere  piles and junk all over the place and disorganized messes abounding and overtaking me and my family.  The ability to function with a clear head and focus has completely changed ALL of that.  Thank the LORD I had a clinician who properly identified and prescriptively managed my SERIOUS problem of ADD with 10 mg of Adderall  twice a day.  I have been stable for over two years now.  The change is dramatic. Definitely life changing.

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: This medicine changed my life  quality of life is what matters  I am 50 and cld have benefited years ago  so many yrs I missed being down and dazed.  I watch closely my bp and what I eat to keep the side affects to a minimum to keep taking this medication  it saved my life.

It works well  it wears off in about 4 - 6 hours so I'm not stuck with it for  too long. It calms me and allows me to focus and not be overwhelmed with regular tasks like housekeeping and managing my finances. I don't feel that I'm unable to do what I need and want to do. I understand my behaviors of unfinished school work  disorganization of my school work and notebooks  putting things off and most notable to me  my problems with math  in that I would simply miss or not "see" parts of problems  even when I understood a process of doing a problem.

_comment_: My son is 7 years old and since he has been taking this med his temper has been out of hand and he has been acting very mean to every one and it seems like it don't care about nothing. I want to take him off of it I also have tryed vyvanse and they made him see things that weren't there we had a very bad experince with both meds not sure what to do know.

Emotional probs! Crying and not able to fall asleep.  Headaches and stomach-aches. Disoreinted & confusion(dazed) even when dosage was cut in 1/2. Would like a refund of out-of pocket cost of meds!!!!!

I have been taking this med for two weeks now and it makes me a slug and very sleepy.... from what I understand  that means it working.  If I didn't have ADD  I would be a hyper buzzing bee.  As far as its effectiveness  not sure yet  still to soon  I am titrating up right now to figure my correct dose.  My script is for 20 mg twice a day and I am taking 10 mg twice a day.  I will be upping it at the end of this my second week.  I have lost four lbs though.

I'm in my early 40's suffering from focus issues.  The adderall has helped tremendously and I'm still able to sleep at night.  The only problem I have is the cost!  How do others afford this med?  I am on an HSA so have to pay full price for the rx.  The Dr switched me over to a generic Ritalin to help save cost but taking this has made me more "hyped" up than focused.

_comment_: This drug has done wonders for my organization and concentration. I must admit that it is a bit difficult for me to take because of the decrease in appetite.

Have been taking Adderall for about 3 years to treat adult/ADD. I have noticed that this medication doesnt seen to work well after being on it for a period of time  so my dose has been increased twice starting at 5mg  then 10mg and now at 20mg. Again i am noticing that it is no longer as effective. Im thinking i might want to change meds.
stoped the internal hurting

I have seen a great deal in result.  I have been able to focus and contract better since I have been on Adderall for the past 2 month.   Beside the notice that I have not been eating much and that I am losing weight due to taking this med's.  But over all  it has helped me to contract and focus on my daily task.  And that alone has been a big help.

I have only used this drug for about three weeks now. Sometimes I feel OK and other times it seems I have tightness in my upper body. I sometimes still have episodes of wanting to strike out or become aggressive. I still bring myself to think of the consequences of my actions in certain situations. Most of the time; I am able to work thru the situation.

I am a 54 yr. old woman who has been taking 10 mg. per day for abot 1 year.  I was recently hospitalized with coronary artery spasms which resulted in slight heart attack.  I am concerned that the adderall caused this.  I was afraid to tell my family doctor that my psychiatrist prescribed this b/c I know his reaction would not be favorable.  Has anyone ever heard of adderall causing heart spasms?  Just in case  I have quit taking it since discharged but I do miss the energy and focus it gave me.

I have taken this medication for 4 years  I have found it to be very valuable in helping me focus and concentrate. I work as a software architect. Concentration is my paycheck and if I can't concentrate to solve a problem or create a solution I am worthless.  I am not addicted to the medication and found a perfect dose with help of my doctor.

I only take the medication in the morning and do not feel a need to take it when I am not at my office.  I recieve a check up every 3 months from my physician o make sure every thing is fine.

I Have Been Takeing adderall For Most Of My Life It Works Very Well For Me Only One probem is it can be addeting And ma be other side effects But I cant say I Take Other Meds So Cant Say I Would Not No What Would Hapend If My Dr Stop Giveing It To Me

_comment_: I have been prescribed dextro-amphetamine for the past 13 years and was abruptly cut off by my doctor.  I now suffer from involuntary leg movement and extreme restlessness.  Are these documented withdrawal symptoms?  Anyone who has taken amphetamine medications please become informed of pros and cons before deciding to take the medication.  I am now 40 years old and miserable.  Please take heed.

I'm 54 and on 10. once a day last to long can't sleep but a couple of hrs. at a time  also on lexapro 10 my son is on Vyvance and lexapro and he has no problems sleeping I gonna have to change my meds.
Helps me very much to stay focused and retain my ability to concentrate.
I'm wondering what ( if any ) long term effects might occur mixing adderal with xanax and trazadone

My dr. neglectfully gave me to much of the drug and I quickly became addicted.  I abused it to the point that my boyfriend left me and I now suffer chest pain.  It has psycotic effects and can be life changing.  It should be taken off the market. It is worse than cocaine.  I can attest to that personally.

Adderall has been an extremely effective drug for managing my ADD symptoms. Before being started on adderall  I found it difficult if not impossible to stay focused on most tasks  especially if the task was not something that i was interested in doing. With the medication however  I find it much easier to keep my mind on topic  allowing me to utilize my time and energy with much more efficiency and efficacy. My biggest complaint with adderall has been its effect on sleep. However  I found that if I take my last dose at least 9 hours before I intend to sleep it causes little to no problem.

Since starting college I realized just how bad my attention span was. When my 3 year old can pay attention to something longer than I can  I know theirs something wrong. Not only is this medication helping me get things done around the house and in school  it gives me the energy and motivation I need to get out of bed and take on the day. I also struggle with anxiety  depression  and have a horrible avoidance problem. This medication helps tremendously with those problems as well. I've also struggled with a weight problem  and this medication is helping me lose weight. I have a more positive outlook on things while on this medication.
