_comment_: helps me lose weight

I never once showed a ounce of having ADD/ADHD in childhood--NONE. But while in college they threw it on me. Well I didn't know what a powerful addictive drug this was for someone who literally doesn't have typical add. Although when I take the quizzes I meet all the requiremnts except childhood was perfect. I now am trying to get off them and I must admit it is hard. I feel lethargic. But I am now starting Oriental medicine/Acupunture and it is helping with so many of my medical problems it's amazing. I get prescribed the adderoll by my psych but believe deep down I don't need it and am going to have to try my hardest to get off it. Get a 2nd opinion b4 you start on such a addictive med IMO

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day

_comment_: This is the second medication that I tried for my 7 year old son (first was Mendadate).  This is the one!  His behavior has changed for the better drastically since he started taking 10mg every morning before school!  He's doing so much better in school and is far more motivated than in the past.  I know it's early  but his teacher and I are very excited about his improvements.  After reading some of the other reviews and speaking with his doctor.  I have decided to NOT give it to him on the weekends and during school vacations.  Side effects have been less sleeping and no real appetite while he's at school.  He does however eat well in the evenings.

I take Adderall IR 30mg pills for both ADHD and chronic anxiety around new people.  I found that while taking the medication it helped me carry on conversations that I would once be "terrified" of and just avoid.  Also my attention span went from being a 3 out of 10(being the highest) to a 7 or 8.

I have only been taking this for two weeks but it has really helped me focus. I seem to remember more things  I finish things I start  and I feel more in control of my mind. I did not have any extra energy but have been able to avoid taking two hour naps during the day. I also had no loss of appetite or any weight loss what so ever.
it helps with school.

As a 31 year old adult taking 10mg 3times a day  I am completley impressed with the drug. Recently we have started our son of 7 on it because of his ADD diagnosis. He is on 5mg 2times a day  and is on his 3 day of it  and is consistently crying. I never experienced this side effect  and am curious if anyone else has?

My son  who has ADHD  started taking meds for it when he was 3. They have had to change his meds a few times  however  since he has been on Adderall XR he has done extremely well. He eats normal again and is a much happier child he is 6 now and has been getting good grades and doing great in school as well as at home.

My wife was put on Adderall and zanex.within a 2 year period she went from a loving supporting wife and mother to a monster.It got to where neither my son or me could even talk to her without her jumping down our throut's.We ended up getting divorced and I got custody of our son.STAY AWAY FROM THIS MESS!!! It ruined all of our live's.If you are taking these please get help before it's to late.
This medication has been very helpful while driving and studying. I can focus and think clearly.

When I started I was taking 20mg Adderall once a day. I did not stop consuming caffeninated products and that was a big no-no. It made my chest hurt. So I cut back for awhile. I have noticed that by lunch time the medicines effectiness has worn off. So the DR has told me to take the 20mg in morning and to take 10mg at lunch time. It is enough to get me through the day at work. I can be productive and complete my tasks. I have noticed though if I miss a dose I ge a bad headache

Well first of all I was not have to begin this medication at the age of 32. I have just started this medication. I have already experienced nausea  it was bad this morning and I couldn't even eat and didn't even feel like I could swallow. I almost vomitted and the feeling was awful. I had eaten about 6 hours earlier and hadn't had any of the drug in about 12 hours. I've had headaches and the jitters. They say this will pass. I'm trying to keep hydrated and take my vitamins. I'm only on the 5mg dose and have to bump up to the 10mg dose after 15 days  and I'm worried about further side effects. I know there are ADD drugs that are non-narcotic and plan to ask my psychiatrist about that option. On a good note it has begun to control my irritability and my impulsiveness (I'm known to intetrrupt and not be able to wait my turn to speak or not filter my thoughts and just blurt out thoughts) I do not have ADHD  I believe I have simple ADD and it runs in the family. Luckily my daughter doesn't seem to have many symptoms and does well in school. I just hope that the increase in dose does not give me too many side effects and I am worried that my tabacco use may increase my chance of a cardiac event. I do not like the feeling of my heart racing. I'm also taking an SSRI and worried about those side effects  my MD is aware. I'm just worried in general.
It has helped me to stay calm  more alert  more energy daily  able to hold my concentration keep my thoughts together  speaking more clearly without losing my train of thought.
I have been taking this for a long time. my body gets headaches when I don't take it. I can't sleep and don't eat when I do take it. I hate it!
when i was in 6th grade i went from failing math to making straight a's.

I was diagnosed at a very early age (nursery school) and my parents were against any medication to deal with the problem. They instead sent me to a private school with smaller classes and kept having me tested throughout my school years and kept getting the same answers. I would not pay attention in class and was very disruptive. They would yelled at me after meetings with my teachers and ground me. It was not my fault. As I matured I was able to graduate from college but I had a very hard time focusing. I have been on Adderol and Vivanse for about a year now and I cant believe my parents put me through a miserable childhood when I could have been much more "normal" and been able to focus with the medication. I have not experienced any bad side effects from either meds and I am much more happy and less stressed.

My 4 and a half yr old started this medication about two weeks ago.  At first  it would make him drowsey in the morning  he'd take a nap  then seemed less defiant for awhile  then he would crash and come down and have like these meltdowns late afternoon.  Today  however  was another story.  Doesn't make him tired anymore  instead it was like hearing and watching a robot

I'm 16 now and i take 40 mg of Vyvanse everyday  but i started out on Adderall. It did its job and my grades shot up  but i was not myself at all! i was really really quiet and really shy (i'm extremely outgoing and always the life of the party so this was really really weird!) and another thing i didn't like about it was that i gained weight. Not to mention since Adderall is well known with people my age everyone was begging me to sell it once midterms and final exams came around. I mean i know other people who it's worked for  but it just wasn't for me.

Since taking Adderall I consistently do the right things at the right time. Before Adderall I struggled with moments of genius followed by days of a mixture of procrastination and chaos. With Adderall my focusing abilities are quite amazing. I have to actually be careful to not over-focus. I can honestly get so hooked on the details of a particular work project that I find myself working for 12+ hours without much of a break. So with that said I should probably urge everyone to try to maintain a life of balance. I've always been good at what I do  but now I can do more with less. I eat less. I sleep less. I waste time less. I make mistakes less. I'm more patient. I'm overall much happier. Am I addicted to it? Yes. When I don't take it I'm an even bigger disaster than before. If I don't take it I could stay in bed all day and stare at the TV. For me  the Adderall PROS outweight the CONS. If you are a distracted mess with piles of papers  a racing mind  and an inability to put first things first then I suggest you talk with your doctor about trying a low dose for starters. I've been taking Adderall for about 4 years and I take 40 mg daily  in the form of two (2) 20mg tablets. I do not like the XR (extended release) formulation of any medication  so it is not specific to Adderall.

I started Adderall when I was 20.Up to that point I had been on everything under the sun for my ADD since primary school - from Ritalin to antianxiety meds like Xanax  and every antidepressant inbetween. After trying so many of the 'popular' drugs  my psych. decided that we should try Adderall -I was a little unnerved about the drug after reading all of the negative things about it online but decided that  as a last resort  I'd give it a try.
I COULD NOT BE HAPPIER! This month is my 15th on the drug  and I've only noticed minor  appetite related side effects. [Perhaps it's because I am on a lower dose (20mg every morning and one 10mg at noon)?] Over all  I've noticed my focus is so much better  along with my ability to finish the things I start. My mind isn't going  going  going all the time  and I was finally able to get a job  and go back to school!  
I understand the concern with younger children taking this medication  however  everyone reacts differently to different things  and if there were any natural alternative that would work  I'd be the first one on it. [I had tried going off of it and went right back to not being able to sit still for more than 15mins.] From my experience with Adderall  I've realised that sometimes  some perscriptions are necessary to lead a normal  quiet life.
I know that the results aren't the same for everyone on it  but I did want to share a positive outcome
Have been able to stay focused and finish the tasks I've started.

I have ADD and probably have been since a least a pre-teen[self-diagnosis] but haven't been professionally diagnosed until 3 months ago at age 33.  I am currently on 25mg of Adderall  1 pill daily in AM.  The 10mg & 20mg did nothing for me in terms of concentration but I am noticing better results with the 25mg  though I think it needs to be upped.  Only one time I was up 32 straight hours but that was partially due to having to be in school that night as well as the first increase from 20mg - 25mg. I had problems sleeping before taking this drug and I still do  though I CAN sleep through the night. I have experienced weight loss and lack of appetite with sometimes being repulsed by food.  I crave more water now.  This hasn't been a problem since I am obese  and I have lost almost 20 lbs in 3 months.  I no longer crave a lot of junk foods and eat more healthy since snacking isn't as frequent.  My job tasks and school work have greatly improved!  I wish my mom wouldn't have just told me to apply myself better in school and actually had me evaluated.  I don't feel like a failure anymore with this new outlook and I am finally at peace knowing about this "disability".

Started to take adderol after years of not taking medictions to see how it would affect my ADHD and productivity at work. I took it for less than a week and felt jitterty. I opted to not take it on the weekends and on Saturday I could not get out of bed.  I thought to myself that if I took an adderol I would have the energy to get up that is when I knew I had to stop.  I have no desire to develop any kind of an addiction.
I can function on individual task and complete them. Decrease migraines  less mood swings. But did experience some aggation but not bad.

I have 9 year old twins in July they were put on Concerta. We saw very little improvement even when the doses were upped. Then they both got side effects  one was doing strange things with his mouth and the other was constantly picking his head(his teacher sent him to the nurse to check for lice cuz it got so bad) Last Monday the dr. switched to adderall xr 10mg the one who was having the mouth movements has improved alot! The other one stopped picking his head but started something new. He's CONSTANTY sniffling. He says he feels like he has no control of it. He's going to the dr. on Thursday so I hope we find something that works!!

I am 22 and i have been on adderall since i was 14. This drug is insanely addictive and thats what I hate about it. Sure it works  makes you focus  you can go without sleep easier then others  it makes you lose weight (i myself lost 55 pounds)  and it makes you more sociable with others. But the price you pay is that you become dependent on it. Why would you want a drug to do all the work for you? It's going to cause health problems  most likely cardiac  if not now  in the future. You'll have to stay on it forever (my doctor literally said that i would have to take it forever  im not kidding)  and if you find it in yourself to quit  you'll hate the world when you go off of it. i tried to quit 4 years ago  got off of it for a year  and i couldn't take it  i had to get back on it. In my eyes  people do cocaine or meth for reasons similar to adderall. They need to stay up and get things done  feel happy  and they are addicted. Don't get on it. Learn to focus the old fashioned way. Because you'll still get that diploma  or certification  or acheive happiness and at the end of it all  you wont feel like you cheated or owe it all to adderall  you'll just be proud of yourself and have no dependencies. Thats soo much better and I really wish my parents would have just given me that option. Oh and one more thing  females have to get off of it when you get pregnant and thats scary to go through withdrawls and then go and be pregnant. I just had an early miscarriage... dont know that it has to do with this drug  but i dont know that it doesn't..

I am much more focused and driven  almost to a fault.   I hve not experienced the physiologic side effects  but i do notice i am not eating as much  but probably because I am not as bored so often.  I do believe that it has helped me quit smoking.   Immediately after begining this medication  I went from smoking almost a pack a day to two  just purely out of habit.  It keeps me so focused  I am not looking for any chance I can get to take a break.   The only undesirabe effect I have had is trouble sleeping.   I went from sleeping 10 hours a night to about 4 in a matter of two weeks.  This really has been a miracle drug  and I wish I would have been prescribed this when I was in high school and college.   It makes me kind of wonder what I would have really been able to acheive.
I like the way it helps me to organize my thinking (executive function) but don't like the way it makes me feel.  I'm much more cognitive with the medicine and less accessable to my emotions.
i feel great with this pill
not losing my temper as easy able to listen without interupting or making an assumption still fidgety more open-minded
i love this medcin
i am bipolar and right now i am very depressed and take 2-3 5mg of adderall daily. when i don't take the medicine i do not have the energy to get out of bed.
It has worked wonders with my home and work life and it has also benifited both of my children!!!!!
I need help0 with anxiety and weight loss will adderall help?

At first the medication worked well. Work was easy  life was easy. After second month started having trouble sleeping. Eventually became an INSOMNIAC. I probably only slept around 4 hours a day. The medication also cause my skin to dry up. My scalp became itchy all the time and caused dandruff. My penis also became smaller and the skin around the head became dry and irratated. The medication caused my sex drive to decrease. Sex became painful and I felt a burning sensation upon ejaculation. I experienced severe cotton mouth as well. I stopped taking the medication and my appetite soon came back. The medication was addictive and when i got off of it  life was extremely difficult at first. I was tired ALL the time. I felt extreme exhaustion for the first week. My advice  stick to coffee and learn to pay attention.
works relatively well keeping me more alert and focused during the day.
After monitoring my blood pressure I had discovered it very high and unstable.

I am a 38 year old male.  I have suffered my whole life with ADHD/ADD.  I never knew or understood why I behaived the way I did  until my son showed the same symptoms and was diagnosed.  I asked my doctor about my symptoms and he recommended a low 20mg a day dosage.  I did not sleep for 3 days  I thought my heart would burst  but in three days  I read 4 books  all 400+ pages.
At work  my productivity increased instantly. Instead of looking for the door  and at the clock  "bouncing off the walls" as my co-workers would tell me  I was focused  task orriented  and results driven.  My district VP  who I have known for over 10 years  even called and asked me  why my team is doing so well.  I have been on this drug for 6 months now  and it has helped me to change my life! I have my blood pressure checked regularly  I excercise more  because I can focus and not get bored out of my mind in 3 minutes  I eat better  because I can read labels and know what it is I am eating  because my mind is not changing thoughts every 2 seconds and I forget what the HELL I was reading to begin with  my wife LOVES ME  because I am focused when she talks to me and I can actually carry a conversation with her  because I can remember what she just said.  And you know what else  I actually sat down and wrote this message in just a few minutes.  I did not even get up  or even think about anything else  I did not have to stretch  scratch  move  fidget  adjust  look around  yawn  cough  or ANYTHING  because this drug helped me. I thanked my doctor  and I cried when I did  because I have awakened  my mind does not race  and after 38 years of life  my mind is clear.

I'm 43 years old and have taken ridaliun in the past with bad results. I have been on adderall for 6 months 15 mg twice a day. Bad thing is that after 3-4 hours I'm so tired and need to drink anything to pickj me up. I do not like the XR as it makes me too jumpy in the first 2 hours.
 I plan to increase my dosage but dread the side affects.
 Overall  this drug is addicting  helps with add and weight loss but I wish there were something safer.

i have depression and anxiety. I have trouble concentrating and focusing. I cant get simple things accomplished. i need to get help for my add.
thankyou   angela
helped me overcome overwhelming depression and to remain focused on the art of living

I am 38 yr old mother of two. My experience is the time release(XR) is the best form the non time release feels like you are on a roller coaster.  The time release is very smooth.  Although I started on 20mg I believe after 5 years on this and now down to 5mg a day this is a very hard drug on my body as a women.  I have two best friends on it and although we love the weight it keeps off and how organized we think we are on it we all believe there is a dark side to this drug that no one talks about. Everyone seems OK in our lives except our husbands.  There is an edgy/anger piece that goes along with this drug..  I think it effects our hormones in some way.  My suggestion is start on a lower dose and move up but I am looking for more natural choices because I think this drug makes life go by very quickly.  I also think as a women you can not help but get addicted to the way you burn more calories and it automaticly suppresses your appetite.  If you are on this and are having relationship problems then you might want to look at this drug as a reason and not other outside things. Also I think if you take the wrong dose it can actually make it harder to complete some things. This drug is in the same family as Meth amphedemines.  If you take this drug you should really think about the similarities to being a junkie!! I stopped taking it for 6 months and gained 30 pounds and I started sleeping a lot and my house became a disaster.  There is probably something better out there  but I have not found it.

Before i started taking Adderall  i was always tired and could not stay focused at work. I've been taking Adderall about 6 months now. It worked really well for the first 2-3 months. After that  i'm awake for maybe half the day and then i get migraine headaches that do not go away. My doctor is putting me on different medication.

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day

_comment_:
It works  it really does. Unfortunately  I became HIGHLY ADDICTED to this medication. I am 21 and a university student and have been on adderall since i was 19. In just two years i developed a 100mg+ habit per day  ended up literally going crazy  cutting  attempting suicide  committed to a psychiatric hospital  and then drug and alcohol rehab. Since I kicked adderall  I have been just fine. Kids won't tell you anything is wrong  because it makes them feel so good they want it more. It severely disrupts eating habits (I lost 35lbs  and as a 5'2" female  that's a lot)  sleeping habits  and overall mood. I also found a sharp decline in imagination and overall creativity. Irritability  dehydration  diarrhea  malnutrition  anemia  and withdrawals were part of my adderall use that was prescribed by a psychiatrist for ADHD. 
PLEASE  if you are a parent wondering if your kid should be on adderall (which is an amphetamine salt  which is the single purest form of SPEED)  think again. Is it worth it in the long run? It is SPEED that you're messing with here- incredibly serious drug. There are many many more behavioral modifications that can be taught that are much more effective  and MUCH MUCH less detrimental to overall mental and physical health. 
NOT WORTH IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
adderall has helped my adhd tremendously..what are the withdrawal symptoms??

I could not be where I am if it wasn't for adderall but I am at a point where I have started to get pretty nasty headaches from it.  I am faced with the daily decision of taking it and being able to focus but risk getting the debilitating headache or not taking it and being completely clueless about what my professor just said.  I have begun taking nsaids on a regular basis to counter the headaches.  If I were to decribe the headache it is a sinus like pain that starts around my eyes and is usually limited to one side of my head.  The length of time I have been taking it could be a factor but a headache is listed as a side-effect.

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: History

I must be the only person in the universe for whom Adderall had absolutely no effect at all. I felt no differently than I did before  no improvement or side effects or anything. . . Can anyone advise me why some people have NO reaction?  I will ask my doctor but wonder if any others have heard of such a thing.

Taking Adderall XR with suboxone makes a pill cocktail. The high from those two drugs combined is a whole new ball game. First of all Docs know nothing but to see you on your appointment and then get rid of you. If they payed any attention they would know that a person with a history of drug or alcohol abuse should not take adderall or adderall xr. But then again they keep us coming back for business. So  would that make them a legal drug dealer. Yes  it would. I had a chemical dependency to perscription painkillers. I realized something was really bad when I was taking them just to be able to function from day to day. I sought help because things were all jacked up. If I could make a difference in someone's life just by writing this little piece then all the pain I caused myself and everyone around me  then I would have to say it was worth it. If you have a chemical dependency the first thing you do is decide weather or not you want to continue that way of life  which is extremely painful. Second  commit to yourself in getting well. You will need a really good support system to help you through it. With hard work and dedication to yourself you will succeed. If you follow those three rules you will get through it with out a dought. If I had to go through it again I would have gone to the psychiatrist to get on suboxone so I could wing myself through it. I was on suboxone for one year exactly. If I would have just listened to my brother and not got on the suboxone I would have gotten over the emotional withdrawl after about 5 to 7 days. The physical withdrawls(tiredness unmotivated)would eventually pass around three to four weeks. So  you could get through it in a months time verses getting on suboxone and wasting a year of your life.
My 10 year old son has been on this medication for almost 5 years and it took a while to get the dose right but once we did we saw a tremendous difference in his performance at school.

Diagnosed w/ Adult ADD W/O Hypertension @ 53yo. Aderall has made an entire positive life change possible by allowing me to focus on something long enought to change it. I now have more completes on my list than not completed  1st time ever.

helps mr to settle down and enjoy life

I've struggled with ADD my entire life but my parents were totally against medicating me (thank you mom and dad) Instead they made an effort to get me help from tutors and personal coaches that taught me good organizational and study habits which helped a bit. I struggled all through out my 6 years of college and now at 26  moving into the ranks of working for myself and taking on several projects  I could really use some help. My buddy gave me some adderall and I probably got more work done in 2 weeks than my 6 years of college- mainly because I neither ate nor slept for days at time. I also found that I was able to pop these like skittles with frightening ease. I couldn't see taking this medication daily as I wouldn't risk my physical and psychological well-being for any amount of work or money. I believe this should be used as a last resort. One thing I have learned is to observe my work habits while on adderall vs. when I'm not and try to mimic those behaviors daily. This drug is certainly a tool for success but I feel that it shouldn't be used as a way of living.
It works it just makes you a zombie in your body. I litterally makes you crazy no joke. only take it as a last resort.

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: I was diagnosed with ADD at age 41  and prescribed 20mg 1x/day. It helped a little but not enough to cause me to really follow a treatment track with enthusiasm...typical ADD. Anyway  I am now 46; I have had 4 different employers in that time  plenty of stress  depression  anxiety  low self esteem  etc. Three years ago  I had the double sleep study which revealed that I have narcolepsy. So now  my sleep specialist has me taking 30mg XR in the morning  and Adderall tabs of 20mg at 9am/noon/3pm for a total of 90mg/day. I have gone through highs and lows with this drug - more highs than lows. I think that the biggest drag in this whole process is that Adderall is just a daytime life support system for my exhaustion; it does enable me to focus  hustle  retain instructions  etc. But - I still have an incurable sleep disorder which never allows me to get restorative sleep. I am definitely addicted to Adderall; I get anxious when my doctor goes on vacation because he has done it in the past  without notice! Needless to say  I am changing doctors. Finally  I can relate to people that complain about the zombie effect. I have a great ability to entertain my family and friends with my humor  and sometimes it will just disappear for days. My new doctor said that he is worried about my heart; I told him that I am at peace with "death by heart attack". He was not amused. I wasn't trying to be funny  just pragmatic. I need my Adderall and I think it works great for the right patient.

I will be 37 this Novemeber and I have suffered from ADD for as long as I can remember and at first the Adderall worked great but now i take 20mg 4xs a day and i can not take it 4xs it makes me very sleepy i get so upset at my self because when i am at work or cleaning my house i will start 3 or 4 things at once i feel like i am running my self crazy but everyone i talk to can not believe it makes me sleepy i need to change dr's because he thinks that its normal he said that might be how my body reacts to the drug but it is not helping at all.i am so ready for some relife

I have suffered with ADD since I was a small child. I got pregnant at 17 and was taken off all my meds. The doc told me that I would outgrow the ADD and probably wouldn't need to be put back on it after I had the baby. After a long 5 year struggle with the same problems I had as a child  my dr. decided to try me on straterra. I tryed it for 4 weeks as he suggested  and the only thing it did for me was drain my bank account. We tried several diffrent drugs  including the same one I took during childhood/adolesence without finding one that provided desired results. I was about to give up hope when the doctor decided to try adderall. A God send! I am now able to think clearly  something I haven't done in a while. I can concentrate  focus  and stay on task now. It helped me to be able to stay organized  and helped the constant aggrivation I suffered with. Thanks to this wonderful drug I no longer feel as if I am at war with my thoughts  I finally have some much needed relief from my mind.

I have been taking it since i was 12 years old now  they took me off cold turkey when i was 20 and i gained 100 pounds in less then one year. I was not me at all. When i turned 22 they put me back on it because i was showing signs of ADHD still. Ever since i have been back on it i am happy again  and i can do my job with no problems.

Adderall has helped me focus so much better and I have went to C's and D's to A's and B's in my grades.  My teachers have actually came up to me and asked if I  was the same person who was in their clas a week ago.  It has helped me get through fourth through sixth grade.  The only problem I have is that it made me want to do evreything at once and that really stressed me out.  I got mild depression becuase of that and I'm now taking an antidepressant AND Adderall.  It's kind of hard to remember to take both the drugs and I somtimes miss a few day on one or both of the drugs.  This drug worked on me but please find out exactly what it does to you before making a comitment to taking it.  Ask your doctor if you can start on the lowest dosage possible and graduly work your way up untill you find a dosage right for you.  Like any other medication it is a hit or miss and you should stop taking it if it worsens your condition or if you have side effects lasting longer than two weeks.  I hope my information helped!

I have been taking 10mg of Adderall for about 2 months now and am very happy with this medication.  I've tried Ritalin which made me feel nervous but after continued dosage increase did not help with focus & attention  and Wellbutrin which helped with focus & attention but had other intolerable side effects with increaded dosage. I had had some loss of appetite   agitation  and stomach upset with an additional 10mg in the afternoon (so I'm back to just 10mg in the morning)  but have had no loss of libido. As a Doctor myself  I have to stress that when it comes to Adderall in either the XR or IR forms  there is no grey area. There are those patients who do extremely well on this medication and others who were perhaps misdiagnosed or physiologically intolerant of the chemical makeup of the drug. The bottom line is

My 18 year old son was recently diagnosed with attention deficite disorder...with no real apparent symptoms.  Our family doctor decided it would help him concentrate in college.  Immediately I noticed that a generally tender-hearted goodnatured young man became cruel  moody and for lack of a better definition psychotic.  He started abusing alcohol  risky sexual behavior  and would lie about anything.  It was like a alien had taken over my son's body.  It has been a nightmare and I would never encourage any parent to give this drug to their children.  My son has been off of it for about 1 week and right now he is a fragile shell who has suffered with depression  vomiting  headaches etc.  My hope for his once bright future now rests on his ability to overcome an apparent addiction and not to be drawn back down that road.  This is not anything you want to put into your body.  I feel like my only son has been taken from me and I don't know if I will ever get that same bright eyed  enthusiatic young man back.

I have noticed that I am more hyperactive. I am constantly fidgeting with my hands and my legs are shake profusely. Also  my eating habits are terrible. I was at a slim 135 pounds to begin with before I began the medication and I know for a fact that I will have lost weight the next time I see my doctor. One side effect is loss of appetite. This effect is extremly noticeable. For me  I very very rarely feel hungry. Just last week I forgot to eat ANYTHING for two straight days. Overall though  if you are careful and responsible this is an effective and easy-to-use drug. Hopefully  this helps.

I've been diagnosed with ADHD since age 6  I am now 26 years old.  I'm overall satisfied with this medication.  I noticed that my mood seems to be more even  I have a better handle on my disorder versus the other medications I've taken  and most of my other symptoms are under control.  I have noticed weight loss but my doctor told me before hand that it would happen. Being that I gained some weight after I stopped my previous medication  I didn't mind that too much.  I have also noticed more dry-mouth than my other medications so I'm drinking a lot more water through the day  but I don't mind that so much as I drink a good amount of water anyway.  One thing that I will have to say is that I keep having to 'readjust.'  My doctor  who I love  started me on an extreme low dose and is working me up to my 'stable' point which has spanned over 8 months now.  Getting to the point of 'stable' is my biggest issue since precautions have to be taken. Due to the nature of this drug  that the risk of addiction is high  my doctor and I are taking it slow.

I have been taking adderall 20mg once a day and this drug is very affective in treating my ADHD.  I explained that I have a very hard time concentrating.  Whether face to face conversations  reading  or in meetings it was very difficult to give my undivided attention to someone or a group. Additionally  I have struggled for a long time in school  college especially and thought it was just lack of sleep. However  both of my brothers have ADHD and after talking to my doctor about my condition he recommended adderall 20mg.  I was jittery at first (simular to too much caffine) but now Im getting used to it.  I now do not crash everyday after work and no longer need my afternoon nap.  I also can focus on conversations and remeber things much better.  It enables me to be more productive and I can get much more stuff done than before.  It does curve my appetite too so make sure if you take this med. to eat as you did before.

i am a 16 year old. I started taking adderall at the age of twelve. When i was on the drug it was very effective. It helped me concentrate in school  calmed me down from acting out  and helped prevent me from doing bad things. Although it has done good  it has also done bad. For example  i started losing weight because i never had an appetite  i became more distant with people because i was quiet all the time from focusing on things  and i also became needy of it all the time. I have been off of the pills for about a year now and I'm doing just fine. It is extremely hard to get out of the habit of needing them. It takes time to get out of the habit  but eventually it will work. Trust me.  Adderall can be very addictive and although it can benefit you  it may also destroy you in some ways. So one tip to take into consideration if you want to start taking adderall is to start off at a low dosage and work your way up until you feel it is doing its job.

I Have been taking this medication for a little over a year now.  I was diagnosed with ADD as a child  but I not took the medication.  I am 35 now and am a small business owner.  I was making small  little stupid mistakes that I just easily overlooked.  My Dr. started me off with 30mg twice a day. I have seen these reviews and have yet to see someone taking that much.  I had all of the the effects for about a month and then they all eventually went away.  The drug overall has improved my attention disorder and even made me more productive.  It allowed all of my energy to be creative.  I still use it today at the same dosage but I found it better for me to take 60mg in the morning and let it run its course through the day.  If you do need to take it. Remember that every ones body responds differently to medication.  I suggest to experiment the time gaps in the beginning and see what best responds to your body.  You will become addicted to it after a while  no choice in that  but just use your months supply evenly.  It has been a success and I researched this med.. I accept the cons of this medication  but for me "someone who really needs it" the pros weigh out the cons.  it has made me more productive with my life and for my family responsibilities. If you "REALLY" are not diagnosed by a physician. Please remember that you will get a reverse effect and it will be equivalent to taking cocaine.  But for those who need it it will have a reverse effect and make you more focused and in a clear state of mind  without the million things around you distracting you from your realistic goal.
Good Luck and Be Wise! Parents  Be alert of your kid on this if applicable  it is becoming a known street DRUG for abuse. Thanks!

I am junior in high school and have been taking adderall for 3 years. At first it seemed like a miracle drug. My grades went up considerably and I felt that I had gained a sense of control. I was prescribed 30mg a day including one 20mg pill of adderall xr. The side effects were harsh in the beginning and I lost a lot of weight. The next 2 years I would take it regularly still having the same side effects but very mild. In short  I could go off the pill and feel fine for any amount of time. But I began to feel a sort of dependence on the drug about a year after. The loss of appetite seemed to be a motivation for me to be thin so i started to up my dose a little bit. My grades went from a 3.3 to a 2.7 and so i figured I was immune to the drug so I started to take even more. For the past about 6 months I have regularly been taking at the least 50mg and at most 70mg a day. Sometimes I don't know why I am taking it I just do. I can honestly say in the past week I have slept in total maybe 10-15 hours some nights not sleeping at all. My heart is constantly pounding and my hands are always shaking. I hate it but i can't help it. My parents dont hide my pills or anything and dont keep track of when they get it so it makes it easy for me.I am always very moody and today I had a nutri grain bar and thats it but I dont even feel hungry. I didnt think drugs prescribed to myself could be so addictive but they are. I suggest people not to take them to begin with.
worked good at first.  Major mood swings after a while

I have been taking Adderall since last November (08).  I was started on 20mg of Adderall xr  then went to 25 mg xr  and now I take 25mg xr in the morning around 6am  and then an Adderall IR  10mg  around noon to one p.m.  I think Adderall works great  the problem I had was that even though it is an XR formulation it seemed to wear off around noonish everyday.  I was never able to get "all day coverage".  In February my doctor added the 10mg IR "booster" and it has worked great ever since.  He told me that every one's body metabolism is different and some get longer coverage than others.  This is what worked for me.  I was worried about sleep issues being on this dose  the amazing thing is I actually feel like I sleep better since being on this medication.  When I lay down to go to sleep I don't have a million and one things floating through my head like I use to.  It's like the background "white noise" is gone.  My thoughts are so much clearer now and I can actually get things accomplished instead of 20 things half accomplished.  It's too bad people abuse this drug  it's makes it more difficult for people who use it for legitimate medical purposes to get it.  All of my other medications I can get a 90 day supply in the mail.  With Adderall I have to go to my doctors office every month and pick up my prescription in person.  Other than that absolutely no complaints.  Good luck to all.

Without a doubt this is an effective drug however it is powerful and has potentially serious side effects.  I've taken adderral for a few years now and it has been a tremendous study and work aid.  Those who take it must be careful due to the outright strength of this stuff.  For about a year I would say that I was addicted to adderral.  I would take too much  too often and get more from friends when I ran out.  During this time I had extreme mood swings  anxiety  loss of sexual interest ability  etc.  Plain and simple I was not myself at all.  I lost weight and I felt as if my personality changed.  After realizing the dilema I stopped taking it for a bit and got healthy.  Now I take the recommended dosage on the prescibed schedule.  It is effective and since I am aware of the side effects I make sure that I am eating right  sleeping enough  etc.  All and all it is an effective drug however those taking it should be very mindful of the possible downside.  Finally  I do not like most children should take this drug  and none should do so in high doses.  If children cannot do anything without the aid of medication  then they will be dependant on this stuff their whole like.  I still function and get work done in a demanding job with or without adderall.

I am a 49 yr female... I always knew I was differrent. I felt like information went into my brain but went right out the other side. I would read  listen to a lecture or be in a conversation and end with no recollection of the information I was given. How was I to explain this to a doctor... I thought they would think I was crazy. I rehearsed over and over what I would say to them to make them believe there truely was a problem. How much easier it would be to go in and show them a cut  bruise or broken bone... they could fix it. How could they diagnose or fix a problem they couldn't see and I couldn't explain. I spent 7 years in and out of the doctors office. She first put me on prozac  treated me for an inter-ear infection  had me get all of my old fillings replaced  got glasses treated me for allergies  etc. All these things were good but there was still something much more. She gave up  one day she said "I can't help you". Talk about a heart break and a validation that I was crazy. One day I read an ad on Straterra... explaining the symptoms of adult ADHD. I asked my doctor if there were special test for that. She said yes  as she rolled her eyes  but she would have to refer me to a shrink...here we ago again! 
The psycologist had me diagnosed in moments. No special tests were needed. The Straterra has helped for about 6 years now but there was still something more that I couldn't put my finger on. I have been going to doctors now for another 3 years to finally get one to take my extreme fatigue seriously. I took a sleep test and I have mild narcolepsy. My doctor has recently added adderall and I am finally content that what I have been silently struggling with all my life has been discovered and properly treated. I breaks my heart to pieces to think I raised my 3 children without this help. I struggled so badly just to make it through each day and hide my feelings of "stupidness". Now at almost 50  I feel like I have a clear mind...and a new start on life.
I took Adderall for 10 years in school  and for ten years I could not sleep  eat  and eventually developed severe depression.  USE THIS MEDICATION ONLY AS A LAST RESORT.

I was prescribed Adderall to help me focus on my job while going through some overwhelming personal problems.  I have to say this medicine is a life-saver.  Instead of starting my day with 20 tasks and ending the day with 20 tasks half-done  I now concentrate on one task at a time and do no move on to the other task until the previous one is complete.  

Side effects for me
This has been a life saver for me. I have not had a single problem from this medication.  My son deveolped some tic's and we took him off of it.

Took this a a last resort for severe depression in tandem with Zoloft.  It reactivated the initial benefits of the primary antidepressant and helped with me
chronic fatigue and narcolepsy due to my fibromyalgia. It's the best combo I've tried in years and I'm praying it lasts awhile.
My boyfriend takes Adderall  and sometimes  he has dramatic mood swings. He get extremely irritable  and it scares me. I feel like I don't even know him anymore.

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: I had a headache for the first two days that I took Adderall. After  the third day  things began to go just fine. The headaches were gone  I could focus  stay alert  and finish duties at work chores at home  and for some reason felt more energized!!

I am 21 years old. I have been on and off adderall for as long as i can remember. I loved it before  it helped me in school  and helped me loose a lot of weight. I just got back on it and first of all the price is CRAZY EXPENSIVE $160 for 30 pills! 2nd of all ive notice i do get alot more done in my day at a faster pace but i have to be doing something at all times  i smoke like crazy and i was just about to quit  i drink water excessively  dont eat  get headaches  iregular heart patterns  and I CANNONT SLEEP! I take a 20mg adderall XR at 7
my 11-yr old takes this 2 times a day. he is sometimes tired on the med. by the end of the day. i mean drained. sometimes he will make noises or say things out of nowhere. i wonder if it is normal.
I think overall my ADHD has improved  however I still find that I at times can't seem to pay attention.

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: I was prescribed adderall 10 mg bid for excessive daytime sleepiness last year/summer. It worked wonders for me. Kept me very alert more focused. Only side effects I had was a little shakey  mild high blood pressure but only when I first took it  and higher resting pulse rate. I also had lack of appetite which I thought was a plus. And weight loss. I lost my job and couldnt continue to take my adderall. I was back to my sleepy fatigue ways it was horrible. So I was dying to go back on the adderall plus I had gained about 30 lbs!!!So I have now been back on the adderall 10 mg bid and my side effects have gotten worse. I feel the med works like it did before but my b/p is high sometimes 150/100 and my resting pulse is 90-100. I sometimes get "pangs" of pain in my chest like 2-3 times a day and I have shortness of breath sometimes. Like I need to take a deep breath. It is making me nervous. I think my b/p was a little high before I started adderall so not sure if its directly the adderall.I do have loss of appetite again but have not lost any weight. Which sucks!! But I have only been on adderall for about a month. So maybe I just didnt lose it yet.When I first started taking the meds last summer I did sometimes take up to 40 mg in one day.I know Im not supposed to but I would if I wanted to study or get up early the next day. My fatigue/sleepiness gets so bad sometimes I physically cant get up in the morning. And sometimes I can sleep like a whole day. So maybe thats why I lost more weight  too. Has anyone else had these side effects that I am now having? I have an app. with my primary physician this week for the high b/p. Just to make sure all is ok. Im only 30 yrs old and dont want heart probs.now!! But I like the adderall and hope I can stay on it.
KEEPS ME ALERT
It really helped with my ADHDD. It did  however  make me really shaky in the hands and legs.

I have ony been taking Adderall for a few days now and have noticeable heart palpitations which are making me feel jittery. My dr. started me on 10 mg twice a day (she recommended 6-8 hours apart)for 2 days and just today I started taking 15 mg twice a day. And she may want to take me up to 20 mg twice a day depending how I am feeling. Just 5 day ago I was switched to generic Celexa (I take 10 mg twice a day for 1 week and then will increase to 20 mg twice a week) Rigt now I am not feeling too great....I have periods where I feel good and have energy  other times I am in the dumps and tired. Not really sure if this is the right meds for me....The jitteriness is bothering me mostly...anyone have any thoughts about this?
Used long term for ADDHD.

I am a 37year old wife and mother. within the past 2 years was diagnosed with depression and sleeping disorder that probably was inherited. I take 20mg of prozac and 45mg of adderall spread out during the day. I was very happy with it at first.Its like i woke up completly for the first time in my life and got everything that i needed to get done accomplished. I have now noticed that I bruise easily  my limbs become numb and tingly occasionally and my circulation seems to be altered a little to where I have noticed it cant be good. My feet do swell and they turn purple if I apply a little pressure to them. My perception of objects seem to be a little off cause i run into everything. I also keep these lumps under my scalp? It seems to stay in the same top portion of my scalp and it just feels lumpy like theres fluid or something trapped in there. Would like to find out if anyone is experiencing the same things. It does wonderful keeping me from taking a nap everychance i get because i just cant go on but I am starting to wonder if it is worth it?

I have been chronically late most of my life so much so it has cost me jobs. Etc. I also was the kid who just looked out the window in grade school. My psych  decided to give me a test and bam  I have ADD. and was given the generic version. After reading these reviews  I can relate. I have horrible tirade mood swings  I don't feel like I am getting more work done during the day  I focus on things that are not a priority like ebay. I also leave the office so exhausted I feel like I have lost me. I have no energy to do anything. Errands are a big deal  working out  forget it. I feel like I have no time  because I waste a lot of it. Procrastinating. It is ruining my life. The only good thing is it keeps my hunger at bay  and my weight is at 120. I think I am taking more and more to keep awake during the day. What is so wonderful  your doc gives you this stuff  and no one tells you to watch for side effects. I wonder if I was off all these meds how I would be. I am 41 and feel like a 90 year old taking a bunch of pills each day. One to bring me up  one to bring me down  one for depression one for anxiety. I have never been one to lose patience  and I lose it all the time. I have ruined relationships because of it. I react  don't think.  I feel like I need rehab.

I began taking Adderall about 5 years ago. I am 33 years old and wonder what my life could have been like if I had this medication during my school years. Adderall has been a lifesaver for me! I always felt like I was being left behind in school because the others could learn things so much faster than I could  but since Adderall I feel like I am on an even playing field.

This medication makes me have terrible moodswings.  I sometimes can't controll them.  I also get serious pounding headachs when the med wears-off.  It sometimes lasts for hours.  I also sometimes get numbness in my face and arm.  Today was the worst experiance I had with this.  I am 35 and take 15mg 2x per day 3 months now

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: I help me get around the house getting it clean.
I can't "function" without this medication.  Only downside  my blood pressure is steadily increasing the longer I take it.

I come from an good middle class  educated family and discovered that I was ADD recently.  
I am a high school teacher  an athlete and a father of a beautiful 5 year old autistic child.  As I learned about autism I saw there was a connection with ADD and I thought I had it.  Well I have always been very ant-meds but I was still very curious to try and see what meds could perhaps do for me.  My ADD symptoms have been fatigue  innattention  foggy thinking  procrastination to name a few.  For the last week I have been taking 10 mgf of Adderall twice daily.  Although I have only taken the medication for 5 days it has been really helping me tremendously.  I am calm and relaxed and I can comfortably sit still.  I have a lot more patience for my son and I feel better in general.  I think people should however be very careful with this medication and take it very carefully. For me this medication has (for the very short time I have tried it) been a huge help.

This is a Reply to the woman who posted a question on 3/20/09.... Edema (Swelling/Fluid) in the ankles & feet is a seriouse side effect from Adderal and indicates a circulatory problem (blood flow) usually due to a heart problem. Most likely a temporary side effect but a serious one. If you stop taking the drug  symptoms should go away unless serious damage has been done or it's poss it could be related to another condition or a drug/food interaction with Adderall. Call your doctor/pharmacist. Also  Review drug info on WebMD.

When I started taking it  I focused better  my grades went up  life was easier  and I lost a few pounds. But after 6-9 months I became dependent on the drug and it almost ruined my life  please be careful.
its the most wonderful man made drug made!
didn't even take it.  call the pharmacist and it cost $200 after my insurance.
Changed my life  went from college drop out to straight A student. Its like putting on a pair of glasses...no more blurrines.
its helped me be calm an listen when my wife talks i dont have to interupt her anymore cause of me being so impatient i listen and focus so much more and better

My husband's doctor prescribed Adderall for depression.  It gave him the worst side effects ever--abusive.  So much so  my family became concerned for my safety.  He's off it now and will NEVER take it again.

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: I was taking 3 times the amount that one should take.  Max. dose is 60 mg per day and I was taking 150 mg per day with no help.  I was very irritable and it was not effective at all.
I've lost 35lbs  plus get 10x more studying and work done.

I was prescribed Adderall for ADD without hyperactivity. I began with the XR but found that the dosage of 40mg was to much so I cut my dosage to 20mg.  I still felt like I was getting to much to quick  so I asked my doctor to precribe the regular 20mg generic which are scored so that I can break them in half and continue the meds at an even pace.  I have great focus at work  but by the time the day is finish I am so tired and washed out I have to rest.  This medication gives my brain the ability to focus perfectly however my energy level has not increased all that well. I eat less  but I've not lost weight and not that I'm looking to loose by taking this. I have notice a major problem with water retention and the swelling of my feet  ankles and hands. Almost like I am bloated.  I was wondering if anyone else was having any of these symtoms.  If you have please let me know.
it worked very well for me but i did have a lot of irritability
Loss of appetite. Sleeplessness

I was prescribed this drug after I became severally depressed  one of my symptoms was a severe loss of focus. It worked well in the beginning  but as time went on it became less effective.  Now I have pulmonary hypertension and other conditons that I believe were brought on by this drug.  Pulmonary hypertension is a fatal disorder.

If you know yourself well enough  and know your limits- this drug can improve your life tremendously. I don't recommend if you have addictive tendencies. It has turned my life around. I can concentrate now. No adverse sexual side effects for me.
I have tried several antideppressents after a divorce  and this drug has saved my life.  I was able to finish college while the divorce was going on and not concentrate obbessively about my ex.
does it make you loos weight

I have been on Adderall for almost 2 years now. I like the XR pills MUCH better than the fast acting pills  but can no longer afford them due to recently losing my job and health insurance. I used to take 25mg (XR) in the morning and that worked well  and I noticed less side effects.  Now I take 10mg of the generic amphetamine salts 2 x's a day. Since starting on the medication I have less difficulty prioritizing my day and schedule  retaining information  starting and finishing tasks  and paying attention in general. On the other hand  I have developed nervous habits I can't break like biting my lips  playing with my nails and a crazy desire to smoke  feel awkward in certain social situations (which is TOTALLY not me)  feel edgy and moody at the end of most days  and sometimes have trouble making fast decisions and conveying my thoughts clearly. Over all  I feel the benefits of the drug outweigh the negative side effects (I used to be a total spaz and be asked almost daily if I was "on crack"  which really messed with my self esteem) so I continue to take it  but I cant help but wonder if I should try something else.  Any suggestions?

I'm a 31yr old man and suffer from a  severe personality disorder.I've been taking 90mlgrs a day for 6 years now and it allows me to function well.I've had no ill efects and it really has improved my dayly life.

36 y/o Female.I have been taking this medication for almost 2 yrs now and it really helps pull my thoughts back into order as far as the ADHD goes. I have had very bad headaches from it though but the benifits do outwiegh the bad things.This is the only medicine i have taken that consistantly works and does not loose effectiveness in a short period.I do not have any other side effects from it and I would recommend giving it a try if your healthy enough to do so.

I have add without the hyperactivity. at first the drug caused insomnia and i lost my appetite. it took nearly 2 months before these side affects subsided. but even so It was worth the trouble. i can now read books and watch movies etc

My son is taking this medication for his ADD. He was on Concerta previously but it caused him to have some patches of hair missing in the back of his head after 3yrs of taking it. He started on the Adderall about 2 months ago and thank goodness has never had any of the side effects that go with certain ADD medications. I am very satified with this treatment and he is able to concentrate at school and get through his day without getting in trouble. He does not take it on the weekends or while school is out.Very effective medication and I am very satisfied!
I have been diagnosed with Narcolepsy and was prescribed Adderall for this; however  there are many times when I don't have any reduction in symptoms.

I have had ADD ALL of my life. My PCP prescribed ADDERALL 10mg twice a day. With the very first dose I experienced chest tightness  palpatations  and high blood pressure. Through the symptoms  I was able to complete tasks and computer entries with speed and ease. I was able to read like never before. Not only did I retain what I read I enjoyed it. However  the symptoms are not lessening and I must discontinue the medication in FEAR OF MY LIFE!  Sadly  I must resume my depressed  dysfunctional  frustrated life.

I have always had a hard time staying focused on tasks and keeping my mind on track.My Dr. first prescribed me 20 mg 2x a day and I was edgy and had hard time sleeping so I dropped my dosage to 10 mg 1x a day or maybe another half if needed and am doing great

My son takes this medication for ADHD. In the beginning he had shortness of breath and hot flashes. After a couple days he was dizzy and has an upset stomach. He did not eat very much. My son would focus more in school and be more calm but he developed anger issues  and he would yell at his parents and siblings which he hadn't done before. The littlest thing would annoy him  and at times he seemed depressed. Sometimes my son would say do I have to take my pill today.

I was very pleased with Adderall for about 2 months. My brain finally woke up  I could focus and get things done  I had energy  I would gladly do dreaded tasks  and I finally felt normal. Then after 2 or 3 months  it was not so effective. At 4 months my doctor increased the dosage from 10 MG to 15 MG twice a day. The outcome

I am 22 years old but have suffered with ADD for years..starting in 5th grade i got tested for learning disabilities every year and got the same answer back i was fine... I struggled through school getting frustrated with everything because i literally couldnt do it... The summer before my senior year in highschool i suffered major depression and got sent to a very intelligent psychiatrist and after 30mins with him he diagnosed me with ADD and put me on adderal my senior year i got all A's and B's with earlier years left me barley passing if i passed at all.. putting aside the frustration of it taking almost my whole school career not knowing and struggling adderal completly changed my life and helped me fulfill many dreams..i am now in college taking courses to get a degree in accounting and I will finish is August...I am still taking adderal and have been on the presidents list having a 3.8 GPA the whole time! It has helped me so much and would recommend it to anyone who seems to struggle with ADD!

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: my muscles seem to ache all over still having problems staying alert during the day

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: This has been SUCH a blessing to me and my family!!!  I had been mis-diagnosed for years for fatigue and last year began falling asleep at any time of the day...could sleep for days.  Finally  last year a specialist in sleep disorders diagnosed me with hypersomniance...I started on Adderall SR  but due to costs  I now use 20 mg 2x/day.  If I am late for my second dose I do not need an alarm....I am drowsy within an hour!

I was diagnosed with manic depression 2004..started wellbutrin xl 300mg until march 2008. I didn't feel as if i was depressed i just had a hard time starting finishing anything. Then the doctor diagnosed me with a.d.d. i've been taking adderall 10mg 2x daily for 5 weeks now and its amazing what a difference it has made. I do get a little edgy when i'm coming off of it but the pros completely out number the cons. The only thing i was wondering is that i get the chills while on it...i've asked others who take it and they never heard of it but i experience it. I do drink a lot of ice water when im taking it throughout the day but i've drank ice water before when i wasn't on it and never got chills. so i was j/w if anyone has experienced that?

I sought help when I found it nearly impossible to sit and concentrate on my school work. My mind was everywhere  I had no motivation to do the work  couldn't explain why. My ADHD is.. well  I am hyperactive just to the extent that I find I am always moving something  just slightly  for instance like wiggling my toes. I'm also the daydreamish type  which isn't easy in college. Benefits of Adderall  in my case  included more energy  increased focus  increased calm  and an increased ability to express what I had to say because my thoughts weren't as scattered. I could follow the teacher easier in class  things made much more sense.. it was as if my mind was on steroids or something. Like steroids  Adderall had its side effects too  which in my case included mood changes when it wore off (I heard Adderall XR prevents that  but haven't tried)  but I'm talking extreme irritability  and normally I am not like that at all.. so personality changes.. I kept to myself  felt my empathy leave  feelings and emotions numbed SIGNIFICANTLY. felt dead inside. Sure  I could concentrate on whatever I CHOSE  and I didn't magically want to do school work  that's the catch. If you're like me  you still have to make that conscious decision to do the work.. and once you do decide to  it is a heck of a lot easier to concentrate. If you start the doses do so slowly.. when I was on too high a dose  I felt so stressed  had high blood pressure  & I was angry  & too concentrated. Please consider trying other options first. I got off adderall  was tired for daysss  learned more about ADHD & more about myself.. & I don't have it all figured out but I feel alive & unaltered & like myself & EVERYONE can tell when the real me is showing.. having people who understand & love me the way I helps me want to care for myself better by eating better  sleeping earlier  exercising & relaxing more  & being alone  without distractions when I study. Be easy with yourself  DO NOT GIVE UP  you ARE NOT alone!

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: I suffered from fatigue  depression and daytime sleepiness for 9 years.  In addition  I have severe generalized anxiety disorder.  I tried every anti-deppresant ever invented with no improvement.  Adderall 20 mg 2X a day works mircacles for me. No fatigue no anxiety no depression or daytime sleepiness. I tried Provigil which increased my anxiety.  Provigil is too $$$ and ineffective in my opinion.  I truely beleive that Adderall has many uses other than ADD/ADHD and Narcolepsy disorders.  Further research should be done to prove it.

OMG...Where do I start? I almost died being on this drug. I had horrible heart palpitations  racing pulse  could not sleep (EVER)  OCD symptoms>>>I washed my hands about 50 times a day until they bled  aggressive behavior (I am not agressive nor was I ever until Adderall  I could not sit still for a minute  I had to be moving all the time  I had shortness of breath  I started grinding my teeth. When I first started this drug I was of average weight. As the months went on  I became skeletal. (Not attractive for those of you that abuse this drug for your own screwed-up purposes)Bottom line is I did a bang-up in school but ADDERALL ALMOST KILLED ME!!! (BTW the Dr. (aka hack) who prescribed this for me should have had his medical license revoked at the very least) He helped in what could have been my death by prescribing it improperly.  A good MD was visibly angry when he learned of the total incompetence of this guy. He could not believe the danger he had put me in concerning Adderall. Needless to say  I am doing MUCH BETTER now>>>alive  not dead (lol) So there is my NIGHTMARE of the SPEED they call ADDERALL. I even left out some gory details

I feel like many doctors are prescribing far to high of a dosage of this medication to start. I am currently prescribed 30mg/day in 10mg tablets. I take one and a half before heading to my early classes  the other half approximately 5 hours later to get through my remaining classes  and am still able to come home and take a nap in the afternoon before taking the third one in the evening to study. Following this dosage I have never been shaky  dizzy  sleepless  or anything other than focused and happy.

I simply don't understand how a doctor could start someone at a dose of 30mg at a time twice a day. That's asking for a heart attack. I've thought about switching to the time release form but I like having the ability to modify how much I'm taking at each point in the day so I'm most productive.

I have recently started to do cardio exersizes and notice that my heart rate is staying in a danger zone 175 beats/ minute and am trying to figure if this is linked to the adderall I take. adderall 30mg x 2 daily is my dosage.

I have been on Adderall for many years. This drug has helped me very much. As a child no Dr. knew what I had. They thought I was just a very active child. That it would pass. When it did not pass they put me on Ritalin. Then after about the 6th. grade my father said it was all in my head. So he took me off of it. Until about 6 yrs. ago I went on Adderall. It has saved mylife. I can sit and talk to someone without getting up or asking over and over what they said. I can start and finish things. Yes I eat a little less but to me I do not care. I came from a time when there was no drugs not even a name for it. The Dr.s made my mother think she was a bad mother. So yes this drug can be used for bad. If not taken the right way. But for people like me its the answer to my problems.
I see a more intolerable child  really wired up. More difficult.

I have been taking Adderall 20mg 2x daily for the past year. My grades in college improved dramatically (I am now graduated) and I am very focused  accomplishing any task hand. This works great  however  if I am tired and I take this medication I will get lightheaded and have heart palpitations. I suggest not taking this medicine in the late afternoon or evening because it WILL prevent you from getting a good nights sleep. Other then those few down points  this drug has changed my life. If taken responsibly it does more good then harm. Please watch out for what I have experienced

My daughter seems much more focused  however she she had some wicked mood swing nad a loss of appetite as well.  She has had rappid heart beats trble sleeping.  The most disturbing is there seemes to be some skin breakouts that have to be related along with some preprubesic smells.  She is only 8 years old and a quiet one at that  The skin breakouts a re painful to her.  Anyone that knows about this or can help?

I hate this med for my adhd. It makes me feel like my skin is crawling. I was on Vyvanse and I loved it. But  my doctor switched me for two months to see how it would do for the long days at school  work  home etc. Just bad bad bad. One  and the only good thing I can can about it is that it started working right away. Then  when it kicked into high gear it was all down hill.

This medicine made me have serious headches  I felt like I was shaking all over my body. It's like speed  expect it's perscribed. People are easily addicted to it  you suffer withdrawal symptons like you would a drug. I do not suggest this medicine.

This medication has worked since the first month i have been on it. I had no problem getting school work done  taking notes  taking tests  doing homework  paying attention at meetings  finishing all my jobs at work and keeping my room organized. It seemed to always do its job  but without ANY say was changed to another medication and seem to experience much anger  no appietiet  a feeling of numbness and get depressed at the end of the day. Aderall was the medication that worked for me  not Vyvance.
I have been on Adderall Oral for 1 year now  20-25 mgs a day with a 'holiday' at least once a week . The positive

I started taking Adderall for ADD about 3 years ago. It works wonderful for the ADD symptoms. I was able to study and concentrate. However  the side effects are not worth it. I had insomnia  shortness of breath and increased heart rate. I felt like my heart was going to beat right out of my chest. I now deal with my ADD symptoms without medication and I'm a lot happier.
CALMING EFFECT

My ADD symptoms reitivly improved with Adderall  but I started to clench my teeth. A few months after starting it  The pharmacy had trouble getting it   there was a mix up with the Dr. and I couldn't get it for a few weeks. I started up again and had HORRABLE  side  effects! collapsed  was in the hospital for several days. And after. that  my teeth are ALL loose  and I need extensive dental work.
I have been experiencing breathing difficulties while taking this medication.

I was supposed to be on Strattera but Health Plus of Mi. wanted me on Adderral first. I'm on it  10mg per day and am so stoned and dissoriented I can hardly stand it. It did not help the ADD. I am having really strange thoughts  like the dog in a bowtie and tux  and laughing my butt off over anything. Tried to tell Health Plus I can't take amphetamines  Bureaucrats playing Doctors!

I started taking Adderall XR a year ago  w/o a prescription.  I am in my last year of college and up until last year  I could never pay attention in class or study.  I started taking 20mg when I had to study  and instantly my grades improved.  I now take it whenever I have class to attend or when I am studying  which is between 2-4 times a week.    I start to feel it about 30-60 mins after I take it. If I'm tired  it wakes me up completely(I am never tired during its duration). It lasts about a total of 6 hours for me (female  110 pounds).
During these hours  I only desire to study and learn. In class  I am now very attentive and class goes by so much quicker for me.  In the past  I just daydream and can't stand sitting there for more than 1.5 hours.  Now  I can sit through a 5 hour class.  I also participate a lot in class now  it makes me want to show everyone how smart I am  haha.  However  when I am on it  I do not like people talking to me because all I want to do is study. People now always tell me how much of a nerd I am  which makes me feel really happy

I have been able to concentract and absorbe what I have read.  In the past  my reading skills (comprehension) has been susbtantially low.  After taking adderal/oral  my slills and comprehension have improved drastically.

I HAVE DEPRESSION AND ADD WITH LITTLE OR NO ENERY.. SLEPT ALL THE TIME NEVER WANTED TO DO ANYTHING  WAS GOING TO LOSE MY JOB BECAUSE I COULDNT FOCUS AND THEN I FOUND ADDERALL. ONLY AT 5 MG DAILY I FEEL A HUGE DIFFERENCE BEEN ON IT FOR A MONTH NOW. I CAN CONCENTRATE AND GET WORK DONE AND I HAVE SOOO MUCH ENERGY. I ALSO TAKE IT WHEN IM FEELING TIRED AND LAZY  AND WITHIN 15 MINS IM AWAKE AND READY TO GOT WHICH HELPS MY DEPRESSION ! I RECOMEND THIS DRUG HIGHLY HELPED ME GET MY LIFE BACK AND CAN ENJOY IT WITHOUT FEELING TIRED. ALSO LOST 17 LBS IN 3 WEEKS !!!!!

I was not the normal add patient. my legs would shake all the time  my mind was else where constantly  i was not hyperactive  i could not listen and write at the same time  and had to stare into the eyes of whoever was talking in order to follow a conversation. Above all i was so unorganized in thoughts and tasks. Adderall changed my life. Its not a drug that instantly makes you organized or extremely good in school  that is your part  it just gives you a boost and focus that you need  but without effort on your part things wont change that much. I have to say this medication does change one as a whole  in every aspect of life.

This drug is an excellent solution to the ADD I have  not with hyperactivity. The bad rap that these medicatios get due to the minority or those who abuse it is criminal. This drug and other medications of it's class are so difficult to get for those of us who do use it responsibly  the pharmacies do not want to carry it  due to cost or lack of need. The doctors are refusing to treat with it and rely on inadequate and ineffective subsitutions.

I am 41 years old  and have had the worst life ever  ever since I was younger  I have made millions of mistakes  many bad decisions  dropped out of school  never finished or accomplished anything  never got a degree  and now work as a waitress with 6 children to support  that 3 of the 6 all have different fathers. I had dislexia as a child  and when I was younger  if anyone in our family had a problem  it was to be kept a secret. I finally got help  and found out I have ADHD. I have been on this medication for 3 months now  and what a complete turnaround  talk about 360! I can focus more on important things  I even noticed a change in my driving  instead of running around like a chicken with its head cut off  I have slowed down and started enjoying things  and am much better at dealing with with problems instead of running away from them  I have also been writing a journal everyday  and remembering things alot better  and feel I am thinking before I open my mouth first. the only problem I have noticed lately  is that at night  I get a little edgy. other than that I love the fact that I feel like I am finally in control of all the racing things that used to go on in my head  and now I can sit back and relax for a change  and organize my priorities  whereas before I could not.

I have been on Adderall for four months now and it has helped me tremedously in school. The only question I have is sometimes I stay up all night studying for an exam and the next day it feels like my heart is going to jump out of my chest. Almost as if I am having a heart attack. Is this something I should be worried about?

I am a programmer that fights with depression. I had tried Effectior  Wellbutrin  Serequel and others but all had side effects that were not good for my work/life.
Adderall seems to work best with me. It helps my mood  keeps me at the keyboard longer without wandering around the internet and stuff and helps me take care of issues in life before they becomes tragedies. If you suffer from depression but do not like the effects of the SSRI drugs  give Adderall a try.
