_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_:
I was not able to focus  stay on tasks  my mind raced  etc. I was very iratated  anxious  no patience and not able to function like everyone else.  I was extremely tired all the time.  I would even suffer from depression and not know why.  

I was precribed Adderall and I am a totally different person now.  I have been taking Adderall for over 2 yrs now and am able to function normally and am ready to go to sleep around 10pm everynite instead of having insomnia!!!

I am a successful nationally known professional advertising photographer who was on Adderall for about five years and then decided that I did not need it anymore because all of my old ADHD habits where mostly gone. I was off of them for about three months and all of those long gone adhd habits that had played havoc with my life started coming back one by one. Unpaid parking tickets  loosing my keys  rash decisions  unfinished project after unfinished project. Within six months I had almost lost my photography business that I had worked so hard for and had collections agencies after me etc.  Wow what a bust to my ego! I guess I really do need to be on Adderall. It's as if when I am not on Adderall I know exactly what it is I need to do to keep my life running smooth...I put together my to do list but the to do list never gets completed. Yes I am a successful advertising photographer with lots of talent...but without the discipline and focus to apply that talent my world falls apart. I guess I just need to take it...it is what it is. I know there are lots of talented artists who take adderall...and I do not feel it makes me any less creative....or for that matter any more creative. How one little adderall XR pill makes the difference between being reasonably disciplined and totally irresponsible  however  is beyond me...but for me the reality is just that. I am now back on Adderall 20 MG XR and things are going great again. Hope this was helpful to any other artists out there who are struggling with the to medicate/not to medicate question. In my case the choice was made for me...I do not even think I would still be in business without this drug..no kidding.
I have to take it twice a day  for ADD/ADHD it works very good  it keeps me alert and focused.  I used to tke Ritalin  however this works even better.
focused  lack of shaky hands  able to organize a tast and complete  operating more in the moment.

I asked my doctor about the effects of this medication on weight loss  and he says it works about 75% of the time for that. I have lost 20 lbs  and it does curb my appitite. I must not have ADD or ADHD because the side effects are it puts me to sleep  I sleep better while on it  My dosage is the generac version 20mg 3 times a day on Monday  Tuesday  Thursday  Friday.
On Mondays I feel a little more alert  but after that I just want to take a nap. It has no negative effects on my pulse or BP.
it did a good job calming me down and letting me really focus.

I have had ADHD  most likely since I was a young kid (I'm now 24)  but diagnosed a little over 1 year ago.  I recently finished graduate school  and stopped the Adderall since I stopped seeing the MD.  Now that I've been back on it (about 2 weeks) I'm much more focused  I don't drift off when I'm speaking to clients and feel more motivated to finish my work on time.  I'm also  not binging as often as I used to  which is extremely helpful since I have gained 10 pounds in the last 6 months.  I don't feel aggressive or angry to the point where its affecting my life and hurting others.  Of course  I still have to make some behavioral changes to improve my organizational skills  but that's not something any medication can fix.  Don't expect it to change everything  as part of the treatment for ADHD is to learn new tools to combat the symptoms.  This medication is not a good idea if you or any family members have a history of substance abuse or dependence  since you are predisposed to those conditions.  If you have any psychiatric issues in addition to the ADHD  you must speak with your doctor about them  since treatment will be counterproductive.  You play the greatest role in your treatment-not the medication.

I've been on Adderall Oral about 4 months and am a full time student which the medication really helps with focusing on my school work and not getting side tracked as much. Just wondering if anyone experiences dry mouth  and constipation? Is there something I can do to correct these side affects or maybe just needs more time taken  since it has only been 4/5 months? Does anyone know about hair loss? Or is it maybe just my hair growth cycling ??? Please email me "From- Medications" "Subject-Adderall" if you know or have experienced any of these things on Adderall. Thanks so much... marebare

My son has been taking Adderall XR for two years he is 11. He has improved his focus at school. Surprisingly even his handwriting improves with the medication. His teachers can tell immediately if I forget a dose. It works well for him in school  but he has gone from being a sweet and gentle kid to an angry person. He acts almost manic- huge mood swings- from happy and confident to overreacting and hypersensitive and angry. I am not sure how to manage his schooling if I take him off of it  but his mood disorder is becoming more pronounced as he is nearing adolescence.

It works great and I'm more focused; however  I have been breaking out more since I've been on it.  Not sure if it is related  but I'm 49 years old  so it is a bit strange.  Anyone else having the same problem?

I was diagnosed with ADD in the third grade and was part of a national study (I Later learned) researching Rittalin<----(Spell Check). This was my second round in the third grade after being held back because of lack of attention and comprehension. Throughout the years I went off and on with various ADD medications trying to find out what works best for me. I am now looking at graduating college in December and was prescribed Adderall at the beginning of this semester. I have been a stellar student this semester and have accomplished more in one semester than I have in my entire collegiate career. I echo some of the previous posts regarding the problem with jitters and increases in tobacco use. I am not a a doctor and in no way am I posing as one on this blog. However   i would recommend if you are seeing an increase in your tobacco habits try using hard candies to suck on when you have the urge to smoke your 4th cigarette in a row  this helped me reduce my urges and aided the hand to mouth habit that is associated with many smokers. Again  this may or may not help you at all and if you are concerned you should inform for doctor immediatly.

i have been taking adderall since 8th grade I'm now a senior in high school. i felt like a new person when first started using it helped a lot in school  i felt focused   + weight loss. i have been on and off adderall partly because there are no refills and it was hard getting back and forth the doctor. this school year is my last year of high school and so far things have been really stressful im living home to home  and im surrounded by drug addicts. my main focus is graduating and hopefully making something of myself i feel totally dependent on adderall to make this happen. im supposed to take two 30MG capsules per day but  whenever i feel it wear off i take another and im afraid its taking control of  my life. EFFECTS

Absolutely amazing.  I was diagnosed w/ ADHD 2 yrs ago.  I've been taking this and it's like I have a whole new brain in my head.  It also elevates my mood too.  I can definitely see and feel why this drug is a schedule II controlled substance.

_comment_: leveled my mood from not being focused and being antisocial to paying attention and able to socialize with others  also it made me loose the weight that I needed to loose and helped lower my cholesteral. Alway's in a good mood.

I was diagnosed with borderline narcolepsy  CFS  and fibromyalgia as a young teenager.  I have taken many things to keep me awake-uncluding provigil and ritalin.  Provigil helped  but I was still tired all of the time and would still fall asleep at the drop of a hat.  I have been taking adderall 20mg 2x a day for only a short time.  It has made a big difference so far.  I am always very careful with medications  so I am very nervous about the long term effects.  When I take adderall  I do not want to eat for 3-4 hours after  so I have not been eating breakfast or lunch.  My boyfriend and my mom (the closest people to me) have noticed a change in me.  I can make decisions easily (never used to be able to do this) and I am not as emotional.  It has helped me to stay awake  focus  and live like someone without sleep disorders  so for the time being-I am very happy.

I began taking adderall at 15mg when I was in the 4th grade (2001-2002) I lost about 28 pounds almost immediatly which was not a bad thing because I was about 30 pounds over weight. My doctor moved me down to 12 mg to stop the weight lose  which it did. I did however notice that it was not working as well so I was placed back onto 15 mg. The 15 mg dosage no longer worked as well as it originally did so I was bumped up to 20 mg and than once again to 25mg and in the 8th grade I was finally bumped up to 30mg where I remain to this day in the 11th grade.

Side effects I have experienced

I feel like I'm back in control of my thoughts and I'm able to go to sleep at night without my thoughts shifting into high speed. I'm able to look at people now and be able to have a conversation without tripping over my own tongue(saying something that doesn't make any sense). I feel confident about just being me for the first time in my life and I'm 32yrs.old. The medicine doesn't make me feel drugged up like other meds I've taken in the past. Which was due to the fact that some doctors brushed it off as conditions such as depression or just anxiety(due to being depressed). It really has fixed some major problems in my whole overall way of life. I'm very pleased that I have control back over myself again and hope it stays this way.
Ive been on it so long Im not sure how good the treatment is.
went from no motivation and feeling very depressed and overwhelmed. now can focus and feel good about myself
Slight increase in aggression but better than the alternative lifestyle of not paying attention and no motivation. It's not right for everyone but it was a LIFESAVER for me.
This drug turned me into a monster.Now that I'm off of adderall I look back and I cannot believe the way I acted.Very addictive And in my opinion should not be prescribed.

My six year old step-son is diagnosed with Autism and ADHD. His mother had him put on this medication about two months ago. The first day was great. But since then  we are in a situation that is far worse than before. He is very angry  violent  and destructive. We have three other young children and our six year old hits then  kicks then  and goes out of his way to couse then harm. After reading these reviews  my husband and i are calling his doctor to see if his meds can be switched. There are some pretty scary stories in these reviews. I would seriously reccomend reading the positive and negative comments before putting your child on this medication. In our opinion  our son is getting worse and not at all better. Be aware of all side effects  please.

I have mild-moderate ADD  but without the hyperactivity. I have been on and off adderall  and usually on very small dosages.  It usually helps  but unfortunately I get side effects pretty bad from stimulant drugs.  The jittery feeling  increased hear rate  and loss of appetite.  The jitters were the worst.  I could focus my mind but I still felt squirmy and totally "out of it."  Sometimes  I was TOO focused  and could only concentrate on what was going on in my head  and felt out of touch with the outside world.  As far as concentration for school goes  it was very helpful  but my doctor took me off it because he was worried about my health.  I tried the XR once  but did not like it as much because it took too long to work and was not as strong.  no other drug seems to have been as helpful.

And one point I should make  is that I follow my doctor's recommendation to take a "holiday" from it periodically to maintain its effectiveness at my current dosage.
is it safe for my 3 year old?

I am a 48 y.o university professor   - after years of frustration and depression because of my procrastination habits and  as I described it  a lack of engagement between my brain and my body. I finally went into therapy just over a year ago at the urging of my wife and was diagnosed with ADHD. I started taking Adderall about 8 months ago. I have found that Adderall is very effective at helping me to focus and listen. It helps me to be more deliberate in my actions  I'm not just drifting through the day. In my classroom I have found that I am able to listen to myself better and not be distracted by those students who give me that 'I'm so bored' look. One of the most interesting effects I've found is that I now actually hear and listen to the lyrics of songs! - never did that before. Looking back at my life  all the way to when I was 6 years old I now recognize the symptoms that had always been there.  I feel that the treatment is working for me  but as my doctor says  the worst part is that I'm 48 and have only now finally taken care of a life-long problem. I take 30 mg. (15 mg standard 2 x a day). I did feel the side effects for about the first two or three days (teeth grinding and dry mouth) but they subsided and I don't have any issues with that now. I've lost a few pounds  but I love to eat and  once I start eating  my appetite is fine. I know that I'll have to continue with this  probably for the rest of my life  but I think of it as a simple compound that my body chemistry is simply missing - so it helps me a lot.
Finally I would say to those of you suffering horrible side effects  stop  and get another opinion! If the side effects are that bad  then you probably have a different problem. Amphetamines are an important drug that can work well for those who need it  but if you don't  you are abusing it. I thought that it would be like the speed we experimented with in high school  but it's not. It is an essential part of my life now  stigma or not -
I have had a great experience with adderall  I finally have my life back.

While adderall does help me concentrate  there is times I seem to drift off in a daze.  I still catch myself not listening while I'm spoken to and I honestly don't know if adderall is worth all the conditions I read about.  I read that there is usually withdrawel when this drug is abused.  I took it for a few weeks  never took more than the prescribed dose and sometimes took half the dose.  I then took nothing for a few days and felt extremely tired.
Had some of the serious but rare side effects.  Continuosly chewing  headache  stomachache  vomiting  and sleeplessness.
i just started this med.. and was wondering does it really do the job for adults with ADD?

My son who is 4yrs old takes this and i have seen a very good side of him i had never seen. He is calmer and able to talk to me like he should  before the meds  he would not be still or be able to listen  he was just too wound up. I felt like a bad mom at first for drugging my child but i do not regret this  we are not able to be a family!
This drug makes me be able to function.

I've been taking Adderall for the past 3 months. I switched over from Focalin because that drug did little to improve my ADD; it just made me irritable once it wore off. I'm on 30 mg twice a day now. The drug puts me in a good place but it doesn't seem to accomplish its actual purpose. I know I've become dependent on it even in this short period of time. Other users have noted this drug should be avoided if you have an addictive personality. I agree completely. It never occured to me that I might have ADD I was more concerned about my depression. Anyways  my psych noted that I consume about three caffinated drinks a day along with a pack and a half of cigarettes. Now this drug is just another one of the stimulants I consume throughout the day to feel normal  or at least like what I have come to consider "normal." Seriously  I've met herion addicts who expressed concern when I told them I take Adderall. This drug is dangerous. Part of me thinks the companies behind it are guilty of endangering a lot of people  but when I remember how I felt just after a few days of being off it  you won't see me trying to stop them.

In high school  my mom kept on me to do my schoolwork  which was good.  However  half way through college  I started failing classes not having support  so I went to the school counselor.

She helped me out a bit with a schedule  but still in crunch time  halfway through a Term (quarter)  I just couldn't focus for homework.  She brought up ADD  so I contacted a Psychiatrist.

My psychiatrist wasn't there  so I had my initial assessment with a stand in.  She said I probably have Bipolar II (hypomanic-depressive).  Shocked  I still geared up and looked up symptoms and this and that.  Sure  so I have mild/moderate Bipolar...I thought everyone did.

I had an appointment with my real psychiatrist  and he was on the edge on if I was Bipolar or ADD.  Apparently  a lot of the symptoms overlap.  It was possible I have both  though  so I scheduled another appointment and took Lamictal for BP2.

The appointment after that was halfway through the term.  The mood swings were better  but I still couldn't focus.  I was "driven to distraction" as he put it.  I would procrastinate to the point where I was not confident I could get the work done  and then to cheer myself up  I would do the very thing that I used to procrastinate (like a video game).

He prescribed me this stuff  Amphetamine Salts.  I took it the day after he prescribed it...and for good reason.  I had an assignment due the next morning.  I had a meeting to prepare for and run.  I had important people to email.

It felt like I was sipping on a heavily caffeinated beverage all day.  That's when I'm most motivated.  I got all the emails sent out  I ran the meeting just fine  and I edited 8 pages of a document that I have been sitting on for over a year.

The side effects I experienced were dry mouth  muscle tension  strange busts of tiredness that go away in 10 minutes  high blood pressure (expected)  feeling a little cold  easy smiling  and restlessness.

It's been 3 days.  I actually WANT to do work now.  So weird...

I have been taking Adderall for six years now and what a difference it has made in my life.  I was finally diagnosed w/ADD when I was 20.  All my life I STRUGGLED through school (constantly daydreaming  forgetting assignments  awful  comprehension). I studied so hard and still earned mostly Cs. Teachers suggested to my parents that I be tested for ADD but I refused because I thought it meant I was dumb.  When I went away to college I did not have my parents reminding me to study or do homework.  The work load and subject matter was increasingly more difficult until one semester I ended up with a 1.5 GPA.  At that point I had enough of the struggle and I made an appointment with my Doctor.  After going through testing I was diagnosed with ADD and was put on Adderall.  I suddenly started to really enjoy school and on top of it all  I really wasn't dumb.  I ended that semester with a 3.85 GPA.  I got an A in Quantitative Business Statistics and loved the class. I continued on with excellent grades and enjoying school and graduated from a State University with a Bachelor of Science.  My only regret is not starting this treatment sooner.  I think that years of struggling through school  feeling left behind  and feeling "stupid" has a negative impact on a child's development of self confidence  self esteem  and perseverance in life. For people that are "on the fence" about taking medication or allowing their child to take meds to treat truly DIAGNOSED ADD/ADHD  ask yourself this..... If(you/your child) had diabetes would you not give your(self/child) insulin?  Everyone should have all the tools they need to succeed.  I am thrilled to be succeeding in life!!

I never get tired anymore during the day and am up late doing homework  which is a given anyway. Don't have any trouble with going to sleep  but have alittle difficulty getting out of bed in the morning.Taking this medication   has given me somewhat of a dry mouth and made me very constipated at first  but now is alittle better in that problem area. Otherwise  I have very much energy  to get alot done with better focusing on my school work.
I have been on this medication for almost a week now. I think it has improved my ability to focus as well as do normal daily chores and functions.

i have been on adderol for about 3 months now. i have been taking it as directed and as far as my adhd symptoms are concerned it has worked wonders...i have not made as many mistakes at work and i feel less anxious. however  a month after i started taking it  had a drastic change in my period. it usually lasted 3-4 days...now its more like 10.. but the upside is my cramps subsided and my period is nowhere near as heavy as it was before. i do not know if it is because of the adderol or not. if anyone has had similar side effects  please include that in your review. i cant find anything that lists this as a potential problem.

only have "anticipated" focused "spots" throughout the day  - Med takes about 1 1/2 hrs to work - get about 2 hrs where I usually almost forget i took a pill and after lunch - do the same thing
But I was on the "pink slip" list when I finally got back on and now    ... it's good

My 7 yr old son has been taking this for two school years now. I was not a beliver in the begaining and was against medicine. The scholl and our family DR. told us to try it for 30 days and see. The differance it has made in my sons school work is unbelivable!!! No more bad reports  He comes home happy and confident from scholl. He no longer hides from his house work or home work.
like looking through a dirty filmy window all my life  took adderal  it looked clean and crisp. Didn't know the window was dirty until I saw it clean.

I began taking Adderall XR but found some of the negative side effects  ie restlessness  trouble sleeping  mood swings to be troublesome.  I stopped taking it for one year and returned to my problem of not being able to focus and complete a task.  I asked for a low dose 5mg. (not XR) that I could take once or twice a day as needed.  This has worked well for me  keeping my focus  completing tasks and no side effects.  On days when I don't take it at all  it doesn't seem to bother me.

For years I struggled with ADD and when I was in 10th grade I was put on ritalin...I hated it...I also have a social phobia and a anxiety disorder that causes panic attacks  I also had suffered from depression and Insomnia for many years...My pychiatrist put me on 10 mg in 2000 to start out with...Started out working great...However  Paranoia doesn't help the effect....I am a very petite woman with a high metabolism...I took adderall until 2002 due to a nervous breakdown and loss of too much weight...In 2002  I weighed 68 lbs...I was taken off of it immediately and was put on seroquel...I was on Straterra since 2003 I believe and it worked good for a while...But  I wasn't getting anything done...I am back on adderall and really watching my weight this time...I no longer suffer from depression but  I do still have a social phobia...Adderall helps this alot...Also  I am able to get things done...It's a very caustious drug...You have to be extremely careful taking it...

WARNING... as addictive as heroin! I was on 60mg a day for four years  worked great at first  then became heavily addicted. Stopped helping me focus after the first 2 years and needed it to even function! I had to go to drug rehab to get off this stuff  not worth it!

I've taken this drug for over 10 years.  I sleep well  I've not lost weight  I feel "normal"  Before I was diagnosed with adult ADHD I was angry  bouts of crying  poor memory  outburst  couldn't sleep and unable to concentrate.  No doubt I will be in bad shape if/when I stop the adderall  I have to be hooked on it...but that's better than the life I had and my mean spirit that made everyone around me miserable before I started this medication.  I'm 55 years old  this has changed my life....I don't have the rapid heart beat or sweats...I just feel calm and like we all would like to feel...and like some people report  I don't have hyper times where I clean or work myself into a frinzy...

I'm a medical professional and it bothers me to no end watching people abuse this drug.  I have been on Adderall for a long time  and only take my prescribed amount and have no problems.  It works very well.

I have PTSD  Bipolar w/Adult ADD. I have been on Adderall for 4 years. First  I had a Doc put on Adderall XR. Then he took me off because I was having trouble sleeping. He didn't tell me about non-extended release and life went back to days in bed for me. I switched Docs and new Doc changed my regime and included regular Adderall. Currently  I am taking 60mgs of Adderall. 30 mgs 2xs days. Without it-I am more likely to succomb to days in bed other forms of depression.

I was diagnosed with ADHD. I am a 28yr old female and I wish a physician would have diagnosed me sooner and maybe I would have done better in school. It is fantastic. My productivity at work has improved TREMENDOUSLY  my concentration and focus have done a 180 in my professional and personal life. For those who complain that they are "addicted" and this is a "bad" medicine. Then you probably have an addictive personality and have it in other areas of your life too  OR have abused the "uses" of Adderall. I take it on the weekdays and am fine on the weekends. I don't "freak out" or have withdrawls!? If your having such a problem (those of you) seek HELP!!! Like alcoholics go to AA..They're not going to "pull" alcohol because people ABUSE it or become addicted?!
after going off daily 80mg dose of ritalin I have found the adderall to be much more effective with very few minor side effects
works good

terrible  it works only for awhile and you have ticks  like habbits such as twitching your eyes.
my son hates it

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day

_comment_: this drug causes uncontrolled rage ! Do not use it! It shows up about 4 weeks after taking and continues in cycles. The FDA should pull this drug like they did in Canada

I am a mental health therapist  and reading these reviews of Adderall makes me want to laugh and cry at the same time.  I am also taking adderall  and know in my heart that I am addicted  and struggle with knowing this everyday.  With not wanting to refill my script  but knowing that the addict in me will call my doctor and get a refill.  Knowing that I will become emotionless and cold  sleepless and edgy  but with a clean house and unhappy children who don't understand why their mom is so tense and angry.  I know that I will start having to take Zanax and Ambien to calm down at night  and that the divide between my husband and I will grow bigger.  This medication helped me at first  it felt like legal meth.  Because that is what it is.  The sad thing is  I was working in the substance abuse field when I began by adderall journey.  I am not saying that everyone will experience what I am going through  but my sister also has the exact same problems.  While I thought we would be having cookouts and taking our kids to the park  instead we are swapping scripts and pills and cleaning tips.  I caution everyone who is thinking about taking this drug to consider whether they can do it responsibly  and their family history of addiction.  Reading these other reviews makes me feel much less alone  but also very sad that so many people are having these problems.  I realize that I may need help to get off of it  but that is very hard when you work in the field that I do and your professional reputation is on the line.  I use up my script in less than two weeks  and then have two weeks without it.  The two weeks w/out it are so much better  but the addict in me never listens.  Every month I think I can do it responsibly.  I just wonder  when is it gonna be to much?  I know the saying one is to many and a thousand is never enough.  In my case  that is so true.  Please be careful.

I did not have A.D.D or adhd but was diagnosed with Depression and severe anxiety.I have been thru countless anti- depressants.Wellbutrin was ok.But something still felt like it was missing.
    I have a "Mentally challenged" friend who has adhd or a.d.d and he had a prescription of Adderall.Since I was a stupid young teen I loved experimenting with pills I had no prescription to.
After the first pill I felt on top of the world.I could speak better/faster/more intelligent.I could focuse better I had NO ANXIETY what so ever of any sort.I had REALLY bad social anxiety and fears of situations before they even happend.But with Adderal it disapeared 110%.In fact with Adderall I WANTED! to go out and socialize when usually I would just hide in my room for days/weeks/months((no joke))
so finally I got my own perscription.The doctor wasnt sure about it but I told him about all the countless benifits I was having and he finally let me have it.
    Of course there was a downside to this to though =(  Eventually I started to abuse it.Taking it more often than I should have.I would even chop it up and let it dissolve in water.Stay up all night & pull all nighters (which was still kinda fun  I got to wright some of my best guitar riffs back then and clean my room spic and span)) but I got real irritable when taking tooo much.OMG and the TEETH GRINDING LOL!!!!Another thing I disliked about being on close to slightly over amount is my penis would shrink greatly lol.Though I could still "get it up" when needed.It looks like I came out of cold pool.
    Anyway    I really miss this pill almost 10 years have past I'd like to give it another try but be a little more responsible this time.
my 4 year old grandson took adderall one time. it made him see bugs and spider webs.

I was diaganosed with Adult Add and have tried one other med that didn't work.  I started Adderall about 10 months ago.  I am currently on a 60mg dosage  yes a lot  but I am also bi-polar.  It has been fantastic for me.  I have been much more productive at work  and have felt more stable with my mood.  I have lost weight  no tears over that  but I haven't changed my eating habits.  No other side effects really!

I WAS DIAGNOSED WITH DEPRESSION CURRENTLY TAKING PRISTIQ  IT HAS WORKED BUT MAKES ME TIRED.. I CONSTANTLY FORGET THINGS HAVE TROUBLE CONSENTRATING AND KEEP UP WITH TASKS. SO I WAS AL DIAGNOSED WITH ADULT ADD. MY MD RECOMMENDED ME ADDERALL 10MG TWICE A DAY. I ONLY SAW IMPROVEMENTS FOR 2 OR THREE DAYS THAN STILL HAVE THE SAME SYMPTOMS  NOT ACTIVEE AND KEEPING UP WITH MY DAILY TASKS..

Greatly helped with my depression and adult ADHD. I didn't even want to get out of bed in the morning. I couldn't function and my thoughts and actions were scrambled. Adderall has really helped my overall condition  although i dont like the 'speed-like' feeling i get from it sometimes. My Dr. prescribed me on 15 mg then to 20mg. The 20mg is usually too much so i take 10mg in the am and 10mg later on. It has been a life-saver. I am aware of the abuse of this medication  also  and I was worried at first about taking it  but hopefully i wont have problem coming off of it in the future.

My doctor in Wash.D.C. Gave me these for ADHD we moved to Co. but the psych waiting list is shortest 6 1/2 mo.sI found it work miracles fo0r me and I studied my assighnments and paid attention in cosmetology school my grades were 80% better
hasn't lift all my problems with adhd but it helps alot

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: does not make hyper but  helps somewhat with excessive daytime sleepiness

I have been switching between Adderall XR and Adderall non-time released for about 3 years. Right now I take 90 milligrams a day of Adderall non-time released. I have days where I am tired  on these days I take more than perscribed. In my opinion Adderall is highly "abusive". When you take a medication long enough your body becomes immune and the medication isnt as effective as it was when you first started taking it.

I dont think Adderall should be prescribed to children under the age of 18. All it takes is a simple 20 question evaluation and you are prescribed a drug that may forever change your life. 

I have tried to stop taking Adderall and I have not been successful yet. I get so mad at myself when I sleep for 5 days straight (when im finally back to normal) and then go back to the Adderall.

My advice to anyone condsidering this medication is to get a second opinion. Honestly  I know I dont have ADHD or ADD  the Adderall makes me have ADHD. I didnt need this medication when I was prescribed it 3 years ago and now I cant get away from it. I have faith in God that He will get me through this and allow me to feel again. The Will of God will never take you where the grace of God cannot protect you. God bless you all!!

I believe I have a mix of hyperactivity and inattentivness.. I'm easily distracted  like to be on the move (as if driven by a motor)  its hard to stay on task  I zone-out/daydream here & there  I find it hard to be motivated  especially in school (unless I am genuinely interested in the material & feel it really applies to my life). I procrastinate  can be quite disorganized  and stress out because of this all! Thats when I dont take Adderall.  Only somewhat effective because the tablets tend to wear off as the day progresses which results in irritability  they initially get me down to business. I'd hoped that side-effecrs wouldnt apply to be but well in reality they do. this drug really is no joke and should be taken seriously because of its habit-forming tendency. i dont like the idea of depending on a substance to do things i used to be able to do without it. true  those things were harder to do before Adderall  but

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: I suffer from chronic fatigue.  After trying several different meds  this one is the only one that has made a difference in my ability to wake up and get going.  A big difference.  I take 40 mgs when I get up and sometimes another 20 in the afternoon.  It has made my life so much better.  It is not perfect  but I'd rather take it than feel like I did before.  When my new Dr. said she wouldn't be able to prescribe it  I cried.  My quality of life was at stake.  I changed doctors.
excellent medication for my hadhd i use to be  scattered  unorganized .. ect now i work effective and sleep easily

I am a 23 year old college student.  I started taking adderall to help me with my school work about 7 months ago.  Before the medicine I procrastinated  could not finish a projects  was disinterested  and unmotivated.  When I take this medication I shed all of those characteristics. I am able to study for about 5-8 hours straight and obtain all the information. I am in my senior year of college and thought I could use a push to finish the hard classes. I became interested in learning; I grasped concepts easily  and became level headed and rational.  I will say though  there is a huge downside.  I got bad headaches  lost ten pounds  blacked out frequently for a second when I stood up  chest pains  and numbness in my hands. When on the medication  I lost my connection to emotion and was very irritable.  I tended to be cold and distant.  I know this medicine works but I did not want to put my body through the side effects any longer.

I have stopped taking this due to the person I was becoming.  It takes more discipline for me to study and stay focused but at least I feel like my true self. 
This drug is habit forming. I thought I could not get an A on a test without it  but I did and I can.  Plus now when I get an A it is more rewarding knowing it was all me who earned  not the adderall.

Freshman yr of college i was diagnosed with ADD  the Inattentive kind. My experience with Adderall has been a love/hate relationship. I started on 20mg in a.m. & 10mg in p.m. It gave me more energy  made me mentally sharper & I felt normal & happier since I was more able to communicate & think clearly. I was happy.. at first. Then I noticed I could stay up WAY late. Then I'd sleep in & miss the classes I'd finally begun thoroughly doing the work for. Also  friends pointed out Id become irritable & mean at times. I agreed but was upset because of all the good adderall was doing for me otherwise. The tablets wore off later in the day  causing my moods. My prescriber recommended a higher dose  I agreed & I liked it  I was focused on getting my stuff done. STILL  I was.. cold  emotions were distant. IMPORTANT

I have been on adderall (20mg) for about 5 years. It is a hardcore stimulant that is similar to an illegal group of drugs if you catch my drift. Has helped me but I'm not sure if the benefit has exceeded the cost. I can't imagine children taking it so do your research first. Causes anxiety  mood swings  and an overall feeling that can only be described as BLAH.

I have been 20 mgs of Adderall per day for around a month's time.  I notice I am able to concentrate and focus better. My boss says I look less tense.  I don't take things so personally and my self esteem is increasing.  I have difficulty with math and understanding what I read  but I am hopeful I will improve in that area.  This medication has given me hope.  I also have depression and take zoloft.  One thing I've noticed is sometimes I get extremely sleepy in the afternoon.
abcd

I have been on Adderall now for 2.5 years. I am also on Zoloft & Lamictal. I have noticed an increase in anger and rage over the last 2 years or so  and I have been researching ALL of these drugs in order to find out if all 3 are causing these highly charged emotions  or just one or two. The smallest incident can absolutely en-rage me to the point of screaming and then crying out of frustration or just plain anger. I'm wondering if anyone else has these issues with adderall  in particular. I am not even sure I could function without this drug  but I want off ALL of them and I need to taper myself off them. I know my liver is damaged from them  and I fear with the anger I have inside me  someone will get hurt or someone will hurt me. Another issue for me is that these drugs aren't manufactured in the United States  and the big Pharmaceuticals contract with China & India which aren't quality controlled. This actually makes me VERY angry  so I am going to get off these and try to be normal  and IF I still have these destructive emotions when I'm off them  then I must seek help elsewhere. Adderall in my opinion is a very dangerous drug and giving any ADD drug to a child  adolescent or adult is irresponsible and the drug companies do NOT give a hoot about people  as it is ALL about PROFIT. The FDA is just as corrupt as the big Pharma  and together they are in collusion and both have made billions on people's lives and deaths.
Research it yourself and open your eyes to the corruption in our country  including our own government in regard to the big Pharma's and the FDA. It will scare the HELL out of you!!!

It's a restricted prescription  just like narcotics. It's hard for me to obtain but if I don't I do bad things. I hit someone head on in my car  for ex. I think taking this drug for 10 years (since age 15 or 16 or so)  has also had me turn into a raging psychopath when I'm coming off it. It only gets worse. I don't know I am acting badly  other people who know me complain. I think it's impossible to fix ADD or ADHD  because... why is it such a problem to not be able to sit still? Isn't everyone fat these days because they are far too lazy? Seems dumb to try to fix people who are hyper or not attentive. The world is a boring place. School is boring too. While this substance improved my grades during school  I found no satisfaction in my life. It numbs my feelings. It makes me more agressive and mean. But as far as helping ADD or ADHD  I don't think it does that at all anymore. My thoughts still race  I still get distracted  I am still bouncing with energy. I am on 90mg a day. Thats as high as it gets. Even though it doesn't help  I take it because I am afraid I will hurt someone else if I stop. I do not know who I am without this medication. People who take it to feel less tired are abusing it. People who give it to kids SHOULD NOT. People who take it to be less depressed are abusing it. It's not for depression. I'd reccomend exersize for that (not a doc). Besides all that  I'm tired of having to spend my time chasing after this drug every month to fill up on my prescription  because some people think it's cool to take it recreationally. THAT is the dumbest thing of all. This is the least fun drug  ever. They should adjust it so there is no more false euphoria from this drug in anyone. I never felt euphoria of any kind from it. But to give it to a kid that DOES (even legally)  I could see it as being addictive. I've been medicated since I was 5  Ritilan  countless anti-depressants and then back to the desoxyn and Adderall.Yeah-I don't even talk to my parents anymore.
Very satisfied with treatment for adult ADD.

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: Had been taking ritalin before.  Feel this med must be a little stronger!  Would be very cautious about giving to children especially younger ones. Seems I've had more severe mood swings with this med.  Believe the ritalin worked a little better & probably would be better off w/o it too. Started these type meds during period of extreme stress mainly for depression.  Now that stress is less believe I've become a little too dependant on it. I would suggest trying all other measures first & especially with children who are dependant on the parents judgment. My Doctor said he would be curious as to how much physical activity a child is getting before trying these type meds. Maybe try increasing that first. Basically proceed with caution & honesty.  Andy in Ga
was a lot more active very nerves cry alot hateful fearful of people mainly men restless at night chewed nails and skin on fingers and toes etc.

THIS HAS BEEN THE BEST MED FOR ME SINCE TRYING RITALIN AND VYVANSE .  I HAVE HAD NO NEGATIVE EXPERIRNCE WITH ADDERALL AS I DID HAVE PROBLEMS WITH VYVANSE AND RITALIN. HOWEVER I AM AN ADULT IF THAT MAKES A DIFFERENCE!!
I have ADD and without adderall i a unable to even perform normal daily task or even hold a job  this medication has worked wonders for me.

it gave me my life back 
i feel the way i should and i can consentrat much better with this med

This drug has helped me so much with the racing thoughts and inability to concentrate. I can now focus on my work and actually complete tasks. I have so much more energy and get more things accomplished.
almed me down ^ cut my symptoms down by more than half . It really worked1

does not seem to be helping - making my son more iritable and more sensative

For Adult ADD - I've just had issues with getting the ideal dosing schedule with this. Has made me stop taking my SSRI  and feel like I accomplish things. Was taking 20mg XR once daily  then twice daily  but due to price  went to plain. Seems to work longer than XR. But through discussions with my dr  we've decided to do the 20mg plain  and depending on how I feel  can take a 1/4  1/2  3/4 or whole pill. Prescribed at 1 pill b.i.d. but may drop to 1/2 pill b.i.d. with 1/2 pill p.r.n. ... This med has worked wonders in me. Won't recommend it to anyone  though  because it is a Class II controlled substance and they may sound like an addict going to their Dr.

I was given 15 mg a day of this for my chronic exhaustion. However  I quickly realized that it has made my depression go away. The problem is I need about 40 - 60 mg to get rid of the depression. My pdoc won't give me that much  and so I remain depressed. I don't know what to do because nothing makes my depression go away like Adderall does. I also find it's not necessary to take it everyday. I find it best to skip every 3rd day so I can sleep. It does cause insomnia  but I had that before I ever took Adderall. This is like a miracle drug for me. Now if only I knew a doc who would give me enough to last all month.
Works for me!

I'm 20 and in my first year of college. I was diagnosed with ADD in 6th Grade for my lack of ability to concentrate  I was/am quite the day dreamer. The Doc put me on 5mg Adderall XR I believe. My freshman year the dose was increased to 10mg. At the time I didn't know fully how it effected me  all I knew is that it made me want to throw desks at the teachers that irritated me  and that I was unhappy and pissed of for no reason. I switched from adderall to stratera  then to ritali LA  but I prefered not taking anything because of how they effected me. In January I started back on Adderal XR @ 15mg and I told myself that it's worth the sacrifice to have good grades and be able to focus  but I  now that I am older I am more aware of how it effects me. My grades immediately went from C's to high B's and the Highest gpa I've had in years. I quit taking it when I realized that it was destroying my life in the following ways

I was taking this for ADD without hyperactivity. It seemed to help at first  I was concentrating better  keeping up with tasks  and getting more things done. However  I'm also being treated for depression  and after only a few weeks I started noticing the symptoms of my depression coming back. After a full month on the drug  I was extremely irritable  overreacting to stress  crying at every little thing  snapping at friends and family... I really damaged a relationship with one friend  sadly. Upon talking to my doctor  I found out that Adderall can cause heightened emotions  which is exactly what I was trying to treat with the depression medication! She offered to put me on a mood stabilizer drug as well  but I said just take me off the Adderall and try something else for the ADD rather than adding another drug to fix its side effects. I'm trying Strattera now  we'll see how it works. The drug did what it was supposed to do  but honestly  my ADD isn't bad enough to warrant taking a drug with this kind of side effect.

I first saw a doctor when I was 17 yrs. old seeking treatment for depression and constant lethargy. However  after answering a short questionnaire  I was diagnosed with ADD  and have been on Adderall (which was helpful at first) ever since. Now  I've been on the medication so long that I can't remember who  or how I was before I started taking it. In addition to causing my mild OCD to become full blown routine-altering OCD  I find that the medication increases my irritability 10 fold (especially when it's wearing off  and especially within the last year). I'm not sure if it is the medication or simply life circumstances that is now causing me severe depression  extreme lack of motivation  and weird and very sudden mood swings. I have also experienced more common side effects  like jaw clenching  tension  dizziness  and increased heart rate. I would like to try to stop taking the medication now  but feel I am dependent on it and am afraid of the withdrawal effects. I worry about the long term side effects that I may experience from taking this drug for so long  and the misery that it may/may not be causing me presently. I would NEVER consider putting a child on this medication.

I have taken a low dose of adderall for about five years  and it has changed my life. 

My ability to think ahead  anticipate and avoid problems has dramatically improved. My abilty to articulate myself improves dramatically on adderal  especially with a low dose.  I can understand the consequences of my actions with a clarity that I wish I had earlier in life J My over-all attention span has dramatically improved in the last five years  and it remains significantly higher even on days when I choose not to take adderall. To me  that is amazing. Tasks I once found painful  I can now do quickly an efficiently with patience and perfect detail  even off adderall. A large part of why I think I see a lot of improvement is not just the medication  but also all the other things I do to combat ADHD.

When I need to learn something new (e.g. a software program at work) adderal helps me quickly learn and absorb the new information  and remember facts. It is a dramatic change from my past abilities.

When I first started taking the drug  I had heart palpitations. It is definitely hard on the heart. BUT then I started to add regular  gentle but rigorous aerobic exercise to my routine (which  btw  is a non-prescription treatment for ADHD)  my heart became stronger  more conditioned than before and the palpitations stopped. My resting hr is 45 bpm  and my blood pressure is ideal  or close to it. This also will solve any insomnia problems.

I recommend this drug  FOR THE RIGHT PERSON. Fact is we are all built differently. Which is the whole reason why drugs like this are made in the first place. Depending on your peculiarities  it may not give you exactly what you need.  That doesnt mean this drug wont be very helpful to someone else. I look forward to the day when these types of drugs can be prescribed and monitored more accurately.

i as a mom of 4kid's two with adhd i feel that they should take this drug off the drug market i'm very angree that they can use this medication when the side effects out weigh it's self they call this medication safe i call it child endarangerment it is killing my 10yr.old son he has bleeding comming from nose and now in his mouth what the heck kinda medication is this taking live's

My initial response to Adderall XR was great - it changed my life  but then ... and there is always a "but" in life - the effects began to wear off and then I think that Adderall began muting my endocrine system.  In a nutshell - it significantly reduced my level of perceived anxiety. I didn't realize it  but I was probably living with a "4" on a 1 - 10 scale for general anxiety.  Adderall brought me down to a 1 or 2.  I think that basically after a month or two my adrenaline and other things were basically either all used up  or the receptor sites were burned out.  Basically there was no "fire" because all of the fuel had been burned up.  Also  I think that I had some mild depression creeping in - I became somewhat unmotivated  and really didn't want to do much physically.

After about 1 year my libido dropped like a rock  my testicles felt as if they had shrunken to 1/2 their normal size.  My body temperature was always low - it was routinely in the mid 96 to low 97 range.  I had no physical strength nor endurance - where I had been previously in good shape and could crank out 25 pushups at any given time  I could only manage 20 or so "girl" pushups (supported by knees) after which time I was exhausted.  After working out  I didn't feel as if I was gaining any benefit or very minor benefit  almost as if I was having a muted recovery.  

After initially becoming more organized I began slipping back  then I was maybe only 25% of my initial organization. 

I have stopped taking XR on a daily basis and have begun taking it only "as needed" - what my doctor doesn't know will not hurt him.  I think that something needs to be recharged - I am now an advocate of "drug holidays"  every other day usage  or simply "as needed" be that at work  or home. 

I never found myself feeling mentally addicted - but I did have brain fog for a couple of days when stepping down.

I was on 30mg/day Adderall XR - 40yo male - ~18 months.

I have been taking the XR 20mg a day for about 6 months now and it has completely changed my life. You would have never known I had an attention problem because I was a very active teenager.  I was involved in sports  many extracuricular activities and worked since I was 16 so my mind was constantly focused on something different.  It became a problem after becoming a single mom.  I couldn't organize any thought.  If there was too much going on I couldn't focus to organize it.  I didn't pay bills  I took extreme chances  and even forgot I was a mom sometimes.  After finally confessing to my mother how i felt she suggested talking to my PCP.  He gave me the 20mg XR 6 months ago and now I feel as though I am actually living my life.  I have since fixed my finances  gotten promoted at work  and enjoy my time with my daughter so much more.  I would suggest this treament to anyone as long as their Dr. agrees.  Use caution when taking this it can be very addicting  and should not for children that have no gone through puberty.  i have lost 30 pounds since start because of the lack of appetite and amount of exercise i do.  I also have about two nights a week that i have trouble falling asleep.  over all I thank myself every day for being able to communicate how I felt.  I am finally the person I always wanted to be and never thought could be.

this drug causes extreme depression after extended use. i believe this drug should be taken OFF the market and reevaluated. this drug can cause thoughts of suicide  eratic behavior  mood swings  bouts of hysteria and overall should be in a class of its own for ONLY the severely mentally ill that need institutionalizing! the fact that CHILDREN are taking this drug is HORRIFIC and is going to end up doing more damage then good in the longrun. i truly believe that this is one of our biggest problems in America today....adults and worse yet CHILDREN AND TEENAGERS running around 0n legal meth!!!! get rid of this drug  and more importantly the thought process that people need this to pay attention.

I loved being on adderall. But after heart palipitations I decided to stop - feeling additionally like I was becoming addicted. I suffered from complete drug induced psychosis that was misdiagnosed as bi-polar and caused me to have a total break down. DO NOT TAKE THIS DRUG it is dangerous! Do not stop taking adderal cold turkey either it also causes bad things to happen!

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: I have narcolepsy cataplexy and sev. day time sleep disorder and I have done the 200mg Provigil and was up to 50mg 2/day of rittalin and nothing has helped. Now im on 30 mg of addarall 2/day and for now it seems to be helping. Although I have not experienced any of the good side effects.
my daughter been on this med for 3months and she still having  a very hard time in school also at th e beginning it hurt her belly...

I have been on Adderall for 3 years now.  Its been a miracle for my school and work life.  However  this drug is addicting and can easily be abused.  It has really helped me but I worry about my dependence on it and the effects it may be having on my heart in the long run.  Using this drug takes a lot of self discipline but if you can be responsible with it it can truly help the quality of your life.  I have suffered with Attention Deficit problems my entire life and once I was diagnosed as an adult and I started taking this drug I finally felt like I was a normal functioning human being.  I am not a space cadet anymore  I can finish tasks  ext...  I recommend this drug but with caution.

I recently learned that I have ADD at age 36 and my doctor put me on 20mg of Adderall XR and I noticed that I get tired around 3pm.  It's difficult for me to sleep sound (taking 1 mg of Ativan at bedtime)  so I'm not sure about taking another dose.  I'll be increasing to 30mg in 1 week  but will that help my afternoon crash?  Also  is there anything out there that can help me sleep better?
Overall  I'm super stoked on Adderall...It's been the only thing that has helped me concentrate (I'm reading books like I just discovered how to read)...

Started taking Adderall 5 years ago and it has worked incredibly well. I set the alarm for an hour before I need to be up and when the alarm goes off  I wake up just long enough to swallow the pill with a bunch of water then I go back to sleep. Without fail  I wake up almost exactly an hour later feeling awake and energetic. The energy continues throughout the day and wears off in time for me to fall asleep easily. Until the early evening I have very little appetite but if I decide I have to eat  it's not difficult and generally my appetite returns a bit once i start eating. I feel totally able to pay attention to my work  writing papers  reading textbooks  focusing in lectures which was impossible before Adderall or when I miss a dose. I took Ritalin for several months before switching to Adderall with no effect at all.

The side effects have been fairly harsh for me. My mouth is incredibly dry  my appetite is nearly non-existent  I am not as interested in things as I usually am (depression)  I don't feel like being very social and talking to people  and it takes around 2 hours for me to fall asleep if conditions are not entirely favorable.

I needed this to help get me through exams. It helped alright. It helped me pull al-nights without feeling tired the next morning. I could work through the whole night in fact. However  it took a full 24 hours to get out of my system. Until then. no matter how badly my system craved sleep  I didn't feel tired and could not fall asleep. I felt really miserable. Without it  I wouldnt have dont well on my exams. But I would never take this unless I had to. It makes you feel funny. puts pressure on your head  and makes you stay awake. Overall  not fun to be on. A better schedule works much better. (I was on 20mg non xr).

I am 26 yeras old and have been on stimulant medication since the age of 4 for ADHD. I switched to the oral 20mg tablet Adderall when I was 18. Overall  it has been very effective. However  the side effects as of late have been interfering with my job. 2 hours after taking the medication with food  I begin to hot flash and sweat a lot. I drink massive amounts of water to counter this  but then am left with having to urinate constantly. I also experience bad cotton mouth.

After taking Adderall for a couple of years I began having a high heart rate (105 at rest).  I also have heart palpitations.  I've been off this drug for 3 months and my heart rate is still irregular.  I consider this a dangerous drug.
i have been taking adderall for around 7 yrs. and i think that my body is not responding to it anymore.

I wasn't diagnosed with ADD until my sophmore year of college. I was finally able to concentrate  organize  and FINISH tasks. I could read w/o back tracking  and actually remember what I had read. I did notice that I would become easily aggravated (mostly in the afternoon) and somewhat OCD at times...However  I found that keeping an established routine of eating breakfast + snacks and getting a full 8 hours of sleep a night greatly diminished those side effects.

My son has been taking Lexapro for 2 months now and it did wonders for his anxiety.  Before taking Lexapro  he was nausus & sick to his stomach at school.  The doctor added adderall to the mix yesterday and wow  explosive - my son had a huge anger episode at school (very unlike him) and just got totally out of control - his heart rate was up dramatically as well as his blood pressure.  Be careful of mixing drugs.

I was told my daughter was adhd when she was 5 and now she is 9  at first she took ritalin no luck then we tried adderall XR and had nothing but great luck with this drug. just remember some drugs dont work for some people- so you might have a to try a few to get one that works for you.this drug has changed my daughters life and continues to exxcell in school

I have always struggled in school and my parents did not believe in ADD or ADHD.  I would listen to someone talk to me for 10 minutes and not be able to tell you one word that they said.  I went from a D student at a very good university to making the Dean's list.  I have read a few negative reviews of this drug  and I must say that I believe those who had negative opinions about the drug were either on the wrong dosage  or did not need the medication in the first place.  This medecation has changed my life. After 5 years of struggling in college I finally graduated  1 year after starting adderall.  I am proud of myself and proud of my work.  Also   I no longer experience the anxiety that I always had before I started the medication.  I would use caution while taking this medicine  because it can be easily abused.  If you abuse it  you will not get the results that the medication is prescribed for.  If you start taking it for the purpose that it is intended for  it can and will change your life.

I have been diagnosed with bipolar disorder along with PTSD since I was thirteen. I am now 25  and I decided to try this medication perscribed by my new psychiatrist; who has rediagnosed me with ADHD.  
During the first day of two 30mg. tablets I did fine  with the exception of a few jitters.  I wasn't sleepy or depressed as usual.  After consulting my doctor  he said it was a sign that I should double my dosage.  Then came the second and third days.  I was a maniac!  I would sit for hours preforming illogical tasks that I couldn't stop; like combing my hair for 6 hours.  My eyes were dialated  I ached from being tense  and I also felt disconnected from the world.  I was very irritable  paranoid  dizzy  sweating  short of breath  and OCD.  I couldn't fall asleep without prescription medications.  I was too anxious to even take the trash out.  I will never take stimulants of this kind again.  Afterall  I know I am bipolor  but the thought of removing that diagnosis gained enough of my trust to try stimulants.  I've never felt more crazy!  The days just flew by and I have no idea what I did.  Needless to say  I'm looking for a new doctor.

I was prescribed adderall for ADD without hyperactivity 15mg 2x a day. It is very difficult to take this medicine as prescribed because it keeps me up all night and has terrible side effects. I've experienced extreme anxiety that did not exist before I started along with chest pain  tightness in my chest  labored breathing  jaw pain/teeth clenching  headaches  dizziness  loss of coordination etc... I've tried lowering the dose as well as raising it but still experience the same sypmtoms. I will be fine taking it if I havent had it in a few days but the come down is so terrible that I am unable to sleep properly for the next 2 days and experience a hangover so terrible that I am unable to take it again for at least 3 days. It did help me concentrate but makes me extremely antisocial and fearful of speaking in a classroom or out in public. I was not like this before I started taking it. I also have been getting terrible panic attacks so bad that I need to lay down and force myself to sleep until it passes. After I did more research on Adderall and realized it was just SYNTHETIC CRYSTAL METH in a pill form I am no longer suprised at the hell I went through. I think it's terrible that the FDA is allowing so many citizen's to become pharmaceutical speed addicts...especially when it is precribed to a child.
about me- age 23 female 130lbs

Take 15mg/day for 1 week now. For years I have had a hard time sleeping at night without taking melatonin or simply sleep every night. Also have always had a hard time concentrating and focusing on reading/work. Finally decided to go to a doctor to see what was up. I decided to stop taking all sleeping pills beforehand. Doctor prescribes 15mg/ 2x a day (non-xr  I did not want the XR as I already have a hard enough time falling asleep). After taking adderall for a few days  I has undoubtedly made me MUCH more tired - within an hour or two of taking my pill I could easily fall asleep. In fact  I would prob use these to help me fall asleep as they make me more tired than a full dose of simply sleep. Have not helped at all for concentration or focusing. I feel like I'm more in "my own little world" and less hungry. I would find it hard to imagine that taking more would do anything but intensify the effects it has already had.

I was diagnosed in my late 40's and started out on 2 pills  lost 20 lbs (for awhile) but not much in the way of progress.  I still have over a 100 books I've started and not finished.  After about a year on this with my heart rate really starting to scare me I went down to 1 pill a day and my heart doesn't race but I'm not really accomplishing much.  I do stay focused at work which could just be a lifetime of trying to focus.  I still do 20 things at once.
I fel like a different person. I can now concerate  I am 53 now I wish they had this when I was a kid.I was always disrupting class and talking to much  they labled me a problem child.
I used to take riltian and found that it made me depressed so now i take adderall and it's been a night and day change for me! I actually have motavation to do something in life now!

I was diagnosed with ADD about 8 mnonths ago and am prescribed to Adderall 20mg 2x a day. I talked to my doctor about it after I got an office job. I too am one of those people that can read every word in a paragraph and have no idea what it said because my mind was elsewhere. I couldn't listen to a solid sentence someone was saying to me for the same reason. After taking adderall I worked so much more efficiently and understood a lot more. It was as if my head was pulled out of a cloud or something. I really wish I had been more aware of this condition in high school. I was always a decent student making average grades but it was very difficult for me to really understand and grasp things  especially in math. I had a very appathetic attitude towards high school and my efforts to go to college were lacking...and as a result of that I still haven't gone back to school. Knowing how much better I could have done in high school if I had been prescribed to it then really makes me wonder how much more I could have accomplished as far as scholarships and things of that nature. Overall  taken responsibly adderall has been 100% effective. The biggest side effect I'v experienced has been a lack of hunger. I've lost probably 20 pounds in the last 8 months. I just make sure I eat before I take it and drink nutritional shakes throughout the day.
easier to concentrate on work. insomnia. cheek/ jaw swelling. sweating.

For the first time that I can remember I finished reading a book. Before Adderall I would begin reading the first few pages and not remember or understand what I have just read. And then have to go back again and read it over. Now reading has become a joy. I can for the first time memorize Bible Scripture. I'm focused.
Also finishing projects around my home are completed. Befor I would have 5-6 little fix it jobs all going on and not completed. 
The same at work running around working my butt off and at the end of day  I'll remember invoices not made out that should of been done in the morning. This is all differant now. I do First things First and finish them to the end.
            What an blessing For me and my family.

Prayers are answered. Thanks Jesus....Again

The ADD characteristic without hyperactivity was my Dx. Not diagnosed until my early 40's  I struggled to complete tasks at hand. Now  not only do I complete them  I'm able to go above and beyond the tasks at hand. As well  I'm able to keep my weight at managable levels. Also  my energy levels are up and my depression is all but ameliarated. I just wish the Dr would have found the Dx sooner.

I have been taking adderall xr 40mg for the past 3 years.
Im very impressed  i have taken ritalin  conserta  and sitera. By far the adderall is the best. Even though everyonce in a while my body builds a tolerence and i have to up the dosage. Mild side affects  loss of appitite  and insomina. But that is only if i take it later then 4pm.

doctor put me on Concerta medicine sucks So for the first time I was working on behavioral therapy and counseling for the treatment of adhd and i'll tell you what before concerta I was taking adderral 30MG and never felt this way I feel nervous aggitaded unable to handle any stress. For the first time i see why adderral is such a miracle.  You can still be your self you know chit chat whatever I believe that should never be controlled- and no brain chatter either. I highly reccomend adderall.

This medication is very effective. However this dug is very habit forming and I do not recomend children taking this medication at all. If you have to use this medication use as directed and have someone monitor you while taking  very easy to abuse. I took myself of the medication cause I noticed I was abusing it. The withdrawls off this medication are horrible and I don't recommend stoping this medication suddenly  it hurts. I felt like those people you see on T.V. coming off heroin.
Adult ADDer diagnosed at 5 yrs 'hyperkinetic

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: This medication  once I found the right doseage works great for getting through the day without falling asleep. There are times when I still feel sleepy  but overall it has been working well. I haven't fallen asleep at work  as I had been before at least 2 to 3x's a day. I have also been able to feel comfortable driving myself and my son. Before I would have someone drive and there had been incident where I had fallen asleep at the wheel which was very scary.

I am a college student diagnosed with ADD.  I recently began a 2 a day dosage of Aderall 20 mg and it has changed my life.  I actually go to class now  I don't have depression and suicidal thoughts  I am no longer socially anxious  and can actually pay attention to conversations and read books all the way through.

I have Adult Attention Defecite Disorder. The world became a bright place  clear. I could read more than a paragrah at a sitting  I can finish a magazine! I listen better without looking away  distracted by anything. It has been a miracle for me. I will always be greatful to the medical industry for giving me new eyes! Thank you. It is like being legaly blind your whole life and then someone gives you glasses! WOW wonderful. Just make sure you are on the right dose  not to much or not to little.

I am a 23 year old male and have struggled with ADD since i was in 6th grade and began having trouble paying attention  finishing tasks and keeping my concentration in one place. It has affected my job performance  school and home life. Recently My doctor prescribed me to adderall XR 20mg capsules after i addressed this problem with him. Since taking the medication i have been able to complete tasks without being distracted and my concentration is superb. Places i have felt "lost" in thought or daydreaming no longer affect me. Would reccomend for people with this condition but be sure to read all of the literature that comes with the drug.
I FIND THAT AS THE DAY GOES ON IBECOME IRRITABLE  ESPECIALLY @5
my daughter takes this med daily and has improved in school. her grades have improved  and her teacher has been pleased with her attitude.

I am a 23 year old recent college graduate that has been taking Adderall Oral for the past 6 to 7 months.  I was not diagnosed with ADD/ADHD until the start of my treatment.  With this treatment I have noted some very distinct changes in my performance in college and now in my career.  I am a Mechanical Engineer in NC.  My focus at work seems to be increased but not over the top.  I finally feel that I can start a project and follow it through to the end.  Finishing the minute details that have plagued me in the past and that I have procrastinated with in the past.  I feel that Adderall oral is an effective treatment for my condition.  Although I strongly urge parents and students to take caution with using this treatment option.  I have noticed a weekly to bi-weekly occurrence of limited sleep for one to two nights.  This seems to typically happen on a Friday night and Sunday nights.  As this has continued I feel that there are some other treatments that I should attempt before settling on this one.  Also as I was diagnosed during my final semester of college with ADD/ADHD I noticed that I suddenly had more friends then the prior 5 years of college.  So parents  students in college with go to extreme measures to acquire Adderall from your child. This is also becoming an increasing concern for college campuses across the nation.  Like I said before  I believe  this medication should be taken consistently and you shouldn't miss many treatments.  Missing treatments has made me extremely groggy and lazy.  So caution to not taking it on the weekends.  I have noticed that when I continued treatment for 7 days a week I didn't have the haze  groggy and lazy feeling.  Also I reduce my dosage to half during the weekends. I hope this helps all in some manner.

i have been taking 15mg 2x daily for about 4 or 5 months. I've lost 30 pounds! i have no desire to eat at all. i have to literally force myself to eat. this medicine has helped me sooo much. in high school i got D's and F's. i just finished college and was top in my class  straight A's! bad side effects

I started on 10mg 2x/day  and steadily increased to current dose of 30mg 2x/day. Although it doesn't work like it used to  I can't function without it. It tends to make me a little irritable and anxious at times. Within the last 6-8 months I've noticed leg pain  tingling  and swelling. I'm unsure if it's related to medication. I've tried other meds but none has helped. Side effects can be annoying  but benefits are worth it.

_comment_: This has been a miracle drug for me. I suffered from SWSD  Major dep. disorder  obesity  an other afflictions  and adderall seems to alleviate them all. The one draw back is it does give me panick attacks  but it far outweighs the side effects.

I dont have ADD..I am bi- polar and aside from the bi- polar meds i take  adderal has really made me focus when i otherwise have to deal with 'lows' that distract me from the everyday.. i am too busy for that. i dont eat much but to tell you the truth  i dont mind. I love this medication.. dont know what i would do without it.

I have ADD.I have used ritalin conserta & strattera before finaly using adderall. Ritalin  conserta & stattera all caused me to be excessively tired  an in the case of strattera I nearly blanched out. With adderal I have none of thoes.
it has changed my whole life arround beforetreatment i was anti-social could not count  change to pay for something and i would not be able to learn how to work this computer.

My son was held back last year at school & at semester they moved him back up  so Im contributing alot of that to the adderol.
I have been taking Adderall XR 25mg for 1 year  I attend college and have Adult ADHD it has helped me to improve my grades and I have made the Deans List.

_comment_: I don't have Narcolepsy but something close. My apologies with my spelling but my problems is called ideo-pathic-hyper- somnia. This just means there is no explanation for why this is the way that I am. I have taken test after test  2- overnight sleep studies and 1 -three day sleep study. My results have been seen by many specialtist and nothing. I am on 30mgs -3 times a day totalling 90mgs of adderall and 20 mgs of ritilin /3 times a day totalling 60 mgss a day and with both of these I can still sleep and sleep hard. I go through good days and bad days or sperts. The bad days or sperts out do the good days. It helps slightly but I have to force my self to do anything and everything. I don't know what to do anymore. I am willing to try anything  I just want to be normal again  I want to be able to play with my kids  I don't want to be cranky anymore. I want to live  I am to young to be this old. Can anyone help.

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: I have Narcolepsy and have had it for 3 years. It wasn't diagnosed until March '07 and that's when my Dr. gave me Adderall. It gave me my life back. I started on 20mg/day  now I take 40mg 3/day. It took a couple of months to find the right dosage and level off. I would have to write a book to explain what I was going through  and what I was putting my family through...so I will spare you of that. But don't take this drug just to lose weight  it's a serious medication with some side effects. Go on a diet.
Helped me focus  ability to complete tasks instead of being unable to complete one of the 10 tasks I would be attempting.
this drug makes me fell wonderful
i could concentrate on the work at hand. i was acceptionaly calm when getting in front of class. i feel it helped a lot.

Adderall has helped me do better in school  I can actually sit down and read the news paper or a book.
