I had add without the hyperactivity. this has been a lifesaver  normally i just cant get anything done or have the motivation to do anything. its allowed me to improve my life and keep on track with daily tasks and i feel like i can accomplish anything i put my mind to. i dont know where id be without it.

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day

_comment_: MY son he can concentrate much better at school.The behavior improve.

I took this medication because of my ADD problems in high school. My doctor originally started me off with a drug that is almost exactly Ritalin. I started with it in freshman year due to my lowly grades and noticeable problems. I started using the ritalin like drug  but saw no satisfying results. It also seemed to be correlated with having sleeping problems  appetite loss  and depression. So i stopped using it. When i went to my doctor and told him about  it he seemed to realize that the ritalin wasn't causing the stress and other problems  but it was just the the troubles of freshman year. The drug and my problems weren't actually connected. My doctor prescribed adderall for me in my sophomore year  and i almost instantaneously saw the improvements  faster reaction time  less daydreaming  and i could keep my grades up and remember my work with ease. Luckily i had parents that trusted me enough to let me keep the medication in my own place(in my room) because i was ashamed at first to have to take something to make myself better. It was as if it kind of lifted a disability completely off of my shoulders. Ive taken it all the way through college and stopped when i graduated  i experienced no real withdrawal  I just had to make a smooth transition which my doctor helped me with greatly. If taken in the right doses and not obsessed about it seems to be a very good help for my future and self esteem.
Just realize that what you see as depression and other related things could very well be the much more stressful and much more dangerous thing called high school.

ADD-no hyperactivity...but that was the only option to choose..

I've taken adderall when i was in high school and then went off the medication for about a year. During that year my grades went from A's and B's to C's or below. Its not that i wasn't a hard worker  i just couldn't concentrate on school work. Its a great medicine and works if used correctly. There are a few complications with it if you take 40 mg or higher for a long period of time (i.e-years) i have read that there is a possiblity of heart complications. But if you stay at a healthy dose and don't go overboard..it works. Also  adderall XR is great b/c you only have to take it once a day  instead of twice a day.

I have to say that I was very weary of using a drug for my adult ADHD (inattentive type) but adderall really makes my life alot easier. Though adderall is not a "silver bullet" it greatly helped me reach my potential as a college student. In high school I went undiagnosed and subsequently untreated which resulted in my sub par grades. It wasnt until college when I talked to my pyschiatrist who throughly evaluated me and first tried me on Ritalin which made me extremely tired  then finally Adderall. Adderall and therapy have allowed me to stay focused and acheive more than I ever dreamed possible. I'm now on the deans list with a 4.0 in my senior year of college. I was also really lucky to not really have any side effects or withdrawl symptoms  although if I take it too late in the day I have a hard time falling asleep  but thats to be expected from an amphetimine.

MY SON TAKES ADDERALL  IT SEEMS TO HELP WITH THE ATTENTION/DEFICEIT.  HE DOES SEEM TO BE MORE SLUGGISH AND IRRITABLE WHEN HE IS ON IT.  HE COMPLAINS THAT HE IS NOT HUNGRY.  IT HELPS IF I CAN KEEP HIM SNACKING THROUGOUT THE DAY. WE USE GRANOLA BARS  AND FRUIT TO KEEP HIM FROM HAVING STOMACHE ACHES AND HEADACHES.

It's relatively easy to take when you remember  but it's difficult to base eating around it and not eat within an hour before or after. Also  the withdrawl when you forget to take it is exceedingly painful.

This drug is very effective  and very easy to use.  I can focus and pay attention much better than I ever have.  I think it is necessary for me  and I will still take it  but the reason I am only somewhat satisfied is because there are some pretty prominent side effects

when you take it its starts off fine  you can pay attention to everything but about 3 hours later your a wreck. crabby as all get out  you havent eaten all day because you werent hungry  and on top of that cant sleep because ITS METH!!!

I started taking it about four years ago and I've had better attitudes about life and my family.  It slows my brain activity down so I can at least appreciate a converstaion.  I gave it a 4 star twice only becasue I have OCD too  and when I take it  it worsens my OCD.

_conditionInfo_: Recurring Sleep Episodes During the Day
_comment_: I am very jittery and shaky and I know that this a side effect.  I also take thyroid supplements and now know not to take at the same time  but still am shaky. I do feel less sleepy with this drug  but wish there was a non-narcotic choice to use.
my son has been on it for two yaer and we have seen change in his behavior for the best.  mostly for school is why he takes it.

Adderall has helped me immensely with my schoolwork.  As a college student  I thought it was normal to be unable to focus on my professors in class or to have trouble finishing my papers or reading homework assignments.  I would often become so obsessed with the details of a project I would not be able to finish and become discouraged. Adderall keeps me focused in class and helps me get my homework done in a timely matter. Now I don't procrastinate because I am confident that I will be able to perform successfully.

my attention and focus has changed so much since I started taking adderall xr.I can focus instead of sitting at my desk at work and trying to figure out what to do next and since I started taking the adderall I do not use the internet at work.

This drug seems less harsh than ritalin  but it still causes a down feeling as it wears off. Nonetheless  - perhaps 50%+ of the time Adderall has been quite helpful in getting me in focus and on track.That is a great benefit because I find myself restlessly pacing much of the time and unable to initiate or complete projects  Often I have felt too defeated to even hoppe to begin a project. I have lived with thisa painful condition for 20 years or more. 
When I do dfocus i can becaome very effective and creative. It has been a strained interior battle to find ways to establish a balance and a rhythm in daily life.
I also take the antidepressant Cymbalta and often I also need to take Artivan.
So  it is a frustrating story. Adderall is a great help when it helps  and yet i worry about dependence and also the apparent habituation.
All medications for mood and behavior seem to offer complicated trade-offs requiring frequent self-evaluation and consultation with doctors and also with friends and family. Often I feel embarrassed that I seem to need these types of medicines  and yet is  clear that for me they are helpful and also 
problematic.

My 13 year old son has been on adderall xr for almost 4 years.  it changed his life (for the better) and ours!! the only challenge is keeping up with his growth spurts and adjusting the meds accordingly.
the only medicine that truly worked for me.. I wish my dr would have prescribed it years earlier.
I am 41 yrs old  and use it for ADD.  NOT ADHD.  I have had ADD all my life  and finally sought help.  It has been a huge improvement!  I feel like someone opened the blinds  or the fog is gone.

I've been on Adderall on & off over the past few years (off because of pregnancy/nursing).  I've tried 10mg/day in 2 doses and also 10mg/day in 1 XR (extended release) dose.  It has been incredibly helpful.  I get more done in 1 day than I used to in a week or more.  My husband doesn't come home to find me in the middle of 10 unfinished "projects".  The 2 major downsides for me are the addictiveness and the loss of appetite.  I am a mess if I don't take it  and I am naturally a very small person to begin with  so the loss of appetite can be a pretty serious problem.  Eating & maintaining a reasonable weight is a daily struggle  but at least now I can keep up with my responsibilities enough that I even have time to eat!
I've been taking adderal for 7 years and 3 years ago I would have reccomended it.  However  I am now addicted and would not reccomend it to anyone  unless it is heavily supervised.

I am a 35 year old male that has been taking Adderall for almost 2 years now. My symptoms did not include hyperactivity but rather the ability to stay focused on anything detailed for any length of time. 

Ex

The main problem with Adderall is that it is extremely addictive. I started taking it to help me get through classes and work. I loved that it killed my appetite. I thought I'd be able to take it in moderation  but I take it everyday now. I just feel like a happier person when I take it. But I've noticed that I am distant and easily annoyed if I take too much. Sometimes I feel that I'm on the verge of having a panic attack. If I take 15 MG a day and I eat I feel amazing. But its very easy to avoid eating and take 30 MG because you just get so much done. Im very nervous that I will become strongly addicted to the drug. Im also nervous that I will loose too much weight. Scary.

Adderall has worked very well for me. My thought process is much more organized and my ability to stay focused on a conversation and tuned into the subject at hand has improved immensely.  I have over the years tried to slow and constrain my hyperactivity with lorasapam and other sedatives with only a moderate amount of success; major side effect was drossiness and fatigue. I looked into the possibilities of Adderall after speaking with a coworker who was prescribed Adderall several years ago and how he was able to continue his education due to his ability effectively concentrate.  After reading more about the symptoms associated with ADD it seemed to be a perfect match to my condition. This medication has reduced much of my public speaking inhibition; I find that I am more out going  in control  less critical of my self  and more inclined to participate in meeting and activities with minimum anxiety. My sexual drive is actually more enhanced. I am taking 5mg three times daily  but am still adjusting the dosage to alleviate side effects (inability to fall asleep at night) and achieve the maximum benefit. This has been an extremely positive life changing treatment for ADD.

ive alway knew ive had add  i never seek help for it until i failed out of community college and got accepted into a nursing school. Taking this medication help me a lot! i was actually making a and b  my world was finally coming together. I quit taking it when i found out i was pregnant  i had no withdraw symtoms  the only thing i notice was the add symptoms were back in full affect  it was a long yr and half. I went back on them about a little over yr ago and things are back to normal again. im so glad i finally got treatment  i just wish i would of done it sooner.
Adderall makes me very sleepy by half way through the day.  So i have to take more.

This drug has been a life saver for me. I am the typical ADD patient. My mind was racing in a hundred directions at once so I wasn't able to focus on anything. Addy helps me slow down and focus my brain enough to acutally complete the tasks I need to and to do it efficiently. Of course  in the beginning  I got a few side effects - dry mouth  appetite loss  diarrhea (dont take with coffee - TRUST ME)  and some insomnia. I also found myself craving cigarettes for some odd reason. I found that if I ate a meal before taking it in the morning that it almost eliminated most of them. After a few months your body will get used to it. I DO recommend that if you don't need it on the weekends that you don't take it. That way  your body won't be as likely to get addicted to it. I've been taking it for 4 years and I LOVE IT.

I have always been successful in life  but at extreme measures (which I thought were normal).  After finding out my older brother had ADHD I started looking into it. What I found was I was a dead on case. So it's been 2 weeks on Adderal and it has made my life easier on every level. Keep in mind it is a stimulant so follow the dose and be true to yourself and talk with your doctor about your reactions on the drug.  Sleep and appetite our at times and issue  but remember to eat frequently and don't take adderall near bed-time. The positives far out weigh anything else. You can actually go thru life and take things as they come.  It doesn't have to feel like you against the world when facing tasks  challenges etc.  A+ for this...

After trying a few different similar drugs I found that this worked best. With others I lost weight and felt sickly 24/7 (sick to my stomach  weak  lightheaded  dry mouth  just generally terrible). I started taking Adderall  initially in a VERY small dose and I noticed significant improvement. My doctor and I played with the dosage and I'm so happy with the result. The ONLY set back is feeling jittery every now and again. The best solution for that is just to make sure you're eating an appropriate amount. Not tons  but just spread out small meals and snacks and this won't pose a problem. Eating this way is way more healthy anyways. So now I can focus and feel very optimistic about getting things done everyday instead of dreading everything and having no energy  will or attention to finish things (school work). Great drug. I was very nervous to start taking it because I normally refuse all medicine... but this REALLY helped. Just be careful with dosage and eating.

I am ADHD and currently taking Strattera and I have to say with Adderall  I feel great and can focus much more and with Strattera  I am sick to my stomach everyday and my attention span still sucks.
For severe cases of ADHD  like myself  choose Adderall over Strattera.

I've been taking adderall for six years now  and I feel that without it I am far less likely to succeed. This medication has helped me tremedously in Middle and High school  as well as now in college.

I can concentrate and finish school work.  Ritalin didnt work but this makes me actually function like I should.
(Words of my 16 y.o. son with ADHD-Adderall means the difference between "A"s and "F"s for Him.  Affects appetite and sleep minimally.

This drug worked for me  but my husband began using it  and abusing it in order to stay up all night.  He is having severe mood swings (bordering bipolar disorder)  is paranoid  violent  irrational  and unpredictable.  He refuses to consider that it is the medication.  I have noticed a pattern with him;  each time he has a big project at work that he needs to put in a lot of overtime on  he takes excess amounts of the Adderall.  Each time this happens  we have huge and dangerous fights  often started over some minor incident.  For instance  he accused me of being an irresponsible wife  mother  parent because I did not walk the dog every day.  I'm seeing a therapist regarding how to deal with his changes in behavior and irrational and volitile temperment.

My son in law has become a different person while on adderall.  He is now hostile and violent hears things that are not there has become paranoid and driven.  He is arrogant and actually has manic episodes-  This was one of the nicest people I have ever known and this is a real tragedy. He is frightening and although he is under the treatment of a psychiatrist he is worse than before he went to this psychiatrist who prescribes and analyzes his childhood but does not deal with the present behavior. I am at a loss and fear for him and his family with small children

Totally kills sex drive. My dose (150 mg.) seems to wear off after approx. 8 hours. The positive effect is I am totally focused and able to concentrate better (for 8 hours)than when I was not taking the medication.

After a general symptom evaluation with my doctor  I was prescribed Adderal and it had an extremely limited effect on my symptoms.  On top of that  it had an adverse effect on my sexual performance and decreased my sex drive considerably.  This isn't to say it won't be effective for others  but it simply wasn't for me.

I have ADHD and believe that you can over come it with out medication and stop beving this propaganda the news is telling us  that we need to pop pills to pay attention.

I like that I can actually listen to a person and hear the whole conversation for the first time in my life. Adderall has also helped with my constant fidgeting. The thing I don't like about it though is that when I'm put into stressful situation I feel more anxiety than before I started the medication. And so far  even though I understand others better  I still find it challenging to process my own thoughts quickly and effectively. I have so many things popping into my head that its all just a jumble and I cant get my ideas out in a way that works for others. Maybe thats just because I have only been taking it for a few months or am not on the correct dosage yet. Dont let it defer you.
I have loved it.

Both my son and I have been on this medication. The medication did not work well on his ADHD  but it has worked miracles on my ADD. I am able to focus and complete tasks that for me would normaly go unfinished.
Attention Deficit without Hyperactivity

Adderall has completely changed my life!  I can finally think straight  focus & work to my full potential.  Life was frustrating before and now I do not doubt my abilities.  I highly recommend this!  It is evening helping me with my anxiety and i have finally beem able to get my weight to a healthy level.  Thank you Adderall XR!!!

Adderall XR has changed my life for the better. My whole life I kept thinking I had to be the biggest procrastinator in the world. I couldn't get anything done. Once I started on Adderall  not only did I feel a sense of calm  I was easily able to focus on tasks and have accomplished many things.  My only "side effect"

I've been taking Adderall for over ten years. It's Been extremely helpful in my everyday life.  I'm 23 now and still doing well on it.  The dosage has been tweaked over the years  but the end result is always the same  success.
My son has focus and has had a good experience with this medication.
20 mg xr has brought me back to life

I have been taking adderal for approximately two years now.  I worry that I will have a heart attack and that I am too dependent on this drug.  However  I'm too afraid of life off of it to alleviate that fear.
It has been a positive experience.

my teen-age daughter has been using it for six years and it turned her academic life around (as well concurrently seeing a significant weight drop). She has had no side effects. From hoping that she would graduate high school to her being a top student in college  it has been amazing.

As an adult female who has been taking this drug for years I would warn against it. It works well for me  although it took a long time to find the correct doseage-10mg  but I could NEVER imagine giving this to a child. I am on a low dose and I really feel side effects. Such as tenseness  irratation  lightheadedness  and I just am not myself when I take it. Although the drug does work  I would only recommend it for adults that know their bodies well and know how and when it works for them. It does have sexual side effects as well. For those looking for something for a child  look for something other than these meds  they are NOT for children!
Very unpleasant side effects. Mostly sexual in nature.
my son has twitching eyes since starting this medicine

ive tried so many medications for my adult adhd and thus far this one is the most effective. makes me not so hungry which is sad but after years of trying to find coping mechanisms  i found something that works.
Thought it was great.  Made my work day so much easier.

I have adult ADD...no H!!!This drug allows me to complete tasks and do much more in a day than ever before. I sleep better  having a fuller day. My energy has allows been sluggish as well as my mind...this takes care of both problems. I am extremely happy with the new life it has given me

I have been on this medication for a year and six month's and it has work really well.I can now sit in class and do my work before i counld not even get to school.I'm a striaght A student now and just grad. to be a X-ray Tech.
excited  it works wonders

I have been taking this drug for a little over a year and I have went from not being able to sit still and finish projects  and or holding a job to becoming a top sales producer holding my position there for a little over a year. This drug has helped me greatly.

my mothers was on this medication she ended up being hopitalized for mental status change she went on shopping sprees bought 10 of everything didnt pay her biills got evicted from her home this medication made my mothers and my familys life a nitemare shes now on a new med and is already doing so much better i saved her apt and she is getting out of the hospital soon
My son has responded great to this medication. He did have a problem sleeping for the first few weeks of taking the medication. He has no problems with tics like he has with other meds.
Not only was no change n behavior noted  bu my son developed mild tics. I strongly caution any parent from giving this drug to any child.

I loath adderall. For whatever reason  it worked for about 6 weeks  and then my moods started getting weird. After taking Adderall for 2 months  I had several severe panic attacks. I never had a panic attack previously. I'd much rather be on ritalin.
I was prescribed this medication to help alleviate my anxiety and to help control my racing thoughts. Overall  the drug worked alright.

As an accomplished woman  I didn't know I had ADD until after middle age when increasing I couldn't complete tasks. Depression and loss of self esteem set in but once diagnosed and on medication I was able to slow down  concentrate and finish jobs. I never realized how my mind raced from subject to subject until I was on medication - 4 years now.

It was a wonder for me! I had spent tons of money in medical bills and doctors visits only to realize that what I was battleing with was adult ADHD. This hadn't been as much of a problem for me when I was younger until my job had changed drastically and I lost my ability to focus. Work was terrible and my performance was slipping which made me seem deppressed. Once I started on the medication  it has been like I am a different person. I don't give up on tasks  I complete them  I listen to people when they talk to me and overall I accomplish the goals I set forth each day. Thank God my doctor finally listened when others did not.
medication has been effective so far with the weight loss i want to acheive
